[[Serhiy Haidai]], Governor of [[Luhansk Oblast]], says that Russian [[shell (projectile)|shelling]] continues across the oblast and that the 8,000 residents of [[Sievierodonetsk]] are on the verge of a "humanitarian catastrophe". [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/ukrainian-official-warns-catastrophe-captured-city-86437900 (ABC News)]

Former [[Prime Minister of Japan]] [[Shinzo Abe]] is shot in the back while giving a speech in [[Nara, Nara|Nara]], [[Kansai region]], [[Japan]], and later dies from his wounds. Tetsuya Yamagami, a 41-year-old [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force|navy]] veteran, is arrested for the [[assassination]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-62089486 (BBC News)]

Seven teenagers are killed and two others injured after government forces airstrike a village in [[Savanes Region, Togo|Savanes Region]], [[Togo]]. Togolese authorities say that they mistook the teenagers for [[jihadists]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/togos-army-says-civilians-were-killed-by-airstrike-mistaken-jihadists-2022-07-14/ (Reuters)]

A [[Russian Air Force|Russian]] [[airstrike]] on an apartment complex in [[Chasiv Yar]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], kills at least 47 people and leaves nine others injured. [https://news.sky.com/story/ukraine-war-at-least-15-killed-in-russian-strike-on-block-of-flats-in-donetsk-12649330 (Sky News)]

Six people are killed and eight others are wounded in a [[mass shooting]] at a party in [[León, Guanajuato]], [[Mexico]]. [https://www.infobae.com/america/agencias/2022/07/10/masacre-en-estado-mexicano-de-guanajuato-deja-al-menos-6-muertos-3/ (Infobae)]

*Three civilians are killed and 31 others are injured in a Russian [[shell (projectile)|shelling]] of [[Kharkiv]]. The city's mayor says that the latest shelling has targeted civilian infrastructure. [https://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/russian-bombardment-kills-3-in-ukraine-s-second-city-kharkiv/47742224 (SwissInfo)]

The Russian-appointed military-civilian administration leader of [[Velykyi Burluk]] in [[Kharkiv Oblast]], Yevgeny Yunakov, is [[assassination|assassinated]] in a [[car bomb]]ing. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/leader-russian-occupied-ukrainian-town-killed-by-car-bomb-tass-2022-07-11/ (Reuters)]

[[Ukrainian Ground Forces]] recapture the town of Ivanivka in [[Kherson Oblast]] after launching a counter-offensive against [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-says-it-recaptured-village-occupied-kherson-region-2022-07-11/ (Reuters)]

The [[National Army of Colombia|Colombian Army]] launches an [[airstrike]] on a [[FARC dissidents]]' camp in the [[Caquetá Department]], killing ten people. Iván Mordisco, one of the group's leaders, was at the scene during the strike; his fate is unknown. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-62120054 (BBC News)]

A massive explosion occurs in the city of [[Nova Kakhovka]] after [[Ukrainian forces]] destroy a Russian [[arms depot]]. Russian state news agency [[TASS]] claims that a market, hospital, and civilian housing were also damaged, and that multiple civilians were killed. Russian [[22nd Army Corps (Russian Federation)|22nd Army Corps]] general Artem Nasbulin is allegedly among the dead. [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2022/07/11/7357612/ (''Ukrayinska Pravda'')] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-prepares-fresh-russian-assault-west-braces-worsening-energy-crisis-2022-07-12/ (Reuters)] [https://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2022/07/12/ukraine-russia-war-kherson-attack-general-killed/8551657623145/ (UPI)]

[[National Security Advisor (United States)|U.S. National Security Advisor]] [[Jake Sullivan]] claims that [[Iran]] will provide [[Russia]] with hundreds of drones along with the necessary training for their use. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2022/07/11/iran-drones-russia-ukraine/ (''The Washington Post'')]

Leaked military reports indicate that a United Kingdom [[Special Air Service]] (SAS) unit [[unlawfully killed]] at least 54 people during a six-month tour. [https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-62083196 (BBC News)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/12/bbc-probe-suggests-afghanistan-war-crimes-by-uk-special-forces (Al Jazeera)]

The [[United States]] confirms that it has killed the leader of the [[Islamic State]]'s Syrian branch, Maher al-Agal, in a [[drone strike]] in northwestern [[Syria]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/isis-leader-syria-killed-us-strike-us-officials-say-2022-07-12/ (Reuters)]

Seven people are killed when suspected [[Islamist]]s attack the city of [[Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo|Beni]], [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/suspected-islamists-kill-seven-east-congo-city-beni-2022-07-13/ (Reuters)]

Heavy [[Russia]]n [[shell (projectile)|shelling]] is reported in [[Bakhmut]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], with at least one person killed and five others injured in the largely evacuated town. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/jul/13/bakhmut-bombarded-in-wake-of-ukraine-attack-on-russian-air-defences (''The Guardian'')]

At least 23 civilians are killed and more than 100 others are injured by three [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] missile strikes in [[Vinnytsia]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-62163071 (BBC News)]

At least 12 civilians are killed by [[Islamic extremism|Islamic extremist]] gunmen during an attack against two villages in northern [[Togo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/least-12-killed-raids-northern-togo-villages-2022-07-15/ (Reuters)]

Three civilians and three security forces are killed in an attack by [[militant]]s at a checkpoint near [[Bamako]], [[Mali]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/six-killed-rare-attack-near-malian-capital-2022-07-16 (Reuters)]

At least three civilians are killed and 15 others are injured in [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[cruise missile]] strikes on the city of [[Dnipro]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/three-killed-15-injured-missile-strikes-ukraine-city-dnipro-official-says-2022-07-15/ (Reuters)]

Three civilians, two [[gendarme]]s and one policeman are killed as gunmen attack a [[Security checkpoint|checkpoint]] in [[Koulikoro]], [[Mali]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/16/six-people-killed-in-rare-attack-near-malian-capital-bamako (Al Jazeera)]

Nine [[Balochistan Liberation Army]] [[Separatism|separatist]] [[Insurgency|insurgents]] are killed during a gunfight with the [[Pakistan Army]] in [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], after the group kidnapped and killed a colonel. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-crime-islamabad-1888405d4b941ab5a672a0ea82b4c8b7 (AP)]

65 people are killed and 150 are wounded in tribal clashes in [[Blue Nile (state)|Blue Nile]], [[Sudan]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/17/sudan-blue-nile-state-death-toll-tribal-clashes-soars (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] missiles strike the city of [[Chuhuiv]] in [[Kharkiv Oblast]], killing three civilians and injuring three others, while more than 50 [[BM-21 Grad|Grad]] rockets hit the city of [[Nikopol, Ukraine|Nikopol]] in [[Dnipropetrovsk Oblast]], killing two people. The missile strikes come after Russian defence minister [[Sergei Shoigu]] ordered the military to expand operations in [[Ukraine]] in order to "protect the [[Donbas]]".  [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/warning-sirens-sound-ukraines-capital-russia-steps-up-bombardment-2022-07-16/ (Reuters)]

The president of [[Energoatom]], the Ukrainian nuclear energy authority, accuses Russian forces of using the [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]] to store weapons and shell the surrounding area. [https://www.thejournal.ie/russia-shelling-from-ukraine-nuclear-plant-5818580-Jul2022/ (''The Journal.ie'')]

[[Israel]] launches more than a dozen missiles against two [[Hamas]] targets in the [[Gaza Strip]], following a number of [[Palestinian rocket attacks on Israel|rockets fired]] overnight from Gaza into Israel, causing severe damage. No casualties were reported and no civilian structures were targeted or hit. [https://www.voanews.com/a/israel-launches-attack-on-gaza/6661350.html (Voice of America)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/16/israel-launches-air-raid-on-gaza-after-rocket-launches (Al Jazeera)]

Ten people are killed and two others are injured when gunmen attack civilians in [[Nduga Regency]], [[Highland Papua]], [[Indonesia]]. The [[separatist]] [[West Papua National Liberation Army]] is blamed for the attack. [https://apnews.com/article/indonesia-8557eab22bda1e03bd3004d2703f31b9 (AP)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[shell (projectile)|shelling]] kills six civilians in [[Toretsk]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], as [[Ukraine]] says that Russia appears to be preparing for a new ground offensive near [[Sloviansk]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-62207922 (BBC News)]

Russia announces {{ill|Anton Koltsov|ru|Кольцов, Антон Викторович}}, former Prime Minister of [[Vologda Oblast]], as the new Prime Minister in Zaporizhzhia Military-Civilian Administration. His appointment probably took place some days earlier.<ref>[https://euromaidanpress.com/2022/07/19/russia-appoints-ex-first-deputy-of-vologda-region-anton-koltsov-as-sham-council-head-of-zaporizhzhia-oblast/ (Euromaidan Press)]</ref>

Iraqi government and regional authorities claim that [[Turkish Armed Forces]] fired four missiles at a resort in the [[Zakho District]] of [[Kurdistan Region]] in [[Iraq]], killing eight Iraqi tourists and injuring 23 others. [https://apnews.com/article/middle-east-turkey-iraq-baghdad-7488a761ef3fc1115a2307701d4be50c (AP)]

[[Russian Foreign Minister]] [[Sergey Lavrov]] says that his country's military goals are no longer limited to the [[Donbas]] region and have expanded to also include "the [[Kherson region]], the [[Zaporizhzhia region]] and a number of other territories". [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/20/lavrov-says-russia-military-goals-not-focused-only-on-donbas (Al Jazeera)]

[[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] raids [[Yeed]] and Aato in [[Bakool]], [[Somalia]], near the [[Ethiopia–Somalia relations|Ethiopian border]]. Fourteen [[Ethiopia]]n police officers and three civilians are killed. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/somalias-al-shabaab-group-rare-attack-near-ethiopia-border-2022-07-21/ (Reuters)] [https://www.voanews.com/a/al-shabab-attacks-somali-towns-close-to-ethiopian-border-/6667670.html (VOA)]

An [[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli]] [[airstrike]] kills three [[Syrian soldier]]s, injures seven others and destroys an [[Iran]]ian weapons depot near [[Damascus]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/middle-east/20220722-israeli-strike-kills-three-syrian-soldiers-near-damascus-syrian-ministry (AFP via France 24)]

Russia launches five airstrikes on [[Jisr ash-Shughur]], killing seven people, including four children. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/jul/22/russian-airstrike-on-rebel-held-region-in-idlib-syria-kills-seven-people (''The Guardian'')]
Thirteen people are killed as fighting occurs in [[Tripoli, Libya|Tripoli]], [[Libya]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/reports-dead-libya-clashes-strike-capital-2022-07-22/ (Reuters)]

The [[Macina Liberation Front]] launches an attack on [[Mali]]'s largest military base in [[Bamako]]. One soldier and six of the attackers are killed. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/heavy-gunfire-heard-main-mali-military-base-2022-07-22/ (Reuters)]

Two [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[Kalibr]] [[cruise missile]]s hit [[Odesa]]'s [[Port of Odessa|port]] less than a day after a deal to export grain from Ukraine was signed between Russia and Ukraine. Initial reports indicate no related infrastructure damage. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-kyiv-global-trade-c1a004db6eef64d2aea48990a3080017 (AP)]

A Russian cruise missile attack destroys a [[railway station]] in [[Kirovohrad Oblast]], killing three people and injuring several others. [https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20220723-live-washington-announces-270-million-in-military-aid-to-ukraine (France 24)]

Two [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] men are killed and 12 others are injured during a raid by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in [[Nablus]], [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/24/two-palestinians-killed-in-israeli-raid-on-occupied-west-bank (Al Jazeera)]

Iran's [[Supreme National Security Council]] announces that their [[Ministry of Intelligence (Iran)|intelligence ministry]] has arrested an [[Israel]]i cell hours before they were to conduct attacks on several sites in [[Isfahan]], including a major [[Nuclear program of Iran|nuclear facility]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/24/iran-says-suspected-israel-cell-members-planning-attack-arrested (Al Jazeera)]

Head of the [[Investigative Committee of Russia]], [[Alexander Bastrykin]], says that Russia has [[criminal charge|charged]] 92 members of the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine]] with "crimes against the peace and security of humanity", with a further 96 people being wanted. There are also 1,300 ongoing criminal investigations. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-62287502 (BBC News)]

At least six people are killed in a [[mass shooting]] at a [[rehab center]] in [[Tlaquepaque]], [[Jalisco]], [[Mexico]]. [https://www.infobae.com/america/agencias/2022/07/25/matan-a-seis-personas-en-ataque-a-centro-de-rehabilitacion-en-oeste-de-mexico/ (Infobae)]

[[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] strike the strategic [[Antonivka Road Bridge]] in [[Kherson Oblast]] using its [[M142 HIMARS]] missile system, causing severe damage to the bridge and preventing vehicles from crossing. Ukraine also claims to have destroyed a Russian [[ammunition dump|ammunition depot]], artillery and other military equipment in the region, killing 51 [[Russian Ground Forces|Russian troops]]. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-moscow-6a927f75ac4fdb854999d65139b9bd80 (AP)]

[[Ukraine]] says that [[Russia]] has launched [[cruise missile]] strikes at targets along its [[Black Sea]] coast, including at [[Odesa]] and [[Mykolaiv]] port infrastructure. [https://www.voanews.com/a/ukraine-says-russian-strikes-hit-areas-along-black-sea/6673997.html (Voice of America)]

Fifteen people are killed and 50 others are injured as [[MONUSCO|UN peacekeepers]] open fire at an anti-[[United Nations]] protest in [[Goma]], [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/26/un-peacekeepers-troops-shoot-two-protesters-dead-in-goma-drc (Al Jazeera)]

Three UN peacekeepers and seven civilians are killed during an attack on a [[MONUSCO]] base by protesters in [[Butembo]], Democratic Republic of the Congo. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/26/un-peacekeepers-troops-shoot-two-protesters-dead-in-goma-drc (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russia]] captures the [[Vuhlehirska Power Station]], [[Ukraine]]'s second largest power plant, near the city of [[Svitlodarsk]], [[Donetsk Oblast]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-captures-power-station-redeploys-troops-toward-southern-ukraine-2022-07-27/ (Reuters)]

Russia says that it has destroyed more than 100 [[M142 HIMARS]] missiles in an [[airstrike]] on [[Dnipro]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-says-its-strike-july-24-destroyed-100-himars-missiles-2022-07-27/ (Reuters)]

Four protesters are killed when a soldier shoots an electric cable that falls on them in [[Uvira]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. They were protesting the ineffectiveness of the [[MONUSCO]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/four-dead-anti-un-protests-spread-congo-2022-07-27/ (Reuters)]

The [[Burundi Human Rights Initiative]] (BHRI) accuses [[Burundi]] of sending troops into the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) to fight the RED-Tabara, a Burundian armed opposition group. The BHRI also accuses Burundi of supporting armed groups that oppose the DRC. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/27/rights-group-concerned-about-burundis-secret-mission-in-drc (Al Jazeera)]

Eleven people, including a [[Federal Government of Somalia|government]] official, are killed by an [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[suicide bombing]] at the entrance to a government building in [[Merca]], [[Lower Shabelle]], [[Somalia]]. [https://apnews.com/article/africa-bombings-somalia-suicide-mogadishu-2d51274f2bdd3b3220c8f91d7ce00607 (AP)]

Ukrainian [[president of Ukraine|presidential]] advisor [[Oleksiy Arestovych]] says that an [[military operation|operation]] to recapture the [[Kherson Oblast]] has started. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2022/jul/28/russia-ukraine-war-live-news-kyiv-region-hit-by-rocket-attack-governor-says-fight-to-liberate-kherson-has-begun-ukraine-claims (''The Guardian'')]

Russian forces shell [[Bakhmut]] in [[Donetsk Oblast]] with the [[BM-27 Uragan]] [[Multiple rocket launcher|MLRS]], killing three civilians and injuring three others. Six apartment blocks and six detached houses are also destroyed or damaged. [https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-ato/3539035-russians-strike-bakhmut-with-uragan-mlrs-three-civilians-killed.html (Ukrinform)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] in [[Belarus]] launch 25 [[ballistic missile]]s into northern Ukraine. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/jul/28/russian-forces-fire-barrage-missiles-northern-ukraine-from-belarus (''The Guardian'')]

Russia launches [[cruise missile]] strikes from the [[Black Sea]] on the [[Kyiv Oblast]] for the first time in weeks, with missiles striking [[Bucha, Kyiv Oblast|Bucha]], [[Lyutizh]], and [[Vyshhorod]]. At least fifteen people, including five civilians, are injured, according to Kyiv governor [[Oleksiy Kuleba]]. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-kyiv-e85d2709f3f6be7eff1b8d278e4d2be9 (AP)] [https://www.axios.com/2022/07/28/russia-strike-kyiv-kherson-counteroffensive (''Axios'')]

Russian missiles strike [[Kropyvnytskyi]], damaging facilities owned by Kropyvnytskyi Flight Academy and [[Air Urga]]. Five people are killed and 25 others are injured. [https://news.yahoo.com/rocket-shelling-kropyvnytskyi-5-dead-123518473.html (Yahoo! News)]

At least 17 people are killed and 40 others are injured in skirmishes between groups of pro-[[Bashar al-Assad|Assad]] and anti-[[government of Syria|government]] residents in [[As Suwayda]], [[Syria]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/28/at-least-17-dead-in-rare-clashes-in-syrias-sweida (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russia]] and the [[Donetsk People's Republic]] (DPR) say that 53 people were killed and 75 others injured after [[shell (projectile)|shelling]] hit a prison holding Ukrainian [[prisoners of war]] in the DPR-controlled city of [[Olenivka, Kalmiuske Raion|Olenivka]], [[Donetsk Oblast]]. Russia and [[Ukraine]] accuse each other of carrying out the strike. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-donetsk-prisoners-of-war-30e2e205bab0081c576b944baae82a61 (AP)]

A video emerges on [[social media]] of a [[Russian Ground Forces|Russian soldier]] [[castration|castrating]] a Ukrainian prisoner of war in the town of [[Sievierodonetsk]], Donetsk Oblast. The video has not been independently verified. The [[Government of Ukraine|Ukrainian government]] voices outrage over the incident and vows retaliation against the perpetrators. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-62344358 (BBC News)] [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2022/07/29/ukrainian-pow-castrated-russian-troops-horrifying-footage/ (''The Telegraph'')] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/jul/29/video-appears-to-show-russian-soldier-castrating-ukrainian-prisoner (''The Guardian'')] [https://news.sky.com/story/footage-appears-to-show-ukrainian-prisoner-of-war-being-castrated-by-russian-soldiers-12661176 (Sky News)]

A Russian strike kills five civilians and injures seven others at a bus stop in [[Mykolaiv]], according to [[Governor of Mykolaiv Oblast|regional governor]] [[Vitaliy Kim]]. [https://www.barrons.com/news/russian-strikes-kill-4-at-bus-stop-in-south-ukraine-governor-01659082507 (AFP News via ''Barron's'')]

A 16-year-old [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] affiliated with [[Fatah]] is killed during clashes with [[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in [[Al-Mughayyir, Ramallah|Al-Mughayyir]], near [[Ramallah]]. [https://www.albawaba.com/news/israeli-forces-shoot-dead-youth-palestinian-cold-blood-1485582 (''Al Bawaba'')] [https://www.timesofisrael.com/palestinian-teen-said-killed-in-clashes-with-idf-northeast-of-ramallah/ (''Times of Israel'')]

Two people are killed and 11 are injured during a hand grenade attack at a [[cricket]] game in [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/afghanistan-islamic-state-group-sports-taliban-cricket-26ce703e726a1076a9d4f48565775217 (AP)]

Six [[Balochistan Liberation Army]] [[separatist]]s and a [[Pakistan Army|Pakistani soldier]] are killed during clashes in [[Kech District]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-islamabad-d39f9b6e40561da4861e24548212fb15 (AP)]

At least 125 people are injured when supporters of [[Shia]] cleric [[Muqtada al-Sadr]] storm the [[Council of Representatives of Iraq|parliament]] in [[Baghdad]]'s [[Green Zone]]. [https://metro.co.uk/2022/07/30/iraq-on-the-brink-of-chaos-after-protestors-storm-baghdad-parliament-17097084/ (''Metro'')]

One person is wounded in an [[assassination]] attempt on [[President of Guatemala]] [[Alejandro Giammattei]]. The president is unharmed. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/wounded-attack-army-guarding-guatemala-president-87685959 (ABC)]
A [[Russia]]n missile strike on [[Mykolaiv]] in [[Kherson Oblast]], kills [[Nibulon]] owner [[Oleksiy Vadaturskyi]] and his wife. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-62367356 (BBC News)]

A [[UCAV|drone]] strikes Russia's [[Black Sea Fleet]] headquarters, injuring five people, according to the mayor of [[Sevastopol]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2022/jul/31/russia-ukraine-war-drone-hits-russias-black-sea-fleet-hq-zelenskiy-urges-civilians-to-leave-donetsk-latest-updates (''The Guardian'')]

[[Kosovo Police]] close two border crossings in [[North Kosovo]] after [[Kosovo Serbs|local Serbs]] blocked roads and fired shots at police to protest an order to switch [[Vehicle registration plates of Serbia|Serbian car license plates]] to [[Vehicle registration plates of Kosovo|Kosovan ones]] within two months. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/kosovo-closes-two-border-crossings-after-local-serbs-block-roads-2022-07-31/ (Reuters)]

A member of the [[Taliban]] is killed during clashes with [[Iran]]ian border guards on the [[Afghanistan–Iran border]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/one-dead-clashes-between-taliban-iran-border-forces-afghan-police-official-2022-07-31/ (Reuters)]

A [[United States|U.S.]] [[drone warfare|drone strike]] in [[Kabul]] kills [[Ayman al-Zawahiri]], [[al-Qaeda|al-Qaeda's]] leader since the [[Killing of Osama bin Laden|death of Osama bin Laden]] in 2011. The airstrike is also the first [[United States Armed Forces|U.S. military]] action in [[Afghanistan]] following the [[2021 Taliban offensive|Taliban's takeover of Afghanistan]] last year. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2022/08/01/zawahiri-al-qaeda-killed/ (''The Washington Post'')] [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-62387167 (BBC News)]

Shelling and heavy gunfire is reported near two villages by [[Republic of Artsakh|Artsakh]] authorities in [[Nagorno-Karabakh]]. The reports are denied by [[Azerbaijan]] and [[Russian forces]] in the region. [https://jam-news.net/shelling-in-karabakh-and-gunfire-at-the-armenian-azerbaijani-border-whats-happening-opinions-from-yerevan/ (JAM news)]

Three people evacuating in a minibus are killed by [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] shelling near [[Kherson Oblast]], according to [[Ukraine]]'s [[Operational Command South]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2022/aug/02/russia-ukraine-war-live-news-3-killed-in-minibus-evacuating-kherson-officials-say-kyiv-investigating-752-cases-of-treason?page=with:block-62e8a48b8f08af33ff4a5796#block-62e8a48b8f08af33ff4a5796 (''The Guardian'')]

Two [[Taliban]] policemen and three [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|Islamic State]] gunmen are killed during a gunbattle at a hideout in [[Kabul]]. Four other officers are wounded. [https://gandhara.rferl.org/a/afghanistan-gunbattle-taliban-islamic-state-khorasan/31973149.html (Gandhara)]

Reignited clashes in the disputed [[Nagorno-Karabakh]] region between [[Armenia]] and [[Azerbaijan]] kill three soldiers and injure fourteen others. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/troops-azerbaijan-nagorno-karabakh-clash-killed-87880001 (ABC News)]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] strike kills eight civilians and injures four others, at a bus stop in [[Toretsk]], according to regional governor [[Pavlo Kyrylenko]]. [https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-ato/3543369-russians-fire-at-crowded-bus-stop-in-toretsk-eight-dead-three-children-among-injured.html (Ukrinform)]

[[Amnesty International]] releases a report alleging [[Ukrainian forces]] have endangered civilians by establishing bases and operating weapons systems in residential areas, schools, hospitals, violating international humanitarian law as they turn civilian objects into military targets. [https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2022/08/ukraine-ukrainian-fighting-tactics-endanger-civilians (Amnesty International)]

Thirteen people, including nine civilians, are killed in a militant attack in [[Bam Province|Bam]], [[Burkina Faso]]; thirty-four [[insurgent]]s are also killed. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/militants-kill-13-attack-burkina-faso-counter-terrorism-operation-2022-08-05/ (Reuters)]

Ukraine's nuclear agency [[Energoatom]] says that Russian rockets have caused damage to the [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]], including a nitrogen-oxygen unit and a high-voltage power line. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-62432873 (BBC News)]

[[Volodymyr Saldo]], the head of the Russian occupational administration in [[Kherson Oblast]], is hospitalized, with former [[Federal Security Service|FSB]] officer Sergei Eliseev taking over his post temporarily. [https://www.newsweek.com/volodymyr-saldo-kherson-hospital-ukraine-counteroffensive-war-1731212 (''Newsweek'')]

[[Israel]] launches a series of airstrikes in the [[Gaza Strip]], including a number against [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Palestinian Islamic Jihad]]'s facilities. Ten people are killed and 55 others are wounded, including PIJ military leader [[Tayseer Jabari]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/8/5/israel-hits-gaza-with-air-strikes-as-tensions-escalate (Al Jazeera)]

Eight people are killed and 18 others are injured when a bomb hidden in a cart explodes near a [[Shia Islam in Afghanistan|Shiite]] [[mosque]] in [[Kabul]]. The [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|Islamic State]] claims responsibility for the attack. [https://english.alarabiya.net/amp/News/world/2022/08/05/Blast-hits-Afghanistan-capital-Kabul-Report (Al Arabiya)]

The [[Movement of Democratic Forces of Casamance]] signs a peace deal with the [[government of Senegal]], pledging to lay down its arms in order to work towards a permanent solution. [https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-africa-61887107?ns_mchannel=social&ns_source=twitter&ns_campaign=bbc_live&ns_linkname=62ec92a921e03625cb4a3180%26Senegal%20signs%20peace%20deal%20with%20separatist%20rebels%262022-08-05T07%3A32%3A02.877Z&ns_fee=0&pinned_post_locator=urn:asset:17dda0f3-f418-490d-be75-04dfd2acba78&pinned_post_asset_id=62ec92a921e03625cb4a3180&pinned_post_type=share (BBC News)]

[[Israel]] launches airstrikes for the second day in the [[Gaza Strip]], killing 14 people and injuring several others. Nineteen [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Palestinian Islamic Jihad]] members are also arrested in the [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2022/8/6/updates-19-pij-members-arrested-as-israel-continues-gaza-raids (Al Jazeera)]

[[Israel]] and the [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]] agree to a ceasefire agreement for the [[Gaza Strip]]. [https://www.cnn.com/2022/08/07/middleeast/israel-gaza-islamic-jihad-ceasefire-intl/index.html (CNN)]

Forty-two soldiers and four civilians are killed during an attack near the town of [[Tessit]] by [[Islamic State in the Greater Sahara]] gunmen. Twenty-two other soldiers are wounded, and 37 of the attackers are also killed. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/8/11/mali-says-soldier-death-toll-has-risen-to-42-in-tessit-attack (Al Jazeera)]

Twenty people are killed when suspected [[Islamic terrorism|Islamists]] attack two villages in [[Ituri]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/suspected-islamists-kill-20-east-congo-village-attacks-2022-08-07/ (Reuters)]

Senior [[Pakistani Taliban]] [[militant]] [[Omar Khalid Khorasani]] and three other militants are killed as their vehicle hit a [[Improvised explosive device|roadside bomb]] in [[Paktika Province]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/8/8/top-pakistan-taliban-leader-killed-in-afghanistan-roadside-attack (Al Jazeera)]

The government of [[Chad]] and more than 30 rebel and opposition factions sign a peace agreement at talks in [[Doha]], [[Qatar]]. However, the main rebel group [[Front for Change and Concord in Chad]] rejects the agreement, saying that negotiators had not listened to their demands, which included the release of [[political prisoner]]s. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/chad-rebels-sign-peace-deal-2022-08-08/ (Reuters)]

Multiple explosions are reported at a [[Russian military]] air base near [[Novofedorivka]] in western [[Crimea]]. At least one person is killed and six others are injured, according to [[Council of Ministers of Crimea|Crimean authorities]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/loud-explosions-heard-near-russian-military-airbase-crimea-witnesses-2022-08-09/ (Reuters)] [https://news.sky.com/story/ukraine-war-one-dead-as-russia-insists-explosions-at-crimea-air-base-caused-by-detonation-of-ammunition-not-attack-12669385 (Sky News)]

Ibrahim al-Nabulsi, local head of the [[al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades]], and two other people are killed during a raid by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in [[Nablus]]. At least 40 others are injured. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-62476488 (BBC News)]

Four [[Pakistan Army|Pakistani soldiers]] are killed in a [[Suicide attack|suicide bombing]] in [[Mir Ali, Pakistan|Mir Ali]], [[North Waziristan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/suicide-attack-kills-four-pakistani-soldiers-army-2022-08-09/ (Reuters)]

Fifteen [[Burkina Faso Armed Forces|troops]] are killed when their vehicle hits a [[Improvised explosive device|roadside bomb]] in [[Bam Province]], [[Burkina Faso]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/roadside-bomb-kills-15-soldiers-northern-burkina-faso-2022-08-09/ (Reuters)]

Four civilians and a [[Cameroon Armed Forces|soldier]] are killed, and another civilian is wounded, during three separate attacks by [[Boko Haram]] gunmen in the [[Far North Region, Cameroon|Far North Region]], [[Cameroon]]. [https://english.news.cn/20220810/ec46d1026958463b9b42f873ccb655d7/c.html (Xinhua)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] install [[anti-aircraft warfare|air defence systems]] at the [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]] in [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]], [[Ukraine]], according to the head of [[Moscow]]-appointed administration of [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]] [[Yevhen Balytskyi]]. [https://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/world/russia-installs-air-defense-systems-at-zaporiyia-nuclear-power-plant/ar-AA10u0SR (MSN)]

A [[Russia]]n missile strike in [[Nikopol Raion]], [[Dnipropetrovsk Oblast]], kills at least 13 civilians and injures 11 others. [https://www.nytimes.com/live/2022/08/10/world/ukraine-russia-news-war (''The New York Times'')]

[[Drug cartel|Cartel]] gunmen in [[Mexico]] burn down dozens of stores and block streets with burning cars in the states of [[Jalisco]] and [[Guanajuato]] in response to arrests of cartel figures by the [[National Guard (Mexico)|National Guard]]. [https://apnews.com/article/mexico-caribbean-arrests-social-media-eb610956da00c324ba718fc49fafea40 (AP)]

At least ten [[Shell (projectile)|shells]] hit the [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]] with both [[Russia]] and [[Ukraine]] blaming each other for the attack, which damaged an office building and the plant's [[fire station]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-62505815 (BBC News)]

Three [[Indian Army|soldiers]] are killed in an attack at a [[military base]] in [[Rajouri]], [[Jammu and Kashmir (union territory)|Jammu and Kashmir]], [[India]]. Two of the attackers are killed in the ensuing [[shootout]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/india/militants-attack-indian-army-post-kashmir-3-soldiers-2-attackers-die-shootout-2022-08-11/ (Reuters)]

Cleric [[Rahimullah Haqqani]] is killed by a [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] at a [[seminary]] in [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|IS-KP]] claims responsibility for the killing. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/8/11/taliban-say-bombing-kills-prominent-afghan-cleric-in-kabul (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/top-taliban-cleric-killed-in-kabul-suicide-blast-by-islamic-state/ (''The Times of Israel'')]

Five people are killed and 100 others injured as security forces clashes with protesters demanding presidential election be held in November in [[Somaliland]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/least-five-people-killed-100-hurt-somaliland-protests-2022-08-12/ (Reuters)]

The [[Federal Ministry of Defence (Germany)|German defence ministry]] suspends [[Bundeswehr|its military]]'s [[aerial reconnaissance]] and [[Military transport aircraft|transport]] operations in [[Mali]] after the [[government of Mali]] denied the departure of one of their flights. [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-08-12/germany-suspends-military-mission-in-mali-after-troops-blocked#xj4y7vzkg (Bloomberg News)]

Eight people are killed and five others injured in a [[prison riot]] and shootings at a food shop and a pizzeria in [[Ciudad Juárez]], [[Chihuahua (state)|Chihuahua]]. Two other premises are set on fire. [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/crime/drug-traffickers-terrorize-mexico-e2-80-99s-ciudad-ju-c3-a1rez-shootings-molotov-cocktails-and-murder/ar-AA10AKG4 (MSN)] [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/mexico-border-violence-juarez-deaths-el-chapo-sinaloa-cartel/ (CBS News)]

At least a dozen vehicles are burned and several streets are blocked in the state of [[Baja California]], mainly in the cities of [[Tijuana]], [[Mexicali]] and [[Ensenada, Baja California|Ensenada]]. This is the fourth major incident in the last week where arson and blocked streets have been reported. [https://www.10news.com/news/local-news/east-county-news/fire-breaks-out-at-el-cajon-home-while-owners-are-out-of-town (KGTV)]

[[Anglo-Indian people|Anglo-Indian]] writer [[Salman Rushdie]] is attacked at a public event in [[Chautauqua, New York]], [[United States]], sustaining multiple stab wounds to the neck and abdomen. The suspect is arrested by [[New York State Police]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/us/author-salman-rushdie-attacked-stage-event-new-york-sky-news-2022-08-12/ (Reuters)] [https://apnews.com/article/salman-rushdie-attacked-9eae99aea82cb0d39628851ecd42227a (AP)]

[[Russia]] says that it has captured the village of [[Pisky, Pokrovsk Raion|Pisky]], in [[Donetsk Oblast]], while [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] say that they have destroyed a bridge in [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Russian-occupied]] [[Kherson Oblast]]. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-fires-donetsk-ef079e9648ceb5dab4a4fd3bc0954406 (AP)]

Establishment of pro-Russian [[Governor of Mykolaiv Oblast|Mykolaiv military–civilian administration]] with seat in [[Snihurivka]] is announced, {{ill|Yuri Barbashov|pl|Jurij Barbaszow}} becomes its head. It probably began functioning some days earlier. [https://360tv.ru/news/ukrainian-crisis/snigirevka-nikolaevskoj-oblasti-primet-uchastie-v-referendume-o-prisoedinenii-k-rossii/ (360tv.ru)]

A [[Palestinian]] gunman opens fire inside a bus in [[Old City of Jerusalem|Jerusalem's Old City]], injuring eight people, two of them critically. [[Israeli police]] later raid the [[Silwan]] neighborhood, where the suspect lived, and arrest him. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/8/14/several-israelis-wounded-in-attack-on-jerusalem-bus (Al Jazeera)] [https://apnews.com/article/middle-east-jerusalem-israel-west-bank-militant-groups-b39119f3f5d11747b54435b76555fcf5 (AP)]

Five people are killed and 26 others are injured by an explosion in [[Guayaquil]], [[Ecuador]]. The [[government of Ecuador|government]] blames [[organized crime]] groups. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-62544570 (BBC News)]

[[France]] formally ends its [[Interventionism (politics)|military intervention]] in [[Mali]] after withdrawing its last remaining troops from a military base in [[Gao]]. The base was handed over to [[Malian Armed Forces]] before the French forces crossed into neighbouring [[Niger]]. [https://www.ecofinagency.com/public-management/1608-43790-france-withdraws-the-last-barkhane-unit-from-mali (Ecofin Agency)]

Four [[Russia]]n [[Wagner Group]] [[paramilitaries]] are killed during an ambush by [[Jama'at Nasr al-Islam wal Muslimin]] militants in [[Bandiagara]]. [https://www.africanews.com/2022/08/16/mali-jihadist-group-claims-to-have-killed-four-russian-wagner-group-mercenaries/ (Africanews)]

The [[Taliban]] stages a Victory Day parade on the first anniversary of the [[Fall of Kabul (2021)|capture]] of [[Kabul]]. [https://www.cbsnews.com/pictures/afghanistan-taliban-victory-day-us-withdrawal/ (CBS News)]

[[Israel]] launches a series of [[airstrike]]s on [[Damascus]] and [[Tartus]], [[Syria]], killing three [[Syrian Army|soldiers]] and injuring three others. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/8/14/israeli-air-strikes-in-syria-kills-three-soldiers-state-media (Al Jazeera)]

An explosion occurs at an [[ammunition depot]] in northern [[Crimea]], forcing the evacuation of civilians. Observers suggest that the depot may have been hit by [[Ukrainian forces]]. [https://www.rferl.org/a/ukraine-crimean-explosion-ammunition-depot-chubarov/31990544.html (Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty)]

[[Turkish Air Force|Turkish]] [[airstrike]]s on a military base in [[Aleppo Governorate]] kill at least 16 [[Syrian Army|Syrian soldiers]]. [https://english.almayadeen.net/news/politics/syrian-soldiers-killed-wounded-in-turkish-aggression-on-alep (Al Mayadeen)]

Hamza Adel Al-Zamili, a leader of the [[Islamic State – Sinai Province]] and mastermind of the [[2017 Sinai mosque attack]], is killed by [[Egyptian Army|Egyptian soldiers]] during an operation. Nine other militants are also killed and three arrested. [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2144021/middle-east (Arab News)] [https://m.jpost.com/middle-east/isis-threat/article-715016 (The Jerusalem Post)]

A [[Royal Thai Army Ranger|ranger]] is killed while seven policemen and two civilians are injured as two bombs explode at a [[Plantation|rubber plantation]] in [[Narathiwat]], [[Thailand]]. [https://www.thesundaily.my/world/bomb-blast-in-narathiwat-leaves-one-dead-two-injured-KE9556963 (''The Sun'')]

Two policemen are killed when gunmen open fire on them as they are escorting [[polio]] workers in [[Gomal, Tank|Gomal]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/afghanistan-health-pakistan-police-064127d3bf6cc18cf7a352d4f354f89d (AP)]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[missile]] hits a dormitory in [[Kharkiv]], killing seven civilians and injuring 16 others, according to the city's mayor and top military administrator. [https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2022/08/17/7363732/ (''Ukrainska Pravda'')] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/aug/18/russia-ukraine-war-latest-what-we-know-on-day-176-of-the-invasion (''The Guardian'')]

[[Russia]] launches missile strikes on [[Odesa]] and [[Mykolaiv]] in [[Southern Ukraine]] in response to sabotage bombings of military facilities in [[Crimea]]. [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/russia-strikes-ukrainian-ports-after-crimea-blasts/ar-AA10KZwr (MSN)]
Twenty-one people are killed and 33 others are injured by a [[mosque]] bombing in [[Kabul]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-62581102 (BBC News)]

Explosions are reported at military facilities in [[Republic of Crimea|Crimea]] and [[Belgorod Oblast]], [[Russia]], and are believed to have been launched by [[Ukraine]]. An explosion and large fire occur at an [[ammunition dump|arms depot]] near [[Timonovo]]. Explosions are also reported at [[Stary Oskol Airport]] and in [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Russian-occupied]] [[Nova Kakhovka]], [[Kherson Oblast]]. [https://www.forbes.com/sites/davidaxe/2022/08/18/russian-bases-are-blowing-up-all-around-ukraine-as-rockets-and-drones-lash-out/?sh=6e03dff74e33 (''Forbes'')]

Explosions are reported at [[Sevastopol International Airport]]. The [[Governor of Sevastopol (Russia)|Governor of Sevastopol]] [[Mikhail Razvozhayev]] says that Russian air defences have shot down a [[Ukrainian Air Force]] drone near the airport. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/sources-say-blasts-hit-area-near-russian-air-base-moscow-says-no-damage-done-2022-08-18/ (Reuters)]

Residents of [[Kerch]] and nearby villages in eastern Crimea report multiple explosions. Crimean officials say that air defences were activated near the city but that "there is no danger to the town or the [[Crimean Bridge]]". [https://news.yahoo.com/explosion-thunders-kerch-crimea-russian-183500192.html (Yahoo! News)]

[[Mali]] accuses its former ally [[France]] of arming [[jihadism|jihadist]] [[terrorist group]]s in order to destabilize the country. Malian Foreign Minister [[Abdoulaye Diop]] tells the [[United Nations]] that French aircraft are violating the country's airspace and dropping "arms and ammunition" to terrorist groups on the ground. France denies the accusations. [https://www.dw.com/en/mali-tells-un-that-france-armed-islamist-militants/a-62853737 (DW)]

[[Timane Erdimi]], leader of the [[Chad]]ian rebel group [[Rally of Forces for Change]] and nephew of slain [[President of Chad|Chadian president]] [[Idriss Déby]], returns to the country from his 17-year exile in [[Qatar]] to participate in a [[peace process]] between the [[Government of Chad|government]] and numerous rebel groups. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/exiled-rebel-leader-returns-chad-national-talks-2022-08-18/ (Reuters)]

Explosions are reported overnight at [[Russian military]] bases in [[Republic of Crimea|Crimea]] and [[Belgorod Oblast]], Russia. Two villages have been evacuated. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-calls-world-show-strength-after-shelling-near-nuclear-plant-2022-08-15/ (Reuters)]

At least 10 people are killed as [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] gunmen storm a hotel in [[Mogadishu]], following two [[car bomb]] blasts and gunfire. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/8/19/unidentified-attackers-seize-control-of-hotel-in-mogadishu (Al Jazeera)]

Fifteen people are killed and at least 28 others are injured in a rocket attack on a market in rebel-controlled [[Al-Bab]], [[Aleppo Governorate]], [[Syria]]. [https://apnews.com/article/middle-east-syria-turkey-b4ce7f48c32c9e416374469d2041e32a (AP)]

A [[roadside bombing]] kills two [[Pakistan]]i security forces in [[Bajaur District]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]]. [https://apnews.com/article/afghanistan-police-bombings-kabul-taliban-3ed9111366aea1e29cef39a92010fb97 (AP)]

Nine civilians, including four children, are injured by [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] shelling on a residential building in [[Voznesensk]], [[Mykolaiv Oblast]], according to regional governor [[Vitaliy Kim]]. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/russian-shelling-ukrainian-airstrike-reflect-broadening-war/2022/08/20/0f7e1ab6-2083-11ed-9ce6-68253bd31864_story.html (''The Washington Post'')]

[[Russia]] says that a number of [[Russian Army|its soldiers]] in [[Zaporizhzhia]] have been poisoned by Ukraine, with tests showing [[Botulinum toxin|Botulinum toxin type B]] present in their bodies. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-accuses-ukraine-poisoning-some-its-soldiers-2022-08-20/ (Reuters)]

The siege at a hotel seized by [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] fighters in [[Mogadishu]] ends with the deaths of all of the attackers. Twenty-one other people were killed, and 117 others were injured. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/8/21/somali-forces-end-al-shabab-siege-at-mogadishu-hotel-report (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-62621205 (BBC News)]

[[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] reportedly shell the administration headquarters of the [[Donetsk People's Republic]] in separatist-held [[Donetsk]], killing three people, according to pro-[[Russia]]n officials. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-strikes-administration-headquarters-donetsk-russia-installed-separatists-2022-08-23/ (Reuters)]

[[Slovakia]] announces that it will send an additional 30 [[BMP-1]] [[infantry fighting vehicle]]s and ammunition to [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/slovakia-donate-30-infantry-fighting-vehicles-ukraine-minister-2022-08-23/ (Reuters)]

According to the [[Libyan National Army]], a United States-manufactured [[General Atomics MQ-9 Reaper|MQ-9 Reaper]] drone was shot down with a [[surface-to-air missile]], crashing near [[Benina International Airport]] in [[Benghazi]], [[Libya]]. [https://eurasiantimes.com/mq-9-reaper-drone-shot-down-near-benghazi-video/ (''Eurasian Times'')] [https://en.mehrnews.com/news/190589/US-General-Atomics-MQ9-Reaper-drone-shot-down-in-Libya (Mehr News Agency)]

The [[Russia]]n-appointed head of [[Mykhailivka, Vasylivka Raion, Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Mykhailivka]] in [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]], Ivan Sushko, is assassinated in a car bombing. [https://euroweeklynews.com/2022/08/24/russian-appointed-head-of-zaporizhzhia-ivan-sushko-killed-in-car-bomb-explosion/ (Euro Weekly News)]

At least 25 people are killed and more than 50 others are injured in a Russian [[Chaplyne railway station attack|rocket attack]] on a passenger train in [[Chaplyne]], [[Dnipropetrovsk Oblast]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/aug/24/at-least-15-killed-in-russian-strike-on-rail-station-on-ukraines-independence-day (''The Guardian'')] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/least-15-died-russian-attack-ukraine-station-zelenskiy-2022-08-24/ (Reuters)]

The [[United States]] announces a security package of nearly {{US$|3|long=no|link=yes}} billion from the [[Ukraine Security Assistance Initiative]]. [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/ukraine-aid-3-billion-biden-administration-announcement/ (CBS News)]

[[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Joe Biden]] orders airstrikes against claimed [[Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps]] and Russia-linked groups in [[Syria]] in response to a August 15 rocket attack near the [[Al-Tanf (U.S. military base)|U.S. military base in al-Tanf]], Syria, which houses the [[Maghaweir al-Thowra]] [[Syrian Opposition|rebel group]], and an airstrike by the [[Russian military]] in an area held by the [[Syrian opposition]]. The U.S. strikes targeted eleven bunkers in [[Deir ez-Zor Governorate|Deir ez-Zor]] used to store weapons, according to the [[United States Central Command]]. [https://edition.cnn.com/2022/08/23/politics/syria-airstrikes-iranian-backed-groups-biden/index.html (CNN)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/us-military-carries-out-strike-syria-iran-linked-targets-2022-08-24/ (Reuters)]

A spokesperson for the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)|Iranian foreign ministry]] denies that [[Iran]] has any link to targets hit by U.S. in Syria and condemns the strike as "a violation of Syria's sovereignty and territorial integrity". [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/iran-denies-any-link-targets-hit-by-us-syria-2022-08-24/ (Reuters)] [https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/syria-us-service-member-wounded-military-says (''Middle East Eye'')]

Eight people are killed in a shooting between two criminal groups in [[Tuzantla]], [[Michoacán]], [[Mexico]]. [https://apnews.com/article/mexico-city-butterflies-097160ae675272ba1ffefec6d90f298e (AP)]

Fighting resumes between the [[Ethiopian National Defense Force|Ethiopian military]] and the [[Tigray Defense Forces]] in the [[Tigray Region]]. Both sides blame each other for breaking the ceasefire. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/aug/24/fighting-in-northern-ethiopia-shatters-months-long-truce-tigray (''The Guardian'')]

[[Ukraine]] says that the [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]] has been completely disconnected from its power grid after shelling near the [[Russian occupation of Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Russian-occupied]] plant caused several fires. Security systems at the plant were activated shortly after the power failure, according to a local official. [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/zaporizhzhia-nuclear-plant-disconnected-power-grid-ukraine--russia-war-rcna44765 (NBC News)]

The [[United States]] conducts airstrikes against [[Iran]]ian-backed [[militia]] groups in [[Syria]] for a second day. [https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-helicopter-gunships-hit-iran-backed-militia-in-syria-11661433894 (''The Wall Street Journal'')]

[[Ukraine]]'s state nuclear company, [[Energoatom]], says that the Russian-occupied [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]] has resumed supplying electricity to Ukraine's power grid after being disconnected yesterday from it for the first time in history. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2022/8/26/russia-ukraine-live-news-zelenskyy-says-world-avoided-disaster (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-says-one-reactor-nuclear-plant-reconnects-its-grid-2022-08-26/ (Reuters)]

A traffic police deputy chief is killed by a bombing in the Russian-occupied city of [[Berdiansk]], [[Russian occupation of Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Zaporizhzhia Oblast]]. Russian authorities accuse the Ukrainian forces of the attack. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/bomb-kills-traffic-cop-occupied-ukrainian-city-russian-installed-officials-2022-08-26/ (Reuters)]

[[Ethiopia]]n forces reportedly [[airstrike]] a kindergarten playground in [[Mekelle]], [[Tigray Region]], killing at least seven people and injuring more than 13 others. [https://www.ctvnews.ca/world/airstrike-hits-kindergarten-in-capital-of-ethiopia-s-tigray-1.6043532 (CTV News)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/air-strike-hits-capital-ethiopias-northern-tigray-region-local-media-aid-sources-2022-08-26/ (Reuters)]

Fighting breaks out between two [[militia]]s in [[Tripoli, Libya|Tripoli]], [[Libya]]. At least 23 people are killed and over 140 others are injured. [https://apnews.com/article/middle-east-africa-libya-tripoli-f1fbc083274d0e1082df7a755df76974 (Associated Press)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/shootouts-blasts-erupt-libyan-capital-amid-political-standoff-2022-08-27/ (Reuters)]

Six people are killed and two others are injured when militants attack a gold mine in [[Boungou]], [[Bilanga Department]], [[Gnagna Province]], [[Burkina Faso]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/militants-kill-6-attack-convoy-burkina-faso-gold-mine-2022-08-27/ (Reuters)]

[[Ukraine]] says it has begun a ground offensive in the [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Kherson Oblast]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/ukraine-says-long-anticipated-southern-offensive-has-begun-2022-08-29/ (Reuters)]

[[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Russian-occupation]] officials say that the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian military]] launched a barrage of missiles at the town of [[Nova Kakhovka]], leaving the town without water or power. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukrainians-launch-rocket-barrage-key-russian-occupied-town-ria-reports-2022-08-29/ (Reuters)]

Two people are killed and five others are injured after [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] [[shell (projectile)|shelled]] the city of [[Mykolaiv]], according to regional governor [[Vitaliy Kim]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/several-killed-russian-shelling-mykolaiv-regions-governor-2022-08-29/ (Reuters)]

Supporters of [[Shia Islam in Iraq|Iraqi Shia]] cleric [[Muqtada al-Sadr]] storm the [[Republican Palace]] in [[Baghdad]]. The [[Iraqi Ground Forces|Iraqi Army]] declares a total curfew] in the capital beginning at 3:30 p.m. and the [[federal government of Iraq|Iraqi government]] declares a nationwide curfew beginning at 7:00 p.m.. At least twelve people are killed and 270 others are injured in clashes between protesters and [[Iran]]-backed [[Popular Mobilization Forces]] in the [[Green Zone]]. [https://www.rferl.org/a/live-fire-baghdad-green-zone-sadr-pro-iran-groups/32009356.html (Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty)] [https://www.france24.com/en/middle-east/20220829-iraqi-shiite-cleric-sadr-announces-final-withdrawal-from-politics (France 24)] [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2022/08/29/Two-killed-as-Iraq-s-powerful-Sadr-quits-politics-clashes-erupt-and-curfew-imposed (Al Arabiya English)] [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-715830 (''The Jerusalem Post'')]

[[Sadrist Movement|Pro-Sadrist]] protesters blockade roads and government buildings in [[Basra]]. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2022/08/29/iraq-protests-sadr-presidential-palace/ (''The Washington Post'')]

Iran closes [[Iran–Iraq border|its border]] with [[Iraq]] until "further notice" amid the ongoing civil unrest, while [[Kuwait]] urges its citizens to leave Iraq. [https://en.mehrnews.com/news/190806/Iran-closes-border-with-Iraq-amid-unrest (Mehr News Agency)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/kuwait-urges-its-citizens-iraq-leave-country-2022-08-29/ (Reuters)]

At least 42 ethnic [[Oromo people|Oromo]] civilians are killed during a [[massacre]] in [[Horo Guduru Welega Zone]], [[Ethiopia]]. Witnesses blame members of the [[Amhara people|Amhara]] [[Fano (militia)|Fano militia]] of responsibility. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/gunmen-kill-least-42-people-ethiopias-oromiya-region-residents-2022-09-02/ (Reuters)]

Ten soldiers are killed and many more wounded during an attack aimed at cutting off a key route to the city of [[Taiz]]. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/gulf/2022/08/29/10-Yemeni-soldiers-killed-in-dangerous-escalation-Government (Al Arabiya)]

The death toll from the clashes in [[Baghdad]] between [[Shia Islam in Iraq|Iraqi Shia]] cleric [[Muqtada al-Sadr]]'s supporters and security forces increases to 23, with all of those killed being supporters of Sadr. 380 others are injured. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-62719497 (BBC News)]

Iran captures an American unmanned ship before releasing it. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/us-navy-says-iran-seized-later-let-go-of-american-sea-drone/2022/08/30/c045cf4e-2879-11ed-a90a-fce4015dfc8f_story.html (''The Washington Post'')]

[[Allied Democratic Forces]] militants kill at least 40 people in a series of raids on several villages in [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. At least 76 others are kidnapped by the group. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/militants-kill-least-40-villagers-east-congo-attacks-2022-08-30/ (Reuters)]

The [[Republic of China Armed Forces|Taiwanese military]] fire warning shots at a [[China|Chinese]] drone flying over islands in the [[Kinmen]] region. [https://www.taiwannews.com.tw/en/news/4642419 (''Taiwan News'')]

A police chief is killed by suspected members of the [[Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters]] in [[Maguindanao]], [[the Philippines]]. [https://apnews.com/article/police-philippines-ef66d416eafd3fde14fdba1336e2b203 (AP)]

The [[Government of Ethiopia]] says that the [[Tigray People's Liberation Front]] has begun an offensive into the [[Wag Hemra Zone|Wag]] and [[Welkait]] regions and is also pushing forward towards the [[Ethiopia–Sudan border|Sudanese border]]. Tigrayan authorities say that three [[airstrike]]s have hit the Tigrayan capital of [[Mekelle]], nearly striking a hospital. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/air-strike-hits-hospital-ethiopias-tigray-region-health-official-2022-08-31/ (Reuters)] [https://www.voanews.com/a/health-official-air-strike-hits-capital-of-ethiopia-s-tigray-region/6723811.html (Voice of America)]

Fourteen people are killed and several others are kidnapped as [[Allied Democratic Forces]] militants attack a village in [[Ituri Province]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. Five attackers are also killed. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/suspected-islamists-kill-least-14-civilians-east-congo-attack-2022-08-31/ (Reuters)]

[[Israeli Air Force]] jets fire four [[missile]]s at [[Aleppo International Airport]], hitting the runway and several warehouses allegedly containing Iranian rockets, according to the [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights]]. No casualties have been reported. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/syria-israel-strikes-aleppo-airport-89118953 (ABC News)]

Four people are killed during clashes between rival [[Shia Islam|Shia Muslim]] fighters in [[Basra]], [[Iraq]], three days after 30 supporters of Shia cleric [[Muqtada al-Sadr]] were killed during clashes in [[Baghdad]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/1/latest-outbreak-violence-iraqi-city-basra-leaves-dead (Al Jazeera)]

Two [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] men are killed in clashes with [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in the occupied [[West Bank]]. One of the men was killed by Palestinian gunfire, according to the Palestinian Health Ministry. [https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2022-09-01/ty-article/.premium/two-palestinians-killed-in-clashes-with-israeli-army-in-west-bank/00000182-f7ee-d8b2-abcb-f7ef379a0000 (''Haaretz'')]

[[Republic of China Armed Forces|Taiwanese forces]] shoot down an unidentified civilian drone which entered its airspace near the [[Shi Islet]] in the [[Taiwan Strait]]. Taiwan's [[Ministry of National Defense (Republic of China)|Ministry of National Defense]] says that the drone ignored several warning shots before being shot down. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-shoots-down-unidentified-drone-kinmen-2022-09-01/ (Reuters)]

The [[Tigray People's Liberation Front]] claims that [[Eritrea]] and [[Ethiopia]] have launched a joint offensive in the [[Tigray Region]].  [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/tplf-says-ethiopian-eritrean-forces-attack-northwest-tigray-2022-09-01/ (Reuters)]

Eighteen people are killed and 23 others are injured by a [[Suicide attack|suicide bombing]] at a [[Sunni Islam|Sunni]] [[mosque]] in [[Herat]], [[Afghanistan]]. The mosque's pro-[[Taliban]] [[imam]], who is suspected to be the target of the attack, is among the dead. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/blast-afghan-mosque-kills-cleric-civilians-police-2022-09-02/ (Reuters)]

Seven policemen are killed and one is injured during an [[ambush]] in [[Huila Department]], [[Colombia]]. Their vehicle hit a [[roadside bomb]] before being shot dead by gunmen. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-62775585 (BBC News)]

A [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] man stabs and injures an [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldier]] near [[Kiryat Arba]] in the [[West Bank]]. The attacker is shot dead by security forces. [https://apnews.com/article/middle-east-israel-west-bank-0dbdda0114c8e3bbe2f5987ae1c4ba79 (AP)]

The [[Islamic Republic of Iran Navy|Iranian Navy]] captures and later releases two [[United States Navy|American]] [[Unmanned surface vehicle|sea drones]] in the [[Red Sea]]. [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/iran-seizes-2-us-sea-drones-in-second-incident-this-week/ar-AA11oYo6 (MSN)]

Twenty people are killed in a [[mass shooting]] by [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[insurgent]]s against vehicles transporting food supplies from [[Beledweyne]] to [[Mahas District|Mahas]] in the [[Hiran, Somalia|Hiran region]]. [https://apnews.com/article/al-qaida-africa-somalia-shabab-877f395a05f4f7c7e4cc6233fb9dafe9 (AP)]

[[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] recapture the town of [[Vysokopillia]] in [[Kherson Oblast]], which has been under [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Russian occupation]] since March, and raise the [[Flag of Ukraine|Ukrainian flag]] over the town's hospital. [https://www.newsweek.com/ukraine-recaptures-kherson-village-russia-raises-flag-over-hospital-1739725 (''Newsweek'')]

Six [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] and a civilian driver are injured when three gunmen open fire on a bus in [[Nablus]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. Two of the attackers are later arrested. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/shots-fired-at-israeli-bus-in-jordan-valley-at-least-two-moderately-hurt (''Times of Israel'')]

Thirty-five civilians are killed and 37 others injured as a convoy of vehicles carrying supplies strike a [[roadside bomb]] along the road from [[Bourzanga]] to [[Djibo]], [[Soum Province]], [[Burkina Faso]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/6/dozens-civilians-killed-in-burkina-faso-blast-ied-convoy-blast (Al Jazeera)]

Eight people are killed when an [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|Islamic State]] [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] detonates his explosives near the entrance of the [[Russia]]n [[List of diplomatic missions of Russia|embassy]] in [[Kabul]]. Two of the victims were [[Russians|Russian]] staff members. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/5/suicide-bomb-blast-near-russian-embassy-in-kabul-afghan-police (Al Jazeera)]

Five [[Pakistan Army|Pakistani soldiers]] and four [[Pakistani Taliban]] militants are killed during a gunfight in [[North Waziristan]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/6/five-pakistan-soldiers-killed-in-clash-with-taliban (Al Jazeera)]

Six people are killed and three others are kidnapped as [[Islamist]]s [[insurgent]]s raid the districts of [[Eráti District|Erati]] and [[Memba District|Memba]], [[Mozambique]], torching dozens of houses. Six attackers are arrested.

Gunmen storm the [[Comboni Missionary Sisters]]' church in Chipene, Mozambique, killing an [[Italians|Italian]] nun and setting ablaze the church, the nuns' homes and the hospital. Two other nuns and two priests escaped. [https://www.ansa.it/english/news/general_news/2022/09/07/italian-nun-killed-in-terror-attack-in-mozambique_0e99ac8a-3cc4-4120-9f96-299053ad0245.html (Ansa)]

Fights erupt in the village of [[Talataye]] between the [[Islamic State in the Greater Sahara|Islamic State]], [[Jama'at Nasr al-Islam wal Muslimin]] and the [[National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad]], with the [[Malian Armed Forces]] launching [[airstrike]]s amid the fighting. At least 30 people are killed. [https://crisis24.garda.com/alerts/2022/09/mali-further-armed-clashes-likely-following-sept-6-militant-attack-on-talataye-in-gao-region (Crisis24)]

Twenty [[Southern Transitional Council]] [[Separatism|separatist]] fighters are killed by [[Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula|al-Qaeda]] gunmen in [[Abyan Governorate]]. All of the six attackers are also killed in the [[gunfight]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/6/al-qaeda-attack-kills-yemeni-forces-in-abyan-southern-army-says (Al Jazeera)]

Six people are killed and eight others are injured when separatists [[mass shootings|open fire]] on a public bus in [[Southwest Region (Cameroon)|South West]], [[Cameroon]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/least-six-civilians-killed-after-cameroon-separatists-open-fire-bus-2022-09-06/ (Reuters)]

Amid a renewed counter-offensive in the region, [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] reportedly break through [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] defenses and advance more than 30 kilometers into Russian held territory in the [[Kharkiv Oblast]], capturing many towns and cities including [[Balakliia]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/global/2022/sep/07/ukraine-launches-surprise-counterattack-kharkiv-region-russia (''The Guardian'')]

Seven people are killed and 12 others are injured by [[airstrike]]s in [[Idlib Governorate]], [[Syria]]. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-middle-east-syria-civil-wars-8eea57a999f5681e0f3203f7acfa46da (AP)]

[[Governor of Sumy Oblast]] [[Dmytro Zhyvytskyi]] says that [[Russian forces]] have [[shell (projectile)|shelled]] a hospital in [[Velyka Pysarivka]], causing an unspecified number of casualties. [https://www.rferl.org/a/ukraine-bombing-hospital-sumy/32025893.html (Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty)]
[[Ukraine]] claims to have retaken more than 1,000 [[square kilometer]]s of territory previously occupied by Russia, within the last week. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-62849235 (BBC News)]

[[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] retake the cities of [[Balakliia]], [[Kupiansk]], and [[Izium]] from [[Russian occupation of Kharkiv Oblast|Russian occupation]]. The [[Ministry of Defence (Russia)|Russian Defence Ministry]] confirms the withdrawal of troops from several towns in [[Kharkiv Oblast]] in order to allow its forces "to regroup" and reinforce the [[Donbas]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-62860774 (BBC News)]  [https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/ukrainian-forces-capture-strategic-town-27957253 (''Mirror'')]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] withdraw from most of the [[Kharkiv Oblast]] as the [[Russian occupation of Kharkiv Oblast]] collapses. [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian soldiers]] retake [[Chkalovske]] and [[Velykyi Burluk]]. [[Governor of Belgorod Oblast]] [[Vyacheslav Gladkov]] says that "thousands" of civilians are fleeing across [[Russia–Ukraine border|the border]] into the region. [https://financialpost.com/pmn/business-pmn/russian-defenses-fold-quickly-in-kharkiv-area-on-wars-200th-day/wcm/b192cf3c-13c6-43e8-8337-3e5a4a57be6d/amp/ (''Financial Post'')] [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-62867560 (BBC News)]

Russia launches missile strikes with [[3M-54 Kalibr|Kalibr]] [[cruise missile]]s on [[critical infrastructure]] objects, including [[Kharkiv TEC-5]], causing a total blackout and water shutdown in Northeastern Ukraine and the Kharkiv and [[Donetsk Oblast]]s. Ukrainian officials confirm at least 40 [[electrical substation]]s have been destroyed in the wave of missile strikes.  [https://www.nytimes.com/live/2022/09/11/world/ukraine-russia-war/a894f4c2-8799-5766-908a-046f5a232575 (''The New York Times'')] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-region-kharkiv-reports-blackouts-water-cuts-after-russian-attacks-2022-09-11/ (Reuters)] [https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-ato/3569690-russias-mass-attack-on-ukraine-40-substations-left-without-power-yesterday.html (Ukrinform)]

[[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] continue to recapture [[Russian occupation of Kharkiv Oblast|Russian-occupied territory]] in [[Kharkiv Oblast]], saying that they have seized 20 more settlements in the last 24 hours, including [[Dvorichna]], and also claim to have captured many Russian [[prisoners of war]]. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-kyiv-kharkiv-a691ab16016aab01cedb68ea5e247b37 (AP)]

The Ukrainian general staff reports that [[Russian Ground Forces|Russian troops]] abandoned the city of [[Svatove]] in [[Luhansk Oblast]] as Ukrainian forces advanced. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-accuses-russia-attacking-power-grid-revenge-offensive-2022-09-11/ (Reuters)]

Multiple explosions are reported near the city of [[Taganrog]] in [[Rostov Oblast]], [[Russia]]. [https://meduza.io/en/news/2022/09/12/residents-of-several-towns-in-the-rostov-region-report-powerful-explosion (Meduza)] [https://halktv.com.tr/dunya/ukraynadan-ileri-adim-iste-vurulan-rus-kenti-692557h (HalkTV)]

More than 30 municipal deputies of Russian cities sign a petition calling for Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]]'s resignation amid substantial Ukrainian advances in the war. [https://thehill.com/policy/international/3638950-municipal-deputies-call-for-putins-resignation/amp/ (''The Hill'')]

Four [[Turkish Land Forces|Turkish soldiers]] are killed in clashes with [[Kurdistan Workers' Party|PKK]] [[insurgent]]s in [[Iraqi Kurdistan]], according to the [[Ministry of National Defense (Turkey)|Turkish Defense Ministry]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/12/four-turkish-soldiers-killed-in-operations-in-iraq (Al Jazeera)]
[[Azerbaijan]] shells [[Armenia]]n villages in the eastern region of the country. [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-717014 (''The Jerusalem Post'')]

Five people are killed during an attack on a senator's convoy in [[Anambra]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/five-aides-killed-after-gunmen-attack-nigerian-senators-convoy-2022-09-12/ (Reuters)]

The [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian military]] says that it has shot down an [[Iran]]ian [[HESA Shahed 136]] [[unmanned combat aerial vehicle|combat drone]] operated by [[Russia]] near [[Kupiansk]], [[Kharkiv Oblast]]. An inscription on the drone identified it as an "M214 Geran-2", which did not immediately correspond to known Russian weaponry. [https://abcnews.go.com/Technology/wireStory/ukraine-military-claims-downing-iran-drone-russia-89801492 (ABC News)]

[[Taliban]] authorities say that they have killed 40 [[National Resistance Front of Afghanistan|National Resistance Front]] fighters in the [[Panjshir Province]] of [[Afghanistan]], including four commanders. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taliban-says-40-rebel-force-members-killed-northern-panjshir-2022-09-13/ (Reuters)]

[[Prime minister of Armenia|Armenian prime minister]] [[Nikol Pashinyan]] says that 49 [[Armed Forces of Armenia|soldiers]] were killed during overnight clashes with [[Azerbaijan]] after it [[shell (projectile)|shelled]] villages yesterday and that fighting was ongoing. [https://www.reuters.com/world/armenias-pm-says-49-soldiers-died-clashes-with-azerbaijan-2022-09-13/ (Reuters)]

A roadside bombing in [[Swat District]], [[Pakistan]], kills eight people, including a local tribal leader known for his opposition to the [[Pakistani Taliban]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/anti-taliban-tribal-leader-among-5-killed-northwest-pakistan-bombing-2022-09-13/ (Reuters)]
[[Ethiopia]]n [[airstrike]]s hit [[Mekelle University]]'s business campus and a [[Dimtsi Weyane]] radio station. [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-717029 (''The Jerusalem Post'')]

The [[Tigray People's Liberation Front]] says that [[Eritrea]] has taken the town of [[Sheraro]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/13/air-strike-hits-capital-of-ethiopias-northern-tigray-region (Al Jazeera)]

Russian forces launch eight [[cruise missile]]s at the dam of the Karachunivske [[reservoir]] causing extensive flooding in [[Kryvyi Rih]] and a {{Convert|2.5|m}} increase of water level in the [[Inhulets River]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/sep/15/ukraine-city-of-kryvyi-rih-floods-after-russian-missile-strikes-hit-dam (''The Guardian'')]

[[Armenia]] formally triggers article 4 of the [[Collective Security Treaty Organization]] (CSTO) after accusing [[Azerbaijan]] of launching an invasion. [[Prime Minister of Armenia|Armenian Prime Minister]] [[Nikol Pashinyan]] says that "we asked support from CSTO, including military support to restore Armenia's territorial integrity and ensure the withdrawal of the Azerbaijani Armed Forces from the territory of Armenia". [https://armenpress.am/eng/news/1092504/ (Armenpress)]

One [[al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades|al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade]] member and an [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldier]] are killed during a [[shootout]] at a [[security checkpoint|checkpoint]] in [[Jenin]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/14/two-palestinians-one-israeli-soldier-killed-in-occupied-jenin (Al Jazeera)]

Two [[Tajikistan|Tajik]] [[border guard]]s are killed and two others are injured during clashes with [[Kyrgyzstan|Kyrgyz]] guards, who accuse Tajikistan of taking positions at a [[Demarcation line|demarcated]] area. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/world/fresh-clash-erupts-between-kyrgyz-tajik-border-guards-2022-09-14/ (Reuters)]

Ten people are killed when [[Ethiopia]]n [[airstrike]]s hit a residential area in [[Mekelle]], [[Tigray Region]]. [https://apnews.com/article/africa-kenya-ethiopia-74494cd02e719690d20255e5843b5296 (AP)]

[[Ukrainian police]] say that a [[mass grave]] containing more than 440 bodies has been discovered in the recently recaptured city of [[Izium]]. [https://www.reuters.com/article/ukraine-crisis-zelenskiy-grave/ukraine-finds-a-mass-grave-in-recaptured-city-of-izium-zelenskiy-idUSKBN2QG248 (Reuters)]

A civilian is killed and two others are injured by Ukrainian [[shell (projectile)|shelling]] on [[Valuyki, Belgorod Oblast|Valuyki]], [[Belgorod Oblast]], according to Governor [[Vyacheslav Gladkov]]. [https://www.urdupoint.com/en/world/one-dead-two-injured-in-russias-belgorod-re-1563596.html (UrduPoint)] [https://www.msn.com/en-ca/news/world/russia-accuses-ukraine-of-attacking-russian-town-on-common-border/ar-AA11T3dt?li=AAggFp4 (MSN)]

[[Myanmar Army]] helicopters attack a school in [[Sagaing Region]], [[Myanmar]], killing six children and injuring 17 people. Military officials say that the school was being used as a base by anti-[[2021 Myanmar coup d'état|coup]] insurgents. [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-717527 (''The Jerusalem Post'')]

According to Kyrgyzstan, [[Armed Forces of the Republic of Tajikistan|Tajik forces]] again open fire on its outposts and clashes occur along the [[Kyrgyzstan–Tajikistan border|border]] with Tajik forces using [[armored vehicle]]s and [[mortar (weapon)|mortars]]. Tajikistan accuses [[Armed Forces of the Kyrgyz Republic|Kyrgyz forces]] of shelling one of its outposts and several villages. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/kyrgyzstan-says-border-outposts-under-tajik-fire-again-2022-09-16/ (Reuters)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/amp/news/2022/9/16/renewed-fighting-escalation-at-kyrgyzstan-tajikistan-border (Al Jazeera)]

Five [[Syrian Army|Syrian soldiers]] are killed in missile strikes launched by the [[Israeli Air Force]] near [[Damascus]]. [https://www.haaretz.com/middle-east-news/2022-09-17/ty-article/five-syrian-soldiers-killed-in-israeli-airstrike-near-damascus-syrian-media-reports/00000183-4859-dfd0-a5f7-4edb55f80000 (''Haaretz'')]

Russian forces [[shell (projectile)|shell]] a [[psychiatric hospital]] in Strelechya, [[Kharkiv Oblast]], killing four medics and injuring two patients. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/sep/18/ukrainians-flee-shelling-of-kupiansk-as-russian-forces-try-to-slow-advances (''The Guardian'')]

The death toll from the fighting between [[Kyrgyzstan]] and [[Tajikistan]], which began four days ago, increases to 94. Fifty-nine of the people were killed in Kyrgyzstan, and the 35 others were killed in Tajikistan. Another 139 people are injured. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-62950787 (BBC News)]

[[Ukraine]] withdraws its 250 [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|troops]] from the [[United Nations peacekeeping]] force [[MONUSCO]] in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. A [[Ukrainian Air Force]] aviation unit also withdraws its eight helicopters from the mission, which made up a third of the UN's fleet. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-62945971 (BBC News)]

Five gunmen storm a [[rehab center]] in the early morning in [[Cortazar, Guanajuato]], [[Mexico]], and [[mass shooting|open fire]], killing three people and injuring two others. [https://www.meganoticias.mx/cdmx/noticia/tres-muertos-dos-heridos-en-ataque-a-anexo-de-cortazar/360750 (MegaNoticias)]

Thirteen people are killed and many others are injured in explosions in the [[Donetsk People's Republic]]-held city of [[Donetsk]]. [[Head of the Donetsk People's Republic|DPR leader]] [[Denis Pushilin]] accuses [[Ukraine]] of being behind the attacks. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-62952641 (BBC News)]

The [[Ukrainian Ground Forces]] recapture the village of [[Bilohorivka, Luhansk Oblast|Bilohorivka]] in [[Luhansk Oblast]] as it advances on [[Lysychansk]]. [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2022/09/19/ukraine-news-russia-war-counter-offensive-kharkiv-kupiansk-putin/ (''The Telegraph'')]

[[Luhansk People's Republic]] authorities say that a Ukrainian shelling attack has killed seven civilians including three children in the town of [[Krasnorichenske]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/seven-killed-ukrainian-strike-luhansk-region-tass-cites-russian-backed-2022-09-20/ (Reuters)]

Four people are killed and more than 30 injured as police open fire on people protesting in [[Saqqez]], [[Kurdistan province]], [[Iran]], over the [[Death of Mahsa Amini|death of a woman under police custody]] in [[Tehran]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/sep/20/iran-death-mahsa-amini-protests-morality-police (''The Guardian'')]

[[Russia]]n [[State Duma]] deputies approve the introduction of the concepts of [[mobilization]], [[martial law]], [[War|wartime and armed conflict]], as well as punishment for [[desertion]], into the [[Criminal Code of Russia|Criminal Code]]. [https://www.forbes.ru/society/477577-gosduma-prinala-srazu-v-dvuh-cteniah-vvodasij-ponatie-mobilizacia-zakonoproekt (Forbes)]

A civilian is killed and another is critically injured during clashes between [[Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades|Al-Qassam Brigades]]' supporters and [[Palestinian Security Services|Palestinian authorities]] outside a police station in [[Nablus]], in the occupied [[West Bank]], following the arrest of two militants. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/20/palestinian-man-killed-in-ongoing-clashes-with-pa-in-nablus (Al Jazeera)]

An 84-year-old woman is murdered in [[Holon]], [[Israel]] in a suspected [[terror attack]]. The [[Qalqilya]]-born suspect is found dead, presumably by [[suicide]], inside an abandoned building in [[Tel Aviv]]. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/suspect-in-terror-killing-of-woman-84-found-dead-after-apparent-suicide/ (''Times of Israel'')]

[[Tigray People's Liberation Front]] authorities say that [[Eritrea]] has launched a full-scale intervention into the [[Tigray Region]] of [[Ethiopia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/tigrayan-forces-ethiopia-say-eritrea-launches-full-scale-offensive-2022-09-20/ (Reuters)]

In a major address to the nation, [[President of Russia|Russian president]] [[Vladimir Putin]] announces a partial [[mobilization]], with the exceptions of students and [[conscript]]s. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-putin-donetsk-f64f9c91f24fc81bc8cc65e8bc7748f4 (AP)]

[[Lithuania]] places its [[rapid reaction force]] on high alert in response to Russia's mobilization, according to Defence Minister [[Arvydas Anušauskas]]. [https://www.lrt.lt/en/news-in-english/19/1784265/lithuania-puts-rapid-re*action-force-on-high-alert-in-response-to-mobilisation-in-russia (LRT)]

[[NATO]] [[Secretary General of NATO|Secretary General]] [[Jens Stoltenberg]] says that Russia's military mobilization is "dangerous and reckless", and condemns Putin's use of "nuclear rhetoric". [https://www.ntv.com.tr/dunya/nato-genel-sekreteri-stoltenberg-putin-nukleer-bir-savasi-kazanamaz,k0w1OFFbvEeFl8QgpO131w (NTV)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/exclusive-nato-chief-says-putins-ukraine-escalation-dangerous-reckless-2022-09-21/ (Reuters)]

Three people are killed and 13 others are injured in an [[explosion]] at a restaurant in [[Deh Mazang]], [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/afghanistan-islamic-state-group-religion-kabul-taliban-0870652a6342eb7d0943d94c416cbb37 (AP)]
