[[Fulani herdsmen]] shoot and kill 14 civilians in [[Logo, Nigeria|Logo]], [[Benue State]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://apnews.com/article/africa-nigeria-b4221bdb697735bd70dbdd8292441409 (AP)]

Large numbers of fighting-age men leave [[Russia]] after the announcement of the [[mobilization]]. Long traffic jams occur at international border crossings and the price of tickets for international flights sharply increases. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-62996212 (BBC News)]
At least 1,300 protesters rallying against the mobilization are arrested throughout Russia. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-62981293 (BBC News)]

[[Donetsk People's Republic]] authorities accuse [[Ukraine]] of [[shell (projectile)|shelling]] a market in [[Donetsk]], killing six [[civilian]]s. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/separatists-say-6-killed-by-ukraine-shelling-on-donetsk-market/ (''Times of Israel'')]

Ukraine and Russia release 55 Russian [[prisoners of war]] and 215 fighters from the [[Siege of Mariupol]] as part of a [[prisoner exchange]] [[mediation|mediated]] by [[Turkey]] and [[Saudi Arabia]]. Among those released are pro-Russian Ukrainian politician [[Viktor Medvedchuk]], [[Azov Regiment]] commander [[Denys Prokopenko]], British volunteers [[Aiden Aslin]] and [[Shaun Pinner]], and Moroccan volunteer [[Brahim Saaudun|Saadun Brahim]]. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/russia-frees-215-mariupol-defenders-in-swap-for-putin-oligarch-ally-and-54-others/ (''Times of Israel'')], [https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-62970683?pinned_post_locator=urn:asset:bb900c66-5abe-407d-bb6b-fdb36668c820 (BBC News)]

Seven people are killed and 41 others are injured when a [[car bomb]] [[explode]]s at a [[mosque]] in [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/explosion-takes-place-afghan-capital-official-2022-09-23/ (Reuters)]

A 60-year-old man is killed by an [[Ethiopian Armed Forces|Ethiopian]] [[airstrike]] on [[Mekelle]], in the rebel-controlled [[Tigray Region]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/one-killed-air-strike-ethiopias-tigray-hospital-says-2022-09-23/ (Reuters)]

Gunmen kill ten people in a [[mass shooting]] at a [[pool hall]] in [[Tarimoro]], [[Guanajuato]], [[Mexico]]. [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/mexico-shooting-10-people-killed-pool-hall-tarimoro/ (CBS News)]

Thousands of fighting-age men continue to leave [[Russia]] due to the [[mobilization]]. Massive lines are reported at the country's [[Georgia–Russia border|borders with]] [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] [[Finland–Russia border|and]] [[Finland]]. [https://inews.co.uk/news/world/border-queues-up-twenty-six-hours-build-russians-flee-avoid-ukraine-war-draft-1876877 (iNews)]

At least 700 people are detained during [[anti-war movement|anti-war]] protests across Russia. [https://www.itv.com/news/2022-09-24/russia-arrests-more-than-700-people-as-protests-continue-against-putins-order (ITV News)]

The [[Iranian Revolutionary Guards]] [[shell (projectile)|shell]] the "[h]eadquarters of anti-Iranian terrorists" in [[Iraqi Kurdistan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/iran-guards-launch-artillery-attack-militants-iraqi-kurdistan-2022-09-24/ (Reuters)]

Fifteen people are killed and many others are injured after armed bandits attacked a mosque in [[Zamfara]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/armed-bandits-kill-15-mosque-northwest-nigeria-residents-2022-09-24/ (Reuters)]

Mass protests against mobilization take place in [[Dagestan]] with protesters clashing with police. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/police-clash-with-people-opposed-mobilisation-russias-dagestan-2022-09-25/ (Reuters)], [https://www.svoboda.org/a/politsiya-razognala-miting-protiv-mobilizatsii-v-mahachkale/32051394.html (Radio Liberty)]
The number of people detained in [[anti-war movement|anti-war]] protests across [[Russia]] increases to more than 2,000. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-63028586 (BBC News)]

[[President of Ukraine|Ukrainian president]] [[Volodymyr Zelenskyy]] confirms that [[Ukraine]] has received [[NASAMS]] [[Anti-aircraft warfare|air defence system]]s from the [[United States]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-receives-us-air-defence-system-2022-09-25/ (Reuters)]

One [[Somali National Army|soldier]] is killed and six others are injured in a [[suicide bombing]] in [[Mogadishu]], [[Somalia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/suicide-bombing-somalia-kills-one-soldier-injures-six-2022-09-25/ (Reuters)]

Spontaneous protests against the [[mobilization]] continue in [[Dagestan]] and [[Kabardino-Balkaria]]. [https://www.kavkazr.com/a/v-dagestane-nachalisj-novye-stihiynye-mitingi-protiv-mobilizatsii/32052683.html (Radio Liberty)]

A police officer is killed and another injured during a shooting and bomb attack near a police station in [[Mersin]], [[Turkey]]. Both the attackers are killed. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/explosion-near-police-building-turkey-kills-one-police-officer-2022-09-27/ (Reuters)]

Eleven soldiers are killed as a 150-vehicle convoy carrying supplies to [[Djibo]] is ambushed by [[Islamist]] [[militant]]s in Gaskindé (Pobé-Mengao), [[Soum Province]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/several-feared-dead-trucks-destroyed-burkina-faso-convoy-attack-2022-09-27/ (Reuters)]

Russian oligarch [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]], a close ally of [[Vladimir Putin]], publicly admits for the first time that he founded the [[Wagner Group]], a [[private military company]] accused of [[war crime]]s in places where they had been deployed. Prigozhin had previously denied any involvement with the organization. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/sep/26/putin-ally-yevgeny-prigozhin-admits-founding-wagner-mercenary-group (''The Guardian'')]

[[Kazakhstan]] says that around 98,000 [[Russia]]n civilians have entered the country by land and air since [[President of Russia|Russian president]] [[Vladimir Putin]] ordered a military [[mobilization]]. [https://www.huffpost.com/entry/russian-men-fleeing-putin-call-up-kazakhstan_n_63331f9fe4b0e376dbf001ec (HuffPost)]

[[Latvia]] announces a state of emergency over the influx of Russian citizens fleeing mobilization. Special measures are taken in the border regions of the country and at all ports of entry. [https://news.err.ee/1608730630/latvia-declares-emergency-in-border-areas-over-russia-s-mobilization (ERR)]

Three separate spills are detected in the [[Baltic Sea]] following [[explosion]]s in the [[Nord Stream|Nord Stream 1]] and [[Nord Stream 2]] pipelines in what appear to be acts of [[sabotage]]. [https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2022/09/27/denmark-and-sweden-issue-navigation-warnings-over-nord-stream-gas-leaks (Euronews)]

[[Norway]] raises its "emergency preparedness" in response to sightings of "unidentified drones" near its offshore oil and gas facilities in the [[North Sea]], and is coordinating with its [[Norwegian Armed Forces|armed forces]], police, and oil and gas industry operators, according to energy minister [[Terje Aasland]]. [https://www.spglobal.com/commodityinsights/en/market-insights/latest-news/oil/092722-norway-raises-emergency-level-coordinating-with-armed-forces-over-oil-and-gas-drone-threat (S&P Global)]

[[North Ossetia–Alania]] which contains the only [[border crossing]] [[Georgia-Russia border|between]] [[Russia]] and [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]-controlled territory, bans all Russian cars that do not have the [[licence plate]] of the republic, with the exception of tourists travelling to the region. This comes as those fleeing the draft overwhelm the border. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-region-limits-incoming-cars-amid-queues-georgia-border-escape-draft-2022-09-28/ (Reuters)]

A mobile draft centre is built at the [[Torfyanovka]] [[border checkpoint|checkpoint]], the busiest checkpoint on the [[Finland–Russia border]], in order to prevent people who are fit to serve from fleeing the country. However, as of midday, the centre is not yet open. [https://theins.ru/news/255512 (''The Insider'')]

Thirteen people are killed and 58 others are injured as [[Iran]] launches [[missile]]s and [[unmanned combat aerial vehicle|drone]]s upon the [[Democratic Party of Iranian Kurdistan]]'s offices in [[Koy Sanjaq|Koye]], [[Kurdistan Region]], [[Iraq]]. Iran accused the group of being involved in the [[Mahsa Amini protests|ongoing protests in the country]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/28/iran-kurd-rebels-say-dead-in-iran-strikes-on-iraqi-kurdistan (Al Jazeera)]

An Iranian drone is claimed as shot down by [[US forces]] in [[Erbil]], Kurdistan Region, Iraq. [https://www.centcom.mil/MEDIA/STATEMENTS/Statements-View/Article/3173389/statement-regarding-islamic-revolutionary-guard-corps-unprovoked-attack-in-iraq/ (CENTCOM)]

Four [[Palestinians]] are killed and 44 others are injured when [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] storm a [[refugee camp]] in [[Jenin]], [[West Bank]]. The brother of the [[2022 Tel Aviv shooting]]'s perpetrator is among those killed. [https://www.ynetnews.com/article/sjqp7o11mj#autoplay (YNetNews)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/9/28/israeli-forces-kill-palestinians-jenin-raid (Al Jazeera)]

One person is killed and two others are injured when a gunman opens fire against Chinese-Pakistani nationals at a [[dental clinic]] in [[Karachi]], [[Sindh]], [[Pakistan]]. All of the victims were in their 70s and had worked for the clinic for more than 40 years. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-63066745 (BBC News)]

Authorities in [[Cameroon]] ban "undeclared meetings and manifestations" in [[Bamenda]], the capital of the [[Northwest Region (Cameroon)|Northwest Region]], after [[separatist]]s announced a manifestation to commemorate the declaration of independence of [[Ambazonia]], a [[breakaway state]] consisting of the [[English language|English-speaking]] [[regions of Cameroon]]. [https://english.news.cn/20220929/b08e44d0230743fa9141a86dc3f0a069/c.html (Xinhua)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] strike a residential neighborhood in [[Dnipro]] with a [[cruise missile]], killing a family of four, including two children, and injuring 18 other [[civilian]]s, according to local authorities. [https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-ato/3582160-four-killed-18-injured-in-enemy-strike-on-dnipro.html (Ukrinform)] [https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2022/09/29/7369625/ (Ukrainska Pravda)]

Three people are killed and 12 others are injured by a [[Russia]]n [[cluster munition]] attack on a bus stop in [[Mykolaiv]], according to mayor Oleksandr Sienkievych. [https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2022/09/29/7369681/ (Ukrainska Pravda)]

[[Finland]] announces that it will deny entry to Russian [[tourism in Finland|tourists]] beginning on Thursday night, thereby cutting off the last direct link between Russia and the [[European Union]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/finland-will-shut-border-russian-tourists-midnight-2022-09-29/ (Reuters)]

[[Iran]]'s [[Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps]] launches [[ballistic missile]]s at [[Erbil]], the capital of [[Iraq]]'s [[Kurdistan Region]], killing nine civilians and injuring 32 others. The [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Iraq)|Iraqi Foreign Ministry]] says that it will summon the Iranian ambassador in response to the attacks. [https://www.rferl.org/a/iran-iraq-kurds-shelling/32058062.html (RFE/RL)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] launch 16 missiles at areas near the city of [[Zaporizhzhia]], including a gathering point for [[civilian]]s preparing to cross into [[Russian occupation of Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Russian-occupied territory]], where at least 25 people are killed and 50 others are injured. [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russian-missile-strike-civilian-convoy-ukraine-zaporizhzhia-rcna50132 (NBC News)]

[[President of Ukraine|Ukrainian President]] [[Volodymyr Zelenskyy]] requests fast-track [[NATO]] membership following the [[Russian annexation of Southern and Eastern Ukraine]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/world-63077272 (BBC News)]

[[Uzbekistan]] says that it will not [[deport]] [[Russians]] fleeing [[conscription]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/uzbekistan-says-wont-deport-russians-fleeing-conscription-2022-09-30/ (Reuters)]

Twenty-six people are killed and 56 others are injured by a [[Suicide bombing|suicide bomber]] at a school in [[Dashte Barchi]], [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://edition.cnn.com/2022/09/30/asia/kabul-explosion-education-center-intl-hnk/index.html (CNN)]

Four people are killed when armed rebels open fire on civilians in [[West Papua (province)|West Papua]], [[Indonesia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/four-shot-dead-indonesias-restive-papua-region-police-2022-09-30/ (Reuters)]

Junta leader [[Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba]] is removed from office in a [[coup d'état]] after gunfire in the [[Burkina Faso|Burkinabé]] capital of [[Ouagadougou]]. Coup leader [[Ibrahim Traoré]] imposes a curfew, suspends all political civil society activities as well as the Constitution, and closes all land and air borders. [https://apnews.com/article/united-nations-general-assembly-ouagadougou-africa-west-e50ee2eb815152a594a2b441304f4868 (AP)] [https://www.france24.com/en/africa/20220930-shots-fired-near-burkina-faso-s-presidential-palace-in-ouagadougou (France24)]

Nineteen people are killed and 32 more injured when three gunmen attack a police station and [[mass shooting|open fire]] in a [[mass shooting]] in [[Zahedan]], [[Iran]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/1/19-killed-including-four-elite-guard-members-in-iran-attack (Al Jazeera)]

[[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] recapture [[Lyman, Ukraine|Lyman]] after weeks of fighting for the city and one day after the [[Annexation of Southern and Eastern Ukraine|annexation]] of the [[Donetsk People's Republic]] to [[Russia]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2022/oct/01/russia-ukraine-war-ukrainians-advance-on-lyman-after-putins-annexations-live (''The Guardian'')]
The [[Ministry of Defence of Russia]] says that it has withdrawn troops from the town of Lyman due to "a threat of encirclement". [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-63102220 (BBC News)]

After the defeat in Lyman, the [[head of Chechnya]], [[Ramzan Kadyrov]], calls on the Russian government to introduce [[Martial law in Russia|martial law]] and use [[Tactical nuclear weapon|low-yield nuclear weapons]] in [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.mk.ru/politics/2022/10/01/kadyrov-posle-limana-prizval-ispolzovat-yadernoe-oruzhie.html (Moskovskij Komsomolets)] [https://edition.cnn.com/2022/10/01/europe/ukraine-russia-lyman-donetsk-intl/index.html (CNN)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-says-its-troops-left-lyman-avoid-encirclement-2022-10-01/ (Reuters)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2022/10/1/ukraine-blog-3 (Al Jazeera)]

A civilian convoy of seven cars attacked by Russian forces is discovered in [[Kupiansk Raion]] in [[Kharkiv Oblast]] with 24 people being killed, including a [[Pregnancy|pregnant]] woman and 13 children, according to local governor [[Oleh Synyehubov]]. [https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2022/10/1/7369956/ (Ukrainska Pravda)]

An 18-year-old man is killed by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in [[East Jerusalem]], making him the 100th [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] killed in the [[West Bank]] this year. It is the deadliest toll of Palestinians killed there by Israeli's raids since 2015. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-63073541 (BBC News)]

[[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] recapture [[Khreshchenivka]] as they continue to advance southwards in the [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Russian-occupied]] [[Kherson Oblast]], with [[Russia]]'s [[49th Combined Arms Army]] reportedly withdrawing some troops from the frontline to [[Beryslav]]. [https://www.forbes.com/sites/davidaxe/2022/10/02/ukrainian-forces-are-advancing-in-southern-ukraine/?sh=3960572844ab (Forbes)]

A taxi driver is shot and wounded by [[Palestinian]] militants near [[Elon Moreh]] in the [[West Bank]]. A demonstration by local [[Israeli settlers]] to protest the incident is attacked with gunfire, wounding a soldier. A Palestinian group called The Lion's Den claims responsibility for the incident. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/gunmen-target-taxi-bus-in-west-bank-suspected-terror-attack-1-lightly-injured/ (''Times of Israel'')] [https://www.timesofisrael.com/soldier-lightly-hurt-in-west-bank-shooting-after-earlier-attack-nearby/ (''Times of Israel 2'')]

A video emerges showing [[Azerbaijani Armed Forces|Azerbaijani soldiers]] [[Extrajudicial killing|executing]] unarmed [[Armed Forces of Armenia|Armenian]] [[prisoners of war]] during clashes between [[Azerbaijan]] and [[Armenia]] last month. [https://www.scmp.com/news/world/russia-central-asia/article/3194609/armenian-eu-envoy-demands-answers-over-alleged (''South China Morning Post'')]

A mass grave of 42 people is found in [[Sirte]], [[Libya]], after arrested [[Islamic State]] militants tip off authorities. [https://apnews.com/article/islamic-state-group-nato-middle-east-africa-libya-b84251ddb5d46742a75d660c2c48f2a4 (AP)]

[[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian forces]] advance more than {{conv|20|km|mi}} along the [[Dnieper]] towards [[Dudchany]], [[Kherson Oblast]], in what is being called a "major breakthrough". [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-celebrates-capturing-key-town-putin-ally-mulls-possible-nuclear-response-2022-10-02/ (Reuters)]

The [[Ministry of Defence (Russia)|Russian Defence Ministry]] [[dismissal (employment)|dismisses]] [[Colonel General]] [[Alexander Zhuravlyov]] in response to a series of military defeats in [[Ukraine]]. He is replaced as commander of the [[Western Military District]] by [[Major General]] [[Roman Berdnikov]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-sacks-commander-its-western-district-forces-rbc-2022-10-03/ (Reuters)]

Twenty people are killed and 36 others are injured by two [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[Suicide bombing|suicide bombers]] when fifty-six gunmen and [[drug gang]]s [[mass shooting|open fire]] in a [[mass shooting]] at the local government [[headquarters]] in [[Beledweyne]]. The health minister of [[Hirshabelle]] and [[Hiran, Somalia|Hiran]]'s deputy governor for finance and security are among the dead. [https://apnews.com/article/africa-somalia-mogadishu-al-shabab-e90d71c518bd4035ed3dc359d2093894 (AP)] [https://shabellemedia.com/ten-including-regional-minister-killed-in-somalia-attack/ (Shabelle Media Network)]

Two [[Palestinians]] are killed and another is wounded as [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] open fire against a vehicle in the [[Jalazone|Jalazone refugee camp]], [[Ramallah and al-Bireh Governorate]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/3/israeli-forces-kill-two-palestinians-near-ramallah (Al Jazeera)]

[[North Korea]] launches a suspected [[ballistic missile]] towards [[Japan]] with the [[Government of Japan|Japanese government]] warning residents in [[Hokkaido]] and [[Aomori Prefecture|Aomori]] prefectures to immediately seek shelter. It later landed in the [[Pacific]]. The launch comes after a series of balloon launches and placard protests from [[South Korea]] and various [[military exercise]]s involving the US. [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-10-03/northern-japan-residents-warned-to-shelter-from-n-korea-missile-l8tcy12e (Bloomberg)] [https://wnyt.com/us-news/n-korea-sends-missile-soaring-over-japan-in-escalation/ (WNYT-TV)] [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-63126534 (BBC News)]

Ten people are injured when a [[homemade explosive device]] [[explode]]s in [[Butembo]], [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/homemade-explosive-device-east-congo-injures-least-three-2022-10-03/ (Reuters)]

The [[Government of Colombia]] and the [[National Liberation Army (Colombia)|National Liberation Army]] (ELN) announce the resumption of peace talks in [[Caracas]], [[Venezuela]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/colombias-government-eln-rebel-group-reestablish-peace-talks-2022-10-04/ (Reuters)]

The [[Federation Council (Russia)|Federation Council of Russia]] unanimously approves the [[annexation]] of Ukraine's [[Donetsk People's Republic|Donetsk]], [[Luhansk People's Republic|Luhansk]], [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Kherson]], and [[Russian occupation of Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Zaporizhzhia]] regions. The annexation documents will now receive final signing by [[President of Russia|President]] [[Vladimir Putin]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russias-federation-council-ratifies-annexation-four-ukrainian-regions-2022-10-04/ (Reuters)]

[[Ukraine]]'s [[Ukrainian Naval Infantry|35th Marine Brigade]] recaptures the village of [[Davydiv Brid]] in [[Beryslav Raion]], [[Kherson Oblast]], as it continues its ground offensive. The [[Ministry of Internal Affairs (Ukraine)|Ukrainian Interior Ministry]] says that around 3,500 citizens have been freed from [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Russian occupation]] in recent days. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-63137061 (BBC News)]

[[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] recapture the strategic village of [[Dudchany]] on the west bank of the [[Dnieper]] following the withdrawal of [[Russian forces]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/4/russian-army-maps-show-major-retreats-in-ukraines-kherson-region (Al Jazeera)]

[[President of Russia|Russian President]] [[Vladimir Putin]] signs a law formally [[annexation|annexing]] the [[Donetsk People's Republic]], [[Luhansk People's Republic]], [[Kherson Oblast|Kherson]], and [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Zaporizhzhia]] into Russia. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russias-putin-signs-law-annexing-four-ukrainian-regions-2022-10-05/ (Reuters)]

More than 50 people are killed in an [[Ethiopian Air Force]] [[airstrike]] on a school being used as an [[IDP camp]] in [[La'ilay Adiyabo]], [[Tigray Region]], [[Ethiopia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/more-than-50-killed-northern-ethiopia-air-strike-say-aid-workers-tigray-forces-2022-10-05/ (Reuters)]

[[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] surround a house in the village of [[Deir al-Hatab]], killing a man and wounding four residents and two [[Palestinian Satellite Channel]] journalists who were covering the operation. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/5/israeli-soldiers-kill-palestinian-man-wound-two-journalists (Al Jazeera)]

Eighteen people are killed, including the town's mayor, and three others injured, when a Los Tequileros [[drug gang]] [[mass shooting|open fire]] in a [[mass shooting]] at the town hall in [[San Miguel Totolapan]], [[Guerrero]], [[Mexico]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-63153362 (BBC)]

Four people are killed and 25 others are injured by a [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] at a [[government of Afghanistan|government]] ministry's [[mosque]] in [[Kabul]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/5/several-killed-in-bombing-at-afghan-interior-ministry-mosque (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Nigerian military]] says it has secured the release of the last 23 passengers taken [[hostage]] in late March. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/nigerian-military-says-last-hostages-march-train-attack-freed-2022-10-05/ (Reuters)]

Three [[United Nations peacekeepers]] from [[Bangladesh]] are killed in a bombing while on patrol in the [[Central African Republic]] on Monday. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/roadside-bomb-kills-three-un-peacekeepers-central-african-republic-2022-10-05/ (Reuters)]

Russian forces [[shell (projectile)|shell]] residential buildings in [[Zaporizhzhia]], killing at least three people, injuring twelve others, and causing widespread fires. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/shelling-ukraines-zaporizhzhia-causes-fires-injuries-official-2022-10-06/ (Reuters)]

A [[United States Air Force]] [[airstrike]] and helicopter raid kill two senior [[Islamic State]] leaders in [[Qamishli]], [[Syria]], including the Islamic State's deputy leader in Syria. [[United States Central Command|CENTCOM]] says that no civilians nor any U.S. military personnel were killed or injured in the operation. [https://edition.cnn.com/2022/10/06/politics/us-isis-raid-syria/index.html (CNN)]

An [[airstrike]] kills at least five people and injures 37 others in [[Tigray Region]], [[Ethiopia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/air-strike-ethiopias-tigray-region-kills-least-5-people-doctor-2022-10-07/ (Reuters)]

During two separate shootings, a 14-year-old [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] boy is killed by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in a village near [[Ramallah]], in the [[West Bank]], while a 17-year-old Palestinian boy is killed and his mother wounded when Israeli soldiers open fire at residents during confrontations with [[Israeli settlement|Israeli settlers]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/7/israeli-forces-kill-two-palestinian-teens-in-occupied-west-bank (Al Jazeera)]

Two [[Philippine Army|soldiers]] are killed and three [[civilian]]s are injured when five [[drug gang]]s open fire during a attack on a senator's convoy in clashes with [[airstrikes]], gunmen and [[prison riot]]s in a [[mass shooting]] and mass stabbing between the military and the [[New People's Army]] in [[Eastern Samar]], [[Philippines]]. [https://english.news.cn/20221007/962db7dae66b4eefa30ea59b8dc34a67/c.html (Xinhua)]

The [[Somali Armed Forces]] kill 19 [[al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] militants in [[Balad, Somalia|Bal'ad]], [[Middle Shabelle]], in a repelled attack amid ongoing operations against the [[jihadist]] group. [https://allafrica.com/stories/202210070556.html (allAfrica)]

Seven [[Djibouti Armed Forces|soldiers]] are killed and four injured during an attack at an army base in Garabtisan, [[Djibouti]], by [[Front for the Restoration of Unity and Democracy|Armed FRUD]] gunmen. Both the attackers are killed. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/8/djibouti-says-seven-soldiers-killed-in-armed-group-attack (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Kerch Strait Bridge]] is hit by an [[explosion]], resulting in a fire and the partial collapse of a road section. Three people are killed. The cause is currently unknown, with a [[Russia]]n investigative committee saying it was a Ukrainian [[truck bomb]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/oct/08/crimea-kerch-bridge-explosions-russia-ukraine (''The Guardian'')]

The death toll from last Thursday's shelling by Russian forces of a residential area in [[Zaporizhzhia]] rises to 17 civilians, including a child.  [https://www.timesofisrael.com/russian-missiles-kill-17-ukrainians-in-residential-area-near-nuclear-plant/ (''The Times of Israel'')]

Two 17-year-old [[Palestinians]] are killed and 11 more injured during a raid when three gunmen [[mass shooting|open fire]] in a [[mass shooting]] at a refugee camp in [[Jenin]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/8/two-palestinians-killed-by-israel-army-in-west-bank (Al Jazeera)]

A shooting attack by [[Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades]] militants kills an Israeli soldier and injures two [[Israel Border Police|police officers]] and a guard. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/2-seriously-hurt-in-shooting-attack-in-east-jerusalem/ (''Times of Israel'')]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[missile]] attack kills at least 13 people and injures 89 others in [[Zaporizhzhia]], [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russias-ria-state-agency-reports-fuel-tank-fire-kerch-bridge-crimea-2022-10-08/ (Reuters)]

[[President of Russia|Russian president]] [[Vladimir Putin]] formally accuses [[Ukraine]], and specifically the [[Security Service of Ukraine]], of being behind the explosion on the [[Crimean Bridge]] that killed three people and partially destroyed part of the bridge, saying that the explosion was an "act of terrorism". [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-63195504 (BBC News)]

[[Secretary-General of the United Nations|UN Secretary-General]] [[António Guterres]] proposes a "rapid action force" of several countries that could intervene in [[Haiti]] in order to help the [[Haitian National Police]] restore control of the country and remove the threat posed by "armed gangs". [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/un-chief-urges-security-council-consider-haiti-request-specialized-armed-force-2022-10-09/ (Reuters)]

The [[Russian Armed Forces]] launch [[missile]] strikes on the [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] cities and towns of [[Kyiv]], [[Kharkiv]], [[Khmelnytskyi]], [[Zhytomyr]], [[Zaporizhzhia]], [[Ivano-Frankivsk]], [[Sumy]], [[Dnipro]], [[Lviv]], [[Ternopil]] and [[Poltava]], killing at least nineteen people and injuring hundreds more. [https://www.unian.ua/war/lviv-zaraz-u-lvovi-lunayut-vibuhi-misto-bez-svitla-novini-lvova-12005961.html (Unian)] [https://www.ukrinform.ua/rubric-regions/3589824-u-harkovi-pisla-obstrilu-nemae-elektriki-ta-vodi.html (UkrInform)] [https://ru.interfax.com.ua/news/general/864348.html (Interfax)] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/oct/10/explosions-kyiv-ukraine-war-russia-crimea-putin-bridge (''The Guardian'')] [https://www.ft.com/content/24da8f9c-e27b-4522-a520-d2d29f8f2469 (''Financial Times'')] [https://www.kyivpost.com/russias-war/8-reported-killed-in-kyiv-as-russians-launch-massive-missile-attack-on-ukrainian-cities.html (Kyiv Post)]

[[Moldova]] confirms that [[Russian Navy]] warships in the [[Black Sea]] fired [[cruise missile]]s through its [[airspace]] to strike targets inside Ukraine. The Russian ambassador is subsequently summoned by Moldovan authorities to explain the violation. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/moldova-says-three-russian-cruise-missiles-crossed-moldovan-air-space-2022-10-10/ (Reuters)]

Thousands of [[Russian Ground Forces|Russian troops]] enter [[Belarus]] by the "trainload" as [[President of Ukraine|Ukrainian President]] [[Volodymyr Zelenskyy]] warns [[G7]] nations that [[Russia]] is planning on launching another offensive against [[Kyiv]] with direct Belarusian involvement. The troop movements come a day after [[President of Belarus|Belarusian President]] [[Alexander Lukashenko]] accused [[Ukraine]] of planning to launch an attack on the country. [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ukraine-news-russia-war-latest-b2200068.html?page=4#post-874349 (''The Independent'')]

[[Lviv]] experiences a major [[power outage]] after a Russian missile strike damages "critical infrastructure". [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-strike-ukraines-lviv-hits-power-supply-mayor-says-2022-10-11/ (Reuters)]

[[Russia]] adds [[Meta Platforms]], the parent company of [[Instagram]] and [[Facebook]], to its list of "terrorists and extremists" for tolerating [[Russophobia]] and allowing calls to violence against Russians. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/11/russia-adds-meta-to-list-of-terrorist-and-extremist-groups (Al Jazeera)]

The UN [[Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs]] says that renewed fighting between [[tribe]]s has [[internally displaced person|displaced]] more than 8,000 [[civilian]]s in [[South Sudan]]. [https://english.news.cn/20221011/0f9d1ae5219041ba99af770008787809/c.html (Xinhua)]

An [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldier]] is killed by two [[Lions' Den (militant group)|Lions' Den]] gunmen near the [[Israeli settlement]] of [[Shavei Shomron]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/11/palestinian-fighters-kill-israeli-soldier-in-occupied-west-bank (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russia]] says that it has arrested eight people, five [[Russians]] and three people from [[Ukraine]] and [[Armenia]], over the [[Crimea Bridge]] explosion. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2022/10/12/Russia-detains-eight-suspects-over-Crimea-bridge-blasts (Reuters via Al Arabiya)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] strike a marketplace in [[Avdiivka]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], killing at least seven [[civilian]]s and injuring eight others. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-strike-crowded-market-town-avdiivka-kills-7-ukrainian-governor-2022-10-12/ (Reuters)]

[[President of France|French President]] [[Emmanuel Macron]] announces that [[France]] will send [[radar]] and [[air defense]] systems to Ukraine "in the coming weeks". [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/france-deliver-anti-air-systems-ukraine-coming-weeks-macron-2022-10-12/ (Reuters)]

The [[United Kingdom]]'s [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|Ministry of Defence]] announces that it will donate [[AIM-120 AMRAAM|AMRAAM]] [[air-to-air missile]]s to Ukraine in the coming weeks. The missiles are capable of intercepting [[cruise missiles]]. A further 18 [[howitzer]]s will also be donated to the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian military]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/britain-donate-air-defence-missiles-ukraine-2022-10-12/ (Reuters)]

[[Canada]] says that it will provide {{dollarsign|CAD}}47 million in new military aid to Ukraine including artillery rounds, winter clothing, drone cameras, and satellite communications. [https://www.reuters.com/world/canada-announces-new-military-package-ukraine-after-russian-missile-attacks-2022-10-12/ (Reuters)]

The [[United Nations General Assembly]] passes a [[United Nations resolution|resolution]] condemning Russia's "attempted illegal [[annexation]]" of Ukrainian territory. Only [[Belarus]], [[Nicaragua]], [[North Korea]], Russia and [[Syria]] voted against the resolution. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/12/un-condemns-russias-move-to-annex-parts-of-ukraine (Al Jazeera)]

[[Moldova]] urges its citizens to reduce their use of electricity after Ukraine suspended exports of electricity due to Russian missile attacks damaging [[critical infrastructure]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/moldovans-urged-cut-electricity-use-after-missile-strikes-ukraine-hit-supplies-2022-10-12/ (Reuters)]

Two people are killed and another is injured as a gunman opens fire outside an [[LGBT]] venue in [[Bratislava]], [[Slovakia]]. The perpetrator, who has committed suicide after the attack, is identified as a [[Right-wing terrorism|far-right extremist]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-63239523 (BBC)]

Fighting between the [[Eritrean Defence Forces]] and the [[Tigray People's Liberation Front]] is reported in [[Adigrat]], [[Rama, Ethiopia|Rama]], [[Sheraro]], and [[Zalambessa]] as [[Eritrea]] intensifies military mobilisation. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-63208353 (BBC)]

An 18-year-old [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] is killed and another is injured near [[Hebron]], as [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] storm the [[Al-Arroub (camp)|Al-Arroub refugee camp]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/palestinians-protest-jerusalem-refugee-camp-locked-down-2022-10-12/ (Reuters)]

[[Russia]] announces that it will [[emergency evacuation|evacuate]] civilians from [[Kherson]] to "other regions of the country" following an appeal from [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Kherson Military-Civilian Administration]] leader [[Volodymyr Saldo]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/oct/13/russia-announces-kherson-evacuation-raising-fears-city-will-become-frontline?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other (''The Guardian'')]

[[State terrorism|Russian forces]] launch eight missiles at [[Mykolaiv]], hitting a five-story residential building. One of the victims was an 11-year-old boy, who was rescued with broken legs after spending hours under the rubble, but later died in a hospital due to [[heart failure]]. [https://www.nytimes.com/live/2022/10/13/world/russia-ukraine-war-news/russian-missiles-strike-apartment-building-in-mykolaiv#russian-missiles-strike-apartment-building-in-mykolaiv (''The New York Times'')] [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russia-ukraine-war-mykolaiv-strike-boy-pulled-rubble-putin-revenge-rcna52154 (''NBC News'')]

The [[jihadism|jihadist]] group [[Tahrir al-Sham]] captures the city of [[Afrin, Syria|Afrin]] in [[Aleppo Governorate]], [[Syria]], following days of clashes with the [[Turkey|Turkish]]-backed [[Syrian National Army]], according to the [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights]]. [https://www.voanews.com/a/jihadist-group-takes-over-strategic-town-in-northwest-syria/6788541.html (Voice of America)]

Tahrir al-Sham forces capture the town of [[Jindires]] amid ongoing clashes in the region. [https://english.almayadeen.net/news/politics/hts-storms-jindires-calls-for-reinforcements-in-aleppo-count (Al Mayadeen)]

Eighteen [[Syrian Army|soldiers]] are killed and 20 others are injured when a bomb explodes on a military bus near [[Damascus]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/several-soldiers-dead-wounded-explosion-targeting-military-bus-syria-state-media-2022-10-13/ (Reuters)]

Eleven people are killed and 53 more injured as a bus hit a [[Improvised explosive device|roadside bomb]] on a road between [[Bandiagara]] and [[Goundaka]], in the [[Mopti Region]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/14/mali-bus-blast-kills-at-least-11-people-hospital-source (AFP via Al Jazeera)]

Two people are killed and five others are injured in an exchange of fire between [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] and Palestinian militants in [[Jenin]], [[West Bank]], following a raid conducted by the former. The Israeli soldiers aimed to capture a [[Hamas]] operative suspected of involvement in recent shootings; he was subsequently detained and taken into custody. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/14/israeli-forces-kill-two-palestinians-in-occupied-west-bank-raid (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.ynetnews.com/article/bjswv9ixs#autoplay (Ynetnews)]

Three people are killed and six others are injured by a [[roadside bomb]] near a convoy carrying the relatives of a man who was killed yesterday in [[Mastung, Pakistan|Mastung]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-ea17de05d2380e5d47be4275bebddfb3 (AP)]

At least 11 people are killed and 15 others injured after two shooters open fire on a group of volunteers at a [[Russian military]] training ground in [[Belgorod Oblast]], near the border with [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/least-11-killed-attack-russian-military-training-ground-ria-2022-10-15/ (Reuters)]

Gunfire breaks out amid a fire at the [[Evin Prison]] in [[Tehran]], [[Iran]], resulting in the death of eight inmates and the wounding of 61 more. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-63282931 (BBC News)]

Five people are killed and nine others are injured in tribal clashes in [[West Kordofan]], [[Sudan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/least-five-killed-tribal-violence-sudans-west-kordofan-2022-10-15/ (Reuters)]

Twelve people are killed and three are injured in a [[mass shooting]] at a bar in [[Irapuato]], [[Guanajuato]], [[Mexico]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/eleven-shot-dead-mexico-bar-attack-gang-plagued-state-2022-10-16/ (Reuters)]

[[Donetsk People's Republic]] authorities say that a Ukrainian rocket attack hit the office of the pro-[[Russia]]n mayor of [[Donetsk]]. No casualties have been reported. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-kyiv-donetsk-e2f0a99af2f190e70aabd199c3c03de1 (AP)]

The [[United States]] and [[Canada]] send military equipment to [[Haiti]], including tactical and armoured vehicles, as violence and [[shortage]]s continue to worsen in the country. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/16/us-canada-send-military-aircraft-to-crisis-torn-haiti (Al Jazeera)]

The U.S. drafts a [[United Nations Security Council resolution|resolution]] at the [[United Nations Security Council]] to approve the deployment of a "multinational rapid action force" to Haiti, citing ongoing "instability and violence" in the country. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2022/10/15/haiti-biden-un-security-resolution/ (''The Washington Post'')]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] attack the [[Shevchenkivskyi District, Kyiv]], and an energy facility in the city of [[Sumy]] with [[HESA Shahed 136]] [[Loitering munition|suicide drones]], killing eight people. [https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-63280523 (BBC News)] [https://www.cnbc.com/2022/10/17/kyivs-central-district-rocked-by-blasts-for-the-second-time-in-week.html (CNBC)]

The [[European Union]] establishes [[European Union Military Assistance Mission Ukraine|EUMAM Ukraine]], a special military mission that will provide training for the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian Armed Forces]] in EU member states. [https://www.consilium.europa.eu/en/press/press-releases/2022/10/17/ukraine-eu-sets-up-a-military-assistance-mission-to-further-support-the-ukrainian-armed-forces/ (Council of the EU/the European Council)]

After killing hundreds of civilians and forcing thousands to flee, the [[Islamic State in the Greater Sahara]] is reported to have captured the town of [[Ansongo]] in eastern [[Mali]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/islamist-militants-mali-kill-hundreds-displace-thousands-eastern-advance-2022-10-14/ (Reuters)]

Four [[Chad]]ian [[United Nations peacekeeping|United Nations peacekeepers]] are killed and two others are injured in a [[Improvised explosive device|roadside bombing]] near [[Tessalit]], [[Kidal Region]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/death-toll-rises-four-un-peacekeepers-killed-mali-attack-2022-10-18/ (Reuters)]

[[Ethiopian National Defense Force|Ethiopian government forces]] capture the city of [[Shire Inda Selassie|Shire]] from the [[Tigray Defense Forces]]. [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/ethiopian-army-captures-large-city-from-tigray-forces-sources/ar-AA13344d (Reuters via MSN)]

[[Secretary-General of the United Nations|United Nations Secretary-General]] [[António Guterres]] calls for "armed action" to establish a [[humanitarian corridor]] in [[Haiti]], saying [[Haitians]] face a "nightmarish situation", especially in the capital, [[Port-au-Prince]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/17/un-chief-calls-for-armed-action-in-haiti-as-crisis-persists (Al Jazeera)]

[[Ukraine]] accuses [[Russia]] of [[kidnapping]] two senior employees of the [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]]. [https://www.barrons.com/articles/ukraine-says-russia-kidnapped-two-nuclear-plant-workers-01666073707 (Agence France Presse via ''Barron's'')]

Three people are killed and critical infrastructure is destroyed by [[Russia]]n missiles in [[Kyiv]], causing fires, [[explosion]]s, and [[power outage]]s. Several other cities across [[Ukraine]] are also hit in targeted attacks against water supplies and energy facilities, with [[power outage]]s being reported in 1,162 towns and villages. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-attacks-energy-facility-northern-kyiv-presidential-aide-2022-10-18/ (Reuters)] [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-63297239 (BBC News)]

[[Iran]] agrees to provide Russia with medium-range [[missile]]s, [[surface-to-surface missile]]s and [[Unmanned combat aerial vehicle|combat drones]] for the war in Ukraine. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/oct/18/iran-agrees-to-supply-missiles-as-well-as-drones-to-russia (''The Guardian'')]

Two people are killed in a [[grenade]] attack in [[Shopian]], [[Jammu and Kashmir (union territory)|Jammu and Kashmir]], [[India]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/india/militants-indian-kashmir-kill-two-migrant-workers-2022-10-18/ (Reuters)]

Multiple people are killed and 10 others are abducted after gunmen storm a hospital in [[Niger State]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/gunmen-abduct-least-10-hospital-workers-nigerias-niger-state-2022-10-18/ (Reuters)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] begin [[emergency evacuation|evacuating]] thousands of [[civilian]]s from occupied areas of [[Kherson Oblast]], according to Russian-installed governor [[Volodymyr Saldo]]. Ukraine calls on residents to ignore the Russian orders to leave their towns and villages. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-63311744 (BBC News)]

[[President of Russia|Russian President]] [[Vladimir Putin]] introduces [[Martial law in Russia|martial law]], beginning Thursday at midnight, in the [[Russian annexation of Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia oblasts|recently annexed]] territories of [[Ukraine]]. Additionally, an "intermediate level of preparedness" is introduced in [[Crimea]] and the [[Federal subjects of Russia|federal subjects]] bordering Ukraine. [https://apnews.com/b48b555f547ff6a1a59b1cad17d0e269 (AP)] [https://theins.ru/news/256185 (''The Insider'')]

[[Prime Minister of the Bahamas]] [[Philip Davis (Bahamian politician)|Philip Davis]] says that he is ready to send [[Royal Bahamas Defence Force|troops]] to [[Haiti]] as part of a peacekeeping force if asked to do so by the [[Caribbean Community]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/bahamas-would-send-troops-haiti-if-asked-minister-says-2022-10-18/ (Reuters)]

Three staff members and five visitors are killed by two bomb explosions inside [[Insein Prison]] in [[Yangon]], [[Myanmar]]. Ten others are injured. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/19/at-least-8-killed-in-myanmar-insein-prison-blast-media-reports (Al Jazeera)]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russia]]n [[missile]] strikes a major [[thermal power station]] in [[Burshtyn]], [[Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast]], [[Ukraine]], causing "quite serious damage", according to [[governor]] [[Svitlana Onyshchuk]]. The [[United States]] reports that [[Islamic Republic of Iran Armed Forces|Iranian troops]] are in [[Crimea]], assisting the [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian military]] in using Iranian [[Unmanned combat aerial vehicle|drones]]. [https://thehill.com/policy/international/3697453-white-house-says-iranian-troops-on-the-ground-in-crimea-aiding-russian-drone-strikes/ (The Hill)]

A 17-year-old protester, Abolfazl Adinezadeh, is killed in the city of [[Mashhad]] by [[Basij|Iranian security forces]], who shot him at [[point-blank range]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-63328086 (BBC News)]

[[Opposition to Vladimir Putin in Russia|Anti-Kremlin]] [[Bashkirs|Bashkir]] [[Free Idel-Ural|nationalists]] announce the creation of "The Committee of Bashkir Resistance", with the aim of [[Dissolution of Russia|achieving independence]] for [[Bashkortostan]], although the committee had already been established in September. Two people are wounded in a [[car bombing]] in [[Sulaymaniyah]], [[Kurdistan Region]], [[Iraq]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/car-bomb-injures-two-northern-iraq-security-sources-2022-10-20/ (Reuters)]

[[Prime Minister of Chad|Chadian Prime Minister]] [[Saleh Kebzabo]] says that about 50 people have been killed during anti-[[government of Chad|government]] protests in the country. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/chad-police-fire-tear-gas-pro-democracy-protests-2022-10-20/ (Reuters)]

[[Power outage]]s are reported across Ukraine and citizens are advised to store water as [[Russia]]n [[airstrike]]s across the country continue to damage critical infrastructure and energy facilities. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukrainian-infrastructure-pounded-again-saturday-2022-10-22/ (Reuters)]

The [[Taliban]] kill six [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|ISKP]] members during a raid in [[Kabul]], saying they were responsible for the [[September 2022 Kabul mosque bombing|bombings of a mosque]] [[September 2022 Kabul school bombing|and school]] in the city last month. Nine people are killed and over 40 others injured by an [[al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[suicide attack|suicide]] [[car bomb]]ing and shooting attack at the Tawakal Hotel in [[Kismayo]], [[Jubaland]], [[Somalia]]. The three [[insurgent]] gunmen are killed during a [[gunfight]] with security forces. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/car-explosion-gunfire-hit-hotel-somalias-kismayu-port-city-police-say-2022-10-23/ (Reuters)]

Tamer al-Kilani, a founding member of the [[Lions' Den (militant group)|Lions' Den]] [[militant group]], is killed by a bomb planted on a motorcycle in [[Nablus]], [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/23/israel-kills-palestinian-top-member-of-armed-group-in-west-bank (Al Jazeera)]

Osvaldo Villalba, a leader of the [[Marxism–Leninism|Marxist–Leninist]] [[Paraguayan People's Army]] rebel group, is killed alongside two other militants during a gunfight with soldiers in [[Amambay Department|Amambay]], [[Paraguay]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-63373068 (BBC)]

The death toll from the clashes over a [[land dispute]] between the [[Hausa people|Hausa]] and [[Berta people|Berta]] [[ethnic group]]s in [[Blue Nile (state)|Blue Nile]], [[Sudan]], increases to 220. It is one of the deadliest incidents of [[ethnic violence]] in the country during the last years. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/23/death-toll-in-sudan-tribal-clashes-rises-to-220 (Al Jazeera)]

[[Jair Bolsonaro|Pro-Bolsonaro]] [[Brazil]]ian politician [[Roberto Jefferson]] wounds two federal policemen with [[rifle]]s and [[grenade]]s, who [[Siege#Police activity|besieged]] his house in an attempt to arrest him for violating terms of his [[house arrest]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/oct/24/brazil-politician-attacks-police-rifle-grenades-roberto-jefferson (''The Guardian'')]

At least 28 people are killed, including ten [[Burkina Faso Armed Forces|soldiers]], and at least 50 others are injured, after gunmen attack a [[military base]] in [[Djibo]], [[Burkina Faso]]. Eighteen attackers are killed in the ensuing gunfight. [https://www.panapress.com/28-dead-including-10-Burkinabe-s-a_630733421-lang2.html (Panapress)] [https://news.yahoo.com/ten-soldiers-killed-50-wounded-173330816.html (Reuters via Yahoo! News)]

At least 50 people are killed and at least 100 others are injured when the [[Tatmadaw|military]] launches [[airstrike]]s at a concert in [[Kachin State]] celebrating the 62nd anniversary of the founding of the [[separatist]] [[Kachin Independence Army]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-63370732 (BBC News)]

A [[United States Air Force]] [[airstrike]] kills two [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[jihadist]]s in [[Buloburde]], [[Hiran, Somalia|Hiran]], [[Somalia]]. The [[United States Africa Command]] says that the [[terrorist]]s were attacking [[Somali National Army|Somali soldiers]]. [https://www.voanews.com/a/us-targets-al-shabab-in-somalia-airstrike-killing-2-/6804750.html (VOA)]

A young woman belonging to [[Hizb ut-Tahrir]] attempts to shoot either the [[Presidential Security Force of Indonesia]] or the [[President of Indonesia]] [[Joko Widodo]] at the [[Istana Negara (Jakarta)|Istana Negara]] in [[Central Jakarta]], before being arrested. [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] raid a [[Lions' Den (militant group)|Lions' Den]] headquarter in [[Nablus]], [[West Bank]], killing three [[militant]]s, including one of the group's founders. Two [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] [[civilian]]s are also killed in nearby areas. Protests later occur in the town of [[Nabi Salih]], resulting in a Palestinian man being killed by Israeli soldiers. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-63383854 (BBC News)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/25/at-least-three-palestinians-killed-in-israeli-raids-on-nablus (Al Jazeera)]

Gunmen kill two [[Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps]] officers, including a [[colonel]], in [[Zahedan]], [[Sistan and Baluchestan province]], [[Iran]]. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2022/10/25/Two-IRGC-members-killed-in-Iran-s-Zahedan-Report (Al Arabiya)]

More than 30 people are killed and 15 others are reported missing after [[ritual warfare|tribal clashes]] on [[Kiriwina Island]] in [[Milne Bay Province]], [[Papua New Guinea]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/oct/25/more-than-30-dead-in-tribal-fighting-on-papua-new-guineas-kiriwina-island (''The Guardian'')]

A [[Russia]]n [[missile]] strike on [[Dnipro]] kills two people, including a pregnant woman. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2022/oct/26/russia-ukraine-war-live-news-russian-forces-battle-kherson-kyiv?page=with:block-6358ffef8f080759184ff9ac#block-6358ffef8f080759184ff9ac (''The Guardian'')]

At least 15 people are killed and 40 others are injured in a [[mass shooting]] by three gunmen at a [[Shah Cheragh]] [[Shia]] [[mosque]] in [[Shiraz]], [[Fars province]], [[Iran]]. Two of the attackers have been caught and the other remains at large. The [[Islamic State]] claims responsibility for the attack. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/26/attack-on-shiraz-shrine-kills-15-iranian-state-media (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] strike [[Kyiv]]'s energy system facilities and launch [[BM-30 Smerch]] missiles on [[Zaporizhzhia]] as [[Ukraine]] repels attacks in the [[Donbas]]. [https://www.rferl.org/a/ukraine-russia-strikes-kyiv-zaporizhzhia-crazy-tactics/32102668.html (RFE/RL)]

[[Israel]] carries out [[airstrike]]s near [[Damascus]], [[Syria]], killing four pro-[[Iran]]ian fighters. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2022/10/27/Four-pro-Iranian-fighters-killed-in-Israeli-strikes-near-Damascus-War-monitor (Al Arabiya)]

[[Canada]] sends a delegation to [[Haiti]] to assess the security situation and to "consult with stakeholders on options to support Haitian people in resolving the humanitarian and security crises", amid ongoing international talks on sending a [[peacekeeping]] force to the country. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/27/canada-sends-delegation-to-haiti-to-assess-security-crisis (Al Jazeera)]

[[United States Secretary of State|US Secretary of State]] [[Antony Blinken]] announces that the [[United States]] will provide another $275 million in additional military aid to [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/us-provide-ukraine-with-275-mln-military-aid-blinken-says-2022-10-28/ (Reuters)]

[[Ministry of Defence (Russia)|Russian Defence Minister]] [[Sergei Shoigu]] announces the end of the mobilization campaign as 300,000 reservists are reached. [https://www.abc.net.au/news/2022-10-29/zelenskyy-accuses-russia-of-mass-theft-of-medical-equipment/101593288 (ABC News Australia)]

Two [[Palestinian Civil Defence]] members are killed, and another is injured when [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] open fire on a vehicle at a [[security checkpoint|checkpoint]] in [[Nablus]], [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/28/israeli-forces-kill-two-palestinians-in-occupied-nablus (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russia]] accuses [[Ukraine]] of a [[drone attack]] on its [[Black Sea Fleet]] [[headquarters]] in [[Sevastopol]], [[Crimea]]. The [[Russian-occupied territories of Ukraine|Russian-installed]] [[Governor of Sevastopol (Russia)|Governor of Sevastopol]] [[Mikhail Razvozhayev]] says the [[Russian Navy]] repelled the attack, which he calls the "most massive" since the [[invasion]] began. Russia accuses the [[United Kingdom]]'s [[Royal Navy]] of blowing up the [[Nord Stream 1]] and [[Nord Stream 2]] gas pipelines in the [[Baltic Sea]] on September 26. The [[Government of the United Kingdom|British government]] denies both accusations. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-says-british-navy-personnel-blew-up-nord-stream-gas-pipelines-2022-10-29/ (Reuters)]

A [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] gunman kills an [[Israelis|Israeli]] [[Israeli settlement|settler]] in [[Kiryat Arba]], [[Hebron]], and injures four others, including a [[Palestinian]] [[paramedic]], before being killed by security forces. At least 100 people are killed and over 300 others are injured by an [[al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] double [[car bomb]]ing in [[Mogadishu]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/10/29/two-blasts-target-somalias-education-ministry-police/ (Al Jazeera)]

[[March 23 Movement|M23]] rebels capture the towns of Kiwanja and [[Rutshuru]] in [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. Five [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] are injured during a [[vehicle-ramming attack]] at a checkpoint in [[Jericho]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] damage [[critical infrastructure]] in [[Kyiv]] again, leaving parts of the capital without energy and water. A Russian [[cruise missile]] reportedly shot down by a Ukrainian anti-aircraft system crashes in the outskirts of [[Naslavcea]], [[Moldova]]. [[Norwegian prime minister|Norwegian Prime Minister]] [[Jonas Gahr Støre]] announces that [[Norway|the country]]'s military alert level will be increased tomorrow, in response to [[Unmanned combat aerial vehicle|military drone]] sightings near [[Oil platform|offshore oil rigs]] in the past few weeks. The Iranian [[Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps]] seizes an [[oil tanker]] in international waters that was transporting fuel to the [[Persian Gulf]]. [https://www.tasnimnews.com/en/news/2022/10/31/2796555/irgc-seizes-tanker-smuggling-fuel-in-persian-gulf (Tasnim)]

The [[List of prime ministers of Chad|Prime Minister]] of [[Chad]] [[Saleh Kebzabo]] confirms that government forces in North [[Tibesti Region|Tibesti]] have successfully found and subsequently freed hostage Jerome Hugonnot, a Franco-Australian conservationist, kidnapped in [[Wadi Fira]] three days prior. [[Kenyan authorities]] say that an [[ambulance]] carrying two [[paramedic]]s, a patient and a driver has been hijacked with its passengers by [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] in [[Mandera County]]. The [[United States]] says that [[North Korea]] is "secretly supplying" [[artillery shell]]s to [[Russia]] for use in Russia's war in [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.axios.com/2022/11/02/north-korea-russia-artillery-shells-ukraine-war (Axios)]

[[Ethiopia]] and the [[Tigray People's Liberation Front]] reach a "permanent" [[ceasefire]] agreement at [[African Union]]-brokered peace talks in [[South Africa]], exactly two years after the war began. [[North Korea]] fires 23 [[ballistic missile]]s into the [[Sea of Japan]] and [[Yellow Sea]], one of which crossed the [[Northern Limit Line]] (NLL), the de facto [[maritime boundary]] between North and [[South Korea]], for the first time. [[Civil defense siren|Air raid sirens]] were activated on the South Korean island of [[Ulleungdo]] and South Korean [[fighter jet]]s fired three [[air-to-surface missile]]s across the NLL in response to the missile launches. [[President of South Korea|South Korean President]] [[Yoon Suk-yeol]] calls for "swift action" to punish [[North Korea]] in response to the latest [[missile]] launches. [https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20221102005200315 (Yonhap News Agency)]

[[Kenya]] officially deploys [[Kenya Defence Forces|troops]] to the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]] to assist an [[East African Community]] peacekeeping mission. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/kenya-deploys-troops-congo-help-end-decades-bloodshed-2022-11-02/ (Reuters)]

Eight people are injured by a bus bombing in [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://www.republicworld.com/world-news/rest-of-the-world-news/8-injured-in-afghanistans-kabul-as-bomb-blast-hits-bus-carrying-taliban-govt-officials-articleshow.html (Republic World)]

One person is killed and two others are injured by a [[landmine]] [[explosion]] in [[Al Hudaydah]], [[Yemen]]. [https://en.mehrnews.com/news/193213/3-killed-injured-in-mine-explosion-in-Yemen (Mehr News Agency)]

[[North Korea]] launches an [[intercontinental ballistic missile]]  towards [[Japan]], prompting evacuation warnings for residents in the prefectures of [[Miyagi Prefecture|Miyagi]], [[Yamagata Prefecture|Yamagata]] and [[Niigata Prefecture|Niigata]]. The missile landed about {{convert|1100|km}} off the Japanese coast in the [[Pacific Ocean]], with the launch likely not successful. Three [[Palestinians]] are killed during raids by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in the [[West Bank]], while another is killed in [[East Jerusalem]] after stabbing and injuring a police officer. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/israeli-police-kill-palestinian-west-bank-raid-92586034 (ABC News)]

A 14-year-old [[Israeli Jews|Jewish]] girl is in [[critical condition]] after being shot in the head by a [[Palestinian]] [[sniper]] in [[Kiryat Arba]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.jewishpress.com/news/eye-on-palestine/palestinian-authority/jewish-girl-14-in-critical-condition-from-arab-snipers-shot-to-her-head-in-kiryat-arba/2022/11/03/ (Jewish Press)]

Former [[Prime Minister of Pakistan|Pakistani Prime Minister]] [[Imran Khan]] is shot in the leg during a rally in [[Wazirabad]], [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]]. Khan is taken to [[Lahore]] for treatment, although he was not seriously injured. A Khan supporter is killed and eight others are injured. The perpetrator is arrested. Two people are killed and five others are injured when a vehicle carrying students hits a [[roadside bomb]] in [[Mogadishu]], [[Somalia]]. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/police-explosion-somalias-capital-kills-students-92593713 (ABC News)]

A [[Shia Islam|Shi'ite]] [[Shia clergy|cleric]] is shot dead at a [[mosque]] in [[Zahedan]], [[Sistan and Baluchestan province]], [[Iran]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/iranian-human-rights-lawyers-criticise-clerical-leaders-amid-unrest-2022-11-03/ (Reuters)]

[[Syrian government]] [[Syrian Army|forces]] [[shell (projectile)|shell]] a [[internally displaced person|camp for displaced persons]] in rebel-held [[Idlib Governorate]], killing six occupants and injuring dozens of others. Following increased international pressure, [[Haiti]]an gang leader [[Jimmy Chérizier]] announces the end of a blockade that his gang had imposed on a key fuel station, leading to severe shortages. [https://abcnews.go.com/amp/International/wireStory/haiti-gang-leader-lift-fuel-blockade-amid-shortages-92766112 (ABC News)]

One person is killed and ten others are wounded in a bus bombing in [[Tacurong]], [[Sultan Kudarat]], [[Mindanao]], [[Philippines]]. [https://apnews.com/article/bombings-philippines-d1a07bde948a9401b1b8a1a9614ab8ff (AP)]

[[Ukraine]] confirms that it has received the first delivery of the [[NASAMS]] [[surface-to-air missile]] system, which will "significantly strengthen" its [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|armed forces]], according to Defence Minister [[Oleksii Reznikov]]. [https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/ukraine-receives-first-delivery-nasams-air-defence-systems-minister-2022-11-07/ (Reuters)]

Ten people are killed by [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] militants at a [[military base]] in [[Galguduud]], [[Somalia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/somali-army-repulse-al-shabaab-attack-military-base-defence-ministry-2022-11-07/ (Reuters)]

Unidentified warplanes launch [[airstrike]]s against [[Iran]]ian-backed [[militia]]s on the [[Iraq–Syria border]], including near the [[Al-Qa'im border crossing]], reportedly killing at least 25 people. [[Air Force of the Democratic Republic of the Congo|DRC Air Force]] [[Sukhoi Su-25]] jets bomb areas held by [[March 23 Movement|M23 rebels]] in [[North Kivu]], including the recently captured town of [[Bunagana, Democratic Republic of the Congo|Bunagana]].
