[https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20221108-dr-congo-jets-bomb-m23-rebels-in-east (France 24)]

Four people are killed and twelve others are injured by a bombing in [[Anambra State]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/blast-kills-four-others-injured-nigerias-southeast-official-says-2022-11-08/ (Reuters)]

[[Russian Ground Forces|Russian forces]] announce a [[Withdrawal (military)|retreat]] from the city of [[Kherson]], the western bank of the [[Dnieper|Dnieper River]] in [[Russian occupation of Mykolaiv Oblast|Mykolaiv Oblast]], and the western part of [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Kherson Oblast]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-63573387 (BBC News)]

Russian officials say that deputy head of the [[Kherson military–civilian administration]] [[Kirill Stremousov]] has been killed in a car crash while travelling to [[Crimea]]. Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] issues a decree posthumously awarding Stremousov the [[Order of Courage (Russia)|Order of Courage]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-63572668 (BBC News)]

[[President of France|French President]] [[Emmanuel Macron]] announces the official end of [[Operation Barkhane]] in the [[Sahel]]. [https://www.africanews.com/2022/11/09/france-officially-ends-anti-jihadist-barkhane-operation-ponders-new-strategy/ (Africanews)]

A [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] teenager is killed and three others are injured in [[Nablus]] as clashes occur between [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] and the [[Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade]] at [[Joseph's Tomb]] when the latter allegedly opened fire on [[Jewish]] worshippers. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/palestinian-teen-killed-as-gunmen-attack-pilgrimage-of-mks-to-nablus-josephs-tomb/ (''Times of Israel'')]

A [[Law enforcement in Belgium|police officer]] is killed and another is injured in a [[stabbing as a terrorist tactic|stabbing attack]] in [[Brussels]], [[Belgium]]. The perpetrator is shot and injured. The incident is being investigated as a [[terrorist]] attack. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-63586255 (BBC News)]

The [[Ukrainian Armed Forces|Ukrainian military]] says that it recaptured the city of [[Snihurivka]] in [[Mykolaiv Oblast]], the last remaining city controlled by [[Russia]] in the oblast. [https://www.voanews.com/a/ukraine-says-it-recaptured-key-town-in-strategic-mykolaiv-region/6828366.html (Voice of America)]

[[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] recapture the village of [[Kyselivka, Kherson Raion|Kyselivka]], advancing within nine miles of the city centre of [[Kherson]]. Explosions are reported near the [[Kakhovka Hydroelectric Power Plant]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/nov/10/ukraine-capture-snihurivka-kherson-russia-war (''The Guardian'')]

[[The Pentagon]] announces that it will send four [[AN/TWQ-1 Avenger]] [[surface-to-air missile]] systems, [[FIM-92 Stinger|Stinger missiles]], 400 [[grenade launcher]]s, 100 [[humvee]]s, and other artillery rounds and small arms ammunition to Ukraine as part of its latest [[US Dollar|$]]400 million weapons package to support the Ukrainian military. [https://thehill.com/policy/defense/3729848-us-to-send-ukraine-new-air-defense-system-as-part-of-new-400m-package/ (''The Hill'')]

Three [[Armed Forces of the Philippines|soldiers]] and four [[Moro Islamic Liberation Front]] militants are killed in a gunbattle in [[Basilan]], [[Philippines]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/11/10/seven-killed-as-philippine-troops-clash-with-moro-islamic-rebels (Al Jazeera)]

[[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] enter the city of [[Kherson]], the only Ukrainian regional capital captured by Russia during the invasion, ending [[Kherson#2022 Russian occupation|the city's eight-month occupation]] by [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]]. [https://www.cnn.com/2022/11/11/europe/russian-troops-leave-kherson-region-intl (CNN)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] destroy the [[Antonivka Road Bridge]] as they [[Withdrawal (military)|retreat]] from the west of the [[Dnieper]]. [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/11/11/world/europe/kherson-bridge-russia-ukraine-war.html (''The New York Times'')]

The [[Russian Foreign Ministry]] bans 200 [[Citizenship of the United States|U.S. citizens]] from entering [[Russia]], including [[White House Press Secretary]] [[Karine Jean-Pierre]] and three siblings of [[President of the United States|President]] [[Joe Biden]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-bans-entry-200-us-nationals-including-bidens-relatives-press-secretary-2022-11-11/ (Reuters)]

An [[improvised explosive device|IED]] explodes on [[İstiklal Avenue]] in [[Beyoğlu]], [[Istanbul]], killing six people and injuring 81 others. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/11/13/turkey-istanbul-explosion-istiklal-several-injured (Al Jazeera)]

[[Ministry of Interior (Turkey)|Interior Minister]] [[Süleyman Soylu]] reports that a Syrian female suspect has been arrested. [https://www.abc.net.au/news/2022-11-14/suspect-arrested-by-turkish-police-over-istanbul-bomb/101650812 (ABC News Australia)]

[[Israel]] launches missile strikes on [[Shayrat Airbase]] in [[Homs Governorate]], central [[Syria]], killing two [[Syrian Army|soldiers]] and injuring three others, according to [[Syrian Arab News Agency|Syrian state television]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/syrian-air-defences-shoot-down-israeli-missiles-targeting-homs-province-state-tv-2022-11-13/ (Reuters)]

The [[United Kingdom]] announces that it is withdrawing its [[British Armed Forces|troops]] from [[Mali]] citing "political instability" and the controversial relationship between the [[Assimi Goïta]]-led [[military junta]] and [[Russia]]'s [[Wagner Group]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-63627489 (BBC News)]

[[Iran]]'s [[Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps]] (IRGC) strikes the [[headquarters]] of the [[Democratic Party of Iranian Kurdistan]] in [[Koy Sanjaq]], [[Kurdistan Region]], [[Iraq]], with four [[missile]]s, killing at least one person. The IRGC says that it "targeted terrorist groups" with missiles and [[unmanned combat aerial vehicle|drones]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/11/14/iran-rockets-hit-kurdish-party-hq-in-iraqs-erbil (Al Jazeera)]
Israeli forces kill a 15-year-old Palestinian girl in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.pagina12.com.ar/497674-la-adolescente-palestina-murio-baleada/ (''Pagina12'')]

A missile strike kills two people in the village of [[Przewodów]] in eastern [[Poland]]. [[President of the United States]] [[Joe Biden]] says that the missile blast in Poland was caused by a Ukrainian air defense missile. U.S. officials had earlier told the [[Associated Press]] that preliminary findings suggested that the missile that hit Poland was fired by [[Ukrainian forces]] at an incoming Russian missile. [https://www.reuters.com/article/ukraine-crisis-poland-blast-missiles/poland-blast-caused-by-missile-fired-by-ukrainian-forces-at-incoming-russian-missile-ap-idUSKBN2S60AQ (Reuters)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/biden-said-ukraine-air-defence-missile-responsible-poland-blast-nato-source-2022-11-16/ (Reuters 2)]

The [[Polish Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] says that it was a "Russian-made missile" and summons the Russian [[ambassador]] to provide an explanation. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-hails-chinas-opposition-nuclear-threats-2022-11-15/ (Reuters)] [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-war-zelenskyy-kherson-9202c032cf3a5c22761ee71b52ff9d52 (AP)]

Russian missiles strike several cities across [[Ukraine]], including [[Kyiv]], causing "critical" damage to energy facilities. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/nov/15/russia-launches-new-wave-of-missile-strikes-across-ukraine (''The Guardian'')]

Three [[Israel]]is are killed and three others are injured after a 18-year-old [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] man carries out a [[vehicle-ramming attack]] and [[mass stabbing]] in the [[Ariel (settlement)|Ariel]] [[Israeli settlement|settlement]] in the occupied [[West Bank]]. The perpetrator is shot dead. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/3-seriously-wounded-in-stabbing-at-west-bank-industrial-zone-attacker-shot/ (''Times of Israel'')]

The United States opens an investigation into the death of journalist [[Shireen Abu Akleh]], who was killed in the West Bank in May. [https://www.telam.com.ar/notas/202211/610925-cisjordania-periodista-asesinato-investigacion.html/ (Télam)]

The [[US Navy]] says that it stopped an [[Iran]]ian shipment of 70 tons of missile fuel components and fertilizer to [[Yemen]]. The shipment would likely be used by the [[Houthis]], who are Iran's allies. [https://apnews.com/article/iran-united-states-dubai-arab-emirates-saudi-arabia-6e8c6bf72b9304c5bfcc3196478b2ecd (AP)]

Five people are killed and 15 others are injured in a [[mass shooting]] at a market in [[Izeh]], [[Khuzestan province]], [[Iran]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/least-four-killed-terrorist-attack-irans-khuzestan-province-state-media-2022-11-16/ (Reuters)]

[[Germany]] announces the withdrawal of its ''[[Bundeswehr]]'' personnel in the [[United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali]] until the end of 2023. [https://english.almayadeen.net/news/politics/germany-to-withdraw-troops-from-mali-by-the-end-of-2023 (AFP via Al Mayadeen)]

[[Germany]] offers to deploy its [[German Air Force|Air Force]] jets to protect [[Poland|Polish]] [[airspace]] in response to Tuesday's [[missile]] [[explosion]] in [[Przewodów]], [[Lublin Voivodeship]], that killed two people. [https://www.anews.com.tr/world/2022/11/16/germany-offers-to-send-combat-jets-to-poland (A News)]

[[Russia]] carries out another wave of [[cruise missile]] strikes on [[Ukraine]], with strikes reported in [[Dnipro]], [[Odesa]], [[Kharkiv]], and [[Zaporizhzhia]], where two people were confirmed to have been killed overnight by a missile. In Dnipro and Odesa, [[critical infrastructure]] is also targeted. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2022/nov/17/russia-ukraine-war-live-news-blasts-heard-in-crimea-putin-trying-to-freeze-ukraine-into-submission-us-envoy-says (''The Guardian'')]

[[President of Ukraine|Ukrainian President]] [[Volodymyr Zelenskyy]] says that [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[missile]] strikes have left at least 10 million [[Ukrainians]] [[power outage|without electricity]] as the death toll from yesterday's missile strikes increases to seven with many more people injured. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-63659370 (BBC News)]

[[North Korea]] fires a suspected [[intercontinental ballistic missile]] that lands 200 kilometres off the coast of [[Japan]], within Japan's [[Exclusive economic zone of Japan|exclusive economic zone]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/north-korea-fires-ballistic-missile-south-korea-military-says-2022-11-18/ (Reuters)]

Protesters [[arson|set fire to]] the house of the [[Iranian Revolution|Islamic Republic of Iran]]'s founder [[Ayatollah]] [[Ruhollah Khomeini]] in [[Khomein]], [[Markazi Province]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/middle-east/20221118-iran-protesters-set-fire-to-ayatollah-khomeini-s-ancestral-home (France 24)]

[[Iran]]ian security forces open fire on anti-[[Government of the Islamic Republic of Iran|government]] protesters in [[Divandarreh]], [[Kurdistan province]], killing three people. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/nov/19/iran-security-forces-shoot-dead-at-least-three-civilians (''The Guardian'')]

The [[Islamic Republic of Iran Armed Forces|Iranian military]] deploys [[armoured personnel carrier]]s in [[Mahabad]], [[West Azerbaijan province]], amid fears of a [[massacre]] in the restive city. The [[Iran Human Rights]] group reports heavy gunfire. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/iran-activists-fear-deadly-crackdown-in-kurdish-populated-mahabad/ (''Times of Israel'')]

The [[Russian occupation of Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Russian-controlled]] [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]] in [[Enerhodar]] is [[Shell (projectile)|shelled]], with damage occurring to some buildings, systems, and equipment, according to the [[International Atomic Energy Agency]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-says-ukraine-shells-zaporizhzhia-nuclear-power-plant-tass-2022-11-20/ (Reuters)]

The [[Turkish Air Force]] launches a series of [[airstrike]]s against the [[Kurds in Syria|Kurdish]]-led [[Syrian Democratic Forces]] (SDF) and [[Syrian Army]] positions in [[Autonomous Administration of North and East Syria|Northern]] [[Syria]], and the [[Kurdistan Workers' Party]] (PKK) in [[Iraqi Kurdistan]] following the [[2022 Istanbul bombing|Istanbul bombing]], which [[Ankara]] blames on [[Kurdish nationalism|Kurdish separatists]]. The [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights]] reports that at least 35 people were killed, including 18 SDF fighters and 16 Syrian troops. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/11/20/turkey-launches-air-raids-in-syria-iraq-over-istanbul-blast (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.syriahr.com/%d8%a8%d8%b6%d8%b1%d8%a8%d8%a7%d8%aa-%d8%ac%d9%88%d9%8a%d8%a9-%d8%aa%d8%b1%d9%83%d9%8a%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d8%b1%d8%aa%d9%81%d8%a7%d8%b9-%d8%b9%d8%af%d8%af-%d9%82%d8%aa%d9%80-%d9%80%d9%84%d9%89-%d9%82/571734/ (SOHR)]

A [[humanitarian aid]] worker for the French [[Non-governmental organization|NGO]] [[Solidarités International]] and a few other civilians are killed in an ambush in the [[Cabo Delgado Province]] of [[Mozambique]]. [https://www.news360.es/ireland/2022/11/23/aid-worker-killed-in-ambush-in-mozambique-5/ (News360)]

A rocket attack on the Turkish [[Syria–Turkey border|border town]] of [[Karkamış]], kills three people, including a child. Interior Minister [[Süleyman Soylu]] blames [[Kurds|Kurdish]] militants in [[Syria]] and vows a "strong response". Kurdish groups have denied being behind the attack. [https://www.dw.com/en/turkey-several-killed-after-rockets-fired-from-syria/a-63829077 (DW)]

A [[Turkish Land Forces|Turkish soldier]] is killed and seven police officers are injured after the [[Bab al-Hawa Border Crossing]] is [[Shell (projectile)|shelled]] by suspected Kurdish militants. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/suspected-kurdish-militants-fire-turkish-border-town-93705349 (ABC News)]

[[President of Turkey|Turkish President]] [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] threatens to launch a ground operation in [[Autonomous Administration of North and East Syria|northern Syria]] and [[Iraqi Kurdistan]] in response to the rocket attacks on Turkish territory. [https://www.france24.com/en/middle-east/20221121-erdogan-threatens-ground-operation-in-syria-after-deadly-rocket-strike (France 24)]
Two people are killed in a bombing in [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/blast-afghan-capital-kills-two-2022-11-21/ (Reuters)]

Three people are killed and 22 others are injured after an ambush on a major highway in [[Central Equatoria]], [[South Sudan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/africa-south-sudan-juba-uganda-6c71beaa51a4b17c764d0bed98ba9089 (AP)]

[[Germany]] says that it will deploy [[MIM-104 Patriot|Patriot]] [[surface-to-air missile]] systems on the [[Poland–Ukraine border]] in order to protect Polish [[airspace]]. Polish Defense Minister [[Mariusz Błaszczak]] says that he has accepted the German proposal. [https://www.ibtimes.com/germany-deploy-patriot-air-defense-system-along-polands-border-ukraine-3639019 (''International Business Times'')]

Ten [[Chadian military|Chadian soldiers]] are killed and many others injured in an attack by [[Boko Haram]] in [[Lac (region)|Lac Region]], [[Chad]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/boko-haram-fighters-kill-10-chadian-soldiers-near-nigeria-border-2022-11-22/ (Reuters)]

One person is killed and 30 others injured in a [[car bomb]]ing at a [[Royal Thai Police|police]] compound in [[Narathiwat]], [[Thailand]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/11/22/one-killed-30-injured-in-southern-thailand-car-bombing (Al Jazeera)]

At least 14 people, including eight [[Volunteers for the Defense of the Homeland]] members, are killed in two separate attacks by [[jihadist]]s in northern [[Burkina Faso]], with one occurring near [[Markoye]], [[Oudalan]]. [https://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/world/2022/11/23/14-killed-in-two-burkina-faso-attacks-by-jihadist-groups/ (AFP via Free Malaysia Today)]

Widespread [[Power outage|blackouts]] are reported in [[Western Ukraine]] as [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] launch another wave of [[cruise missile]] strikes, including in the city of [[Lviv]], which is currently experiencing a power outage. [[Moldova]] also reports "massive" power outages, although the country has not been directly hit by missiles. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-63729427 (BBC News)]

At least six people, all [[civilian]]s, are killed in the latest missile strikes, including three in an apartment block in [[Vyshhorod]], [[Kyiv Oblast]], where 15 other people were injured. [[Kyiv]] [[Mayor of Kyiv|Mayor]] [[Vitali Klitschko]] says that 21 of the 31 missiles targeting Kyiv were intercepted before they reached their targets. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/nov/23/strike-on-ukrainian-hospital-maternity-ward-zaporizhzhia-kills-newborn-baby (''The Guardian'')]

[[Secretary of State for Defence|British Defence Secretary]] [[Ben Wallace (politician)|Ben Wallace]] announces that the [[United Kingdom]] will send three [[Westland Sea King|Sea King helicopters]] to the [[Ukrainian Air Force]] as part of a new [[Pound sterling|£]]50 million support package to [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2022/11/23/three-sea-king-helicopters-sent-ukraine-first-time/ (''The Telegraph'')]

A 16-year-old [[Israeli Canadians|Israeli Canadian]] teenager and an [[Ethiopian Jews in Israel|Ethiopian-Israeli]] man in his fifties are killed and 22 others are injured in [[explosion]]s at two [[bus stop]]s in [[Jerusalem]].  [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/nov/23/jerusalem-israel-explosion-bus-stop-injured (''The Guardian'')] [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-723426 (''The Jerusalem Post'')]

An [[Israel]]i [[Israeli Druze|Druze]] teen is kidnapped from a [[Jenin]] hospital by [[Jenin Brigades]] militants and his body held hostage. He died either in the hospital or after the militants unplugged him from his [[life support]]. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/body-of-israeli-man-killed-in-west-bank-crash-said-snatched-by-palestinian-gunmen/ (''Times of Israel'')]

Two [[Palestinians]] are killed and three others injured during a raid by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] at a refugee camp in [[Nablus]]. [https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/132022 (Wafa)] [https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/132043 (Wafa)]

The [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]] and [[Rwanda]] agree to a [[ceasefire]] from November 25 and "the immediate withdrawal of [[March 23 Movement|M23]] rebels from the occupied areas". [https://www.africanews.com/2022/11/23/ceasefire-in-restive-east-dr-congo-as-soon-as-friday// (AFP via Africanews)]
At least five people are killed in a [[mass shooting]] at a [[mosque]] in [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://english.news.cn/20221123/ef8403c903d545d78e112ae2c4c0d4d4/c.html (Xinhua)]

[[Syrian Democratic Forces]] [[commander-in-chief]] [[Mazloum Abdi]] suspends military operations against the [[Islamic State]] in order to focus on preparations for a [[Turkey|Turkish]] ground invasion of [[Autonomous Administration of North and East Syria|northern Syria]]. [https://www.al-monitor.com/originals/2022/11/turkeys-strikes-syria-put-us-troops-danger-pentagon-says (Al Monitor)]

At least 15 people are killed and 35 others are injured when [[Russian Armed Forces]] [[Bombardment|bombard]] [[Kherson]]. [https://www.ndtv.com/world-news/russian-shelling-kills-15-in-kherson-as-ukraine-battles-to-restore-power-3554546 (AFP via NDTV)]

The [[Somali Armed Forces|military of Somalia]] carries out a series of [[counterterrorism]] [[military operation|operations]] in southern [[Somalia]], killing 15 [[al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] members who survived a previous operation two days ago, in which 49 fighters were killed. The military also says that they stopped an attack in Qayib, [[Galmudug]], killing dozens of militants. [https://english.news.cn/20221125/364950062f224438bf22599a28bb06e4/c.html (Xinhua)]

[[List of prime ministers of São Tomé and Príncipe|São Tomé and Príncipe prime minister]] [[Patrice Trovoada]] reports that his officials had thwarted a [[coup d'état]] attempt led by the President of the [[National Assembly (São Tomé and Príncipe)|National Assembly]], [[Delfim Neves]], after they arrested Neves and another individual for infiltrating the headquarters of the [[Armed Forces of São Tomé and Príncipe|armed forces]] in [[São Tomé]]. Four people were killed in the attempt. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/prime-minister-coup-thwarted-in-sao-tome-and-principe/2022/11/25/f7fda3b2-6d16-11ed-8619-0b92f0565592_story.html (AP via ''The Washington Post'')]

Eight [[civilian]]s and a [[Somali National Army|soldier]] are killed and several others, including [[Somalia]]'s internal security minister, are injured when [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[jihadist]]s attack a hotel in [[Mogadishu]] frequented by [[Federal Government of Somalia|Somali politicians]]. Five [[insurgent]]s are also killed. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-63773425 (BBC)] [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/11/27/world/africa/mogadishu-shabab-hotel.html (''The New York Times'')]

The [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]] and [[Burundi]] jointly announce that 40 Burundian rebels of the [[National Forces of Liberation]] have been killed recently in eastern DRC. [https://www.rfi.fr/en/international-news/20221127-40-burundi-rebels-killed-in-east-dr-congo (AFP via RFI)]

Four [[Palestinians]], one in [[Hebron]], one in [[Keida|al-Mughayir]] and two brothers in [[Kafr Ein]], are killed during clashes with [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli forces]]. Eight others are injured. A man is also killed in [[Kokhav Ya'akov]] after [[vehicle-ramming attack|ramming]] and seriously injuring a female soldier. [https://apnews.com/article/middle-east-jerusalem-israel-west-bank-hebron-0c9987b77c511482554bf59e07382b27 (AP)] [https://www.timesofisrael.com/israeli-woman-seriously-hurt-in-suspected-west-bank-car-ramming/ (''Times of Israel'')]

The [[United States Central Command]] announces that the [[Free Syrian Army]] killed [[Islamic State]] [[Caliphate of ISIL|caliph]] [[Abu al-Hasan al-Hashimi al-Qurashi]] during an [[Military operation|operation]] in the [[Daraa Governorate]] in mid-October. [https://www.brusselstimes.com/330389/isis-leader-was-killed-by-rebels-in-southern-syria (AFP via ''The Brussels Times'')]

At least 15 people are killed and 20 others injured in a bombing at a [[religious school]] in [[Aybak, Samangan|Aybak]], [[Samangan Province]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/11/30/at-least-15-killed-in-afghanistan-school-bombing-says-official (Al Jazeera)]

Three people are killed and 24 others injured by a [[Pakistani Taliban]] [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] at a [[polio vaccination]] centre in [[Quetta]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/11/30/suicide-bomb-blast-hits-pakistan-police-vehicle (Al Jazeera)]

A staff member at the Ukrainian [[embassy]] in [[Madrid]], [[Spain]], suffers minor injuries when opening a [[letter bomb]] that was addressed to [[ambassador]] Serhii Pohoreltsev. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/spanish-police-say-blast-ukrainian-embassy-injured-one-employee-2022-11-30/ (Reuters)]

Two [[Al-Quds Brigades]] leaders are killed and another person is injured by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] during a raid at a refugee camp in [[Jenin]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/12/1/palestinians-killed-israel-jenin-refugee-camp-raid (Al Jazeera)]

Twelve people are killed by armed gangs in [[Cabaret, Ouest|Cabaret]], a town in the department of [[Ouest (department)|Ouest]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/12/1/armed-gangs-kill-12-in-haiti-as-public-security-crisis-deepens (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Ministry of the Interior (Spain)|Spanish Ministry of the Interior]] reports that several [[letter bomb]]s have been sent to [[Prime Minister of Spain|Prime Minister]] [[Pedro Sánchez]], the [[Ministry of Defence (Spain)|Ministry of Defence]] and the [[Torrejón Air Base]]. A sixth letter bomb is intercepted at the U.S. Embassy in [[Madrid]]. [https://www.elplural.com/politica/espana/cronologia-cartas-bomba-sanchez-defensa-embajada_302153102 (''El Plural'')] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/third-mail-bomb-found-spanish-air-force-base-el-mundo-reports-2022-12-01/ (Reuters)] [https://www.lasexta.com/noticias/nacional/detectan-sexta-carta-bomba-remitida-embajada-eeuu-madrid-acordonan-zona_202212016388aac928ddf800014cecc9.html (''La Sexta'')]

Two men disguised in [[burqa]]s attack a [[mosque]] in [[Kabul]] while former [[Afghan people|Afghan]] [[Prime Minister of Afghanistan|prime minister]] [[Gulbuddin Hekmatyar]] is inside. The attackers killed a [[civilian]] and injured two others before being shot dead by [[security guard]]s. Hekmatyar was not injured in the attack. [https://www.aninews.in/news/world/asia/ex-afghan-pm-hekmatyar-escapes-unhurt-after-his-building-attacked-in-kabul-1-killed-2-injured20221202221441/ (ANInews)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] launch another wave of [[cruise missile]] strikes on [[Ukraine]], destroying homes and killing two people in [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]], while causing power outages in many other areas after damaging [[critical infrastructure]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/zelenskiy-urges-residents-be-strong-ukraine-races-restore-power-2022-12-05/ (Reuters)]

[[Russia]] says that a long-range [[drone warfare|drone attack]] on its [[Dyagilevo (air base)|Dyagilevo Air Base]] and [[Engels-2 (air base)|Engels-2 Air Base]] has killed three servicemen, injured four others, and damaged two aircraft. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/zelenskiy-urges-residents-be-strong-ukraine-races-restore-power-2022-12-05/ (Reuters)]

Protests occur in the town of [[Atarib]], [[Aleppo Governorate]], [[Syria]], after a [[Turkish Armed Forces|Turkish military]] vehicle ran over and killed a woman and a child while conducting a patrol with a local rebel group, according to the [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights]]. The [[Iraqi Armed Forces|Iraqi military]] is deployed to its borders [[Iraq–Turkey border|with Turkey]] [[Iran–Iraq border|and Iran]]. [https://en.mehrnews.com/amp/194470/ (Mehr)]

Ten [[prison officer]]s and four [[inmate]]s are killed in an armed attack on a prison in [[Ciudad Juárez]], [[Chihuahua (state)|Chihuahua]], [[Mexico]], in which 24 [[Prison escape|prisoners escaped]]. [https://www.deccanherald.com/international/world-news-politics/armed-attack-on-mexican-jail-leaves-14-dead-1177101.html (AFP via ''Deccan Herald'')]

Two [[Palestinians]] are killed and three more injured during confrontations with [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] who stormed [[Kafr Dan]] to demolish the homes of two Palestinians killed in a [[shootout]] at a checkpoint in [[Jenin]] several months ago. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/2/israeli-forces-kill-two-palestinian-men-occupied-west-bank (Al Jazeera)]

Two children are killed and four other people are injured by an [[explosion]] outside the home of one of the four [[Hindus]] who were killed yesterday in [[Rajouri district]], [[Jammu and Kashmir (union territory)|Jammu and Kashmir]], [[India]]. [https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/many-killed-in-blast-at-rajouris-dangri-village/article66329258.ece/amp/ (The Hindu)]

Two [[firefighter]]s and three [[civilian]]s are killed in an armed attack by [[Islamist]] [[insurgent]]s along a highway between [[Bamako]] and [[Ségou]]. [https://www.barrons.com/news/two-firefighters-three-civilians-killed-in-mali-attack-ministry-01672782909 (AFP via ''Barron's'')]

Protests continue for a fifth day in [[Las Anod]], [[Somaliland]], with protesters demanding that the city be governed by [[Puntland]] instead of by Somaliland. Twenty people are killed in clashes between protestors and security forces. [https://www.africanews.com/amp/2023/01/02/deadly-clashes-between-protesters-and-security-forces-in-somaliland/ (Africanews)]

The [[Ministry of Defence (Russia)|Russian defense ministry]] increases the death toll of [[Russian Army|soldiers]] from a December 31 [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian]] missile attack in [[Makiivka]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], to 89. The ministry attributes the casualties to the soldiers' use of [[mobile phones]] with [[Mobile phone tracking|tracking]] systems. [https://news.abs-cbn.com/overseas/01/04/23/russia-says-toll-from-ukraine-strike-rises-to-89 (AFP via ABS-CBN News)]

Five gunmen and two members of the security forces are killed during a [[shootout]] while searching for 30 [[inmate]]s who escaped two days ago during an armed attack on a prison in [[Ciudad Juárez]], [[Chihuahua (state)|Chihuahua]], [[Mexico]]. Ten [[prison guard]]s and seven inmates were killed during the attack. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-64147790 (BBC News)]

Five people are killed and many more wounded during a gunfight between [[Houthi movement|Houthi]] militants and [[Republic of Yemen Armed Forces|Yemeni soldiers]] in [[Taiz]]. [https://english.news.cn/20230104/244c4bb2fc4d431e800b09aa748be540/c.html (Xinhua)]

The visit of the [[Israel]]i Minister of National Security [[Itamar Ben-Gvir]] to the [[Temple Mount]] in [[Jerusalem]] results in protests by [[Palestinians]] as well as condemnation of the visit by several [[Arab countries]], who consider the site to be part of the [[Al-Aqsa Mosque]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-64150409 (BBC News)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/3/in-provocation-israel-far-right-minister-enters-al-aqsa-compound (Al Jazeera)]

Twenty-eight [[civilian]]s are found dead in the town of [[Nouna]], in northwest [[Burkina Faso]]. Burkinabé [[human rights group]]s say that the killings were perpetrated by pro-[[government of Burkina Faso|government]] [[militia]] [[Volunteers for the Defense of the Homeland|VDP]] on December 15, 18, and 22. [https://theatlasnews.co/brief/2023/01/03/28-civilians-executed-in-burkina-faso-rights-group-blames-government-militia/ (Atlas)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/bodies-28-men-found-shot-dead-burkina-faso-prosecutors-2023-01-03/ (Reuters)]

[[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] [[jihadist]]s kill 35 people in a double [[car bombing]] outside a politician's home and a market in [[Mahas District]], [[Hiran, Somalia|Hiran]], [[Somalia]]. [https://bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-64167474 (BBC News)]

Two [[intelligence officer]]s, including the director of the provincial [[counterterrorism]] department, are shot dead outside a restaurant in [[Khanewal]], [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]], [[Pakistan]], by suspected [[Pakistani Taliban]] gunmen. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/4/two-pakistan-intelligence-officers-gunned-down-in-punjab-province (Al Jazeera)]

Following the suggestion of [[Patriarch Kirill of Moscow]], [[Russian President]] [[Vladimir Putin]] announces a unilateral [[ceasefire]] on January 6–7 in connection with [[Orthodox Christmas]]. However, [[Ukraine]] rejects an offer to respond with a mutual ceasefire, citing lack of trust. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russias-war-ukraine-latest-russia-says-63-servicemen-killed-makiivka-2023-01-02/ (Reuters)]

The [[United States]] and [[Germany]] agree to send [[Bradley Fighting Vehicle]]s and [[Marder (infantry fighting vehicle)|Marder infantry fighting vehicles]] to Ukraine. Germany will also supply the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian military]] with a [[MIM-104 Patriot]] [[surface-to-air missile]] system. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jan/05/germany-tanks-ukraine-russia-war (''The Guardian'')] [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/white-house-says-us-germany-sending-armored-vehicles-to-ukraine/ (AFP via ''The Times of Israel'')]

The [[Mexican Army|army]] arrests [[Ovidio Guzmán López]], the son of incarcerated [[drug lord]] [[Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán]], in [[Culiacán]], [[Sinaloa]]. The arrest is followed by state-wide unrest, with many schools and airports closed. Ten soldiers and 19 gang members are killed during the unrest. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-64179356 (BBC News)] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jan/05/mexican-authorities-recapture-drug-lord-el-chapo-son (''The Guardian'')]

The [[Taliban]] says that its [[Afghan Armed Forces|forces]] have killed eight [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|Islamic State]] [[insurgent]]s, including foreign nationals, and arrested seven others in a series of raids in [[Kabul]] and the western [[Nimruz Province]], following recent attacks by the [[jihadist]] group. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/5/taliban-says-eight-isil-fighters-killed-in-raids-in-afghanistan (Al Jazeera)]

A [[Coast Guard Command (Turkey)|Turkish coast guard]] vessel exchanges warning shots with a [[Hellenic Coast Guard|Greek coast guard]] vessel near the [[Greece|Greek]] island of [[Farmakonisi]]. [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/warning-shots-fired-as-greek-turkish-patrol-boats-face-off/ar-AA160vNQ?ocid=entnewsntp&cvid=5d1d1b2173b44c3c80638debb7a4ed03 (AP)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] shell the [[front line]] city of [[Kramatorsk]], damaging at least fourteen homes, according to the city's mayor, with no reports of casualties. Meanwhile, [[Donetsk People's Republic]] officials accuse [[Ukraine]] of shelling [[Donetsk]] with [[artillery]]. [https://www.straitstimes.com/world/europe/russian-ceasefire-comes-into-force-in-ukraine (Reuters via ''The Straits Times'')] [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-64187704 (BBC News)]

A Russian [[missile]] strike near a [[fire station]] in [[Kherson]], kills one person and injures four others, according to regional official [[Yaroslav Yanushevych]]. [https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-ato/3647652-russian-strike-on-kherson-fire-station-one-rescuer-killed-four-more-injured.html (Ukrinform)]

[[Mexico]]'s secretary of defense [[Luis Cresencio Sandoval]] reports that a total of 29 people, 19 gang members and ten military personnel, were killed during the operation which ended in the arrest of [[Ovidio Guzmán]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/mexico-says-least-29-killed-during-capture-el-chapos-son-2023-01-06/ (Reuters)]

At least 20 people are killed and many more injured during an [[ambush]] by [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] [[insurgent]]s at a government base at the Hilowle Gaab village. [https://hornobserver.com/articles/1939/At-least-20-killed-in-an-Al-Shabab-attack-in-Somalia-Middle-Shabelle-region (Horn Observer)]

Al-Shabaab gunmen storm a village in [[Hirshabelle State]] that was captured from the [[jihadist]] group last week, killing at least six people. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/6/armed-fighters-in-kill-six-in-village-raid-in-somalia (Al Jazeera)]

Thirty-five [[Islamic State – West Africa Province|Islamic State]] members are killed during a fight with [[Boko Haram]] militants in [[Lake Chad]], resulting in the dislodgement of Islamic State from two of its enclaves. [https://punchng.com/boko-haram-kills-35-iswap-combatants-in-lake-chad/ (Punch)]

[[NATO]] rejects [[Serbia]]'s request to deploy up to 1,000 [[Serbian Army|Serbian troops]] and [[military police]] in [[North Kosovo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/nato-declines-serbias-request-deploy-its-troops-kosovo-2023-01-08/ (Reuters)]

Pro-[[Jair Bolsonaro|Bolsonaro]] protesters storm the [[National Congress of Brazil|National Congress]], the [[Supreme Federal Court]], and the [[Palácio do Planalto]] in [[Brasília]], [[Brazil]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230108-bolsonaro-supporters-storm-into-brazil-congress-clash-with-authorities (France 24)]

At least 18 people are killed and over 100 others are injured when the [[Peruvian National Police]] fire upon [[2022–2023 Peruvian political protests|demonstrations]] in [[Juliaca]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/least-nine-dead-anti-government-protests-near-peru-airport-2023-01-09/ (Reuters)]

The [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|UK Defence Ministry]] says that [[Ukraine  Armed Forces|Russian forces]] are in control of most of [[Soledar]] in [[Donetsk Oblast]]. [[Wagner Group]] leader [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]], however, claims the city had been taken in its entirety. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jan/10/head-of-wagner-group-says-his-troops-have-taken-control-of-soledar (''The Guardian'')]

[[Chief of the General Staff (Russia)|Chief of the General Staff]] of the [[Russian Armed Forces]] [[Valery Gerasimov]] is appointed commander of the Joint Group of Forces participating in the war with [[Ukraine]]. Generals [[Oleg Salyukov]], {{ill|Alexei Kim|ru|Ким, Алексей Ростиславович}}, and [[Sergei Surovikin]], who previously held this position, become his deputies. [https://www.fontanka.ru/2023/01/11/71966756/ (Fontanka.ru)]

An [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|Islamic State]] [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] blows himself up at the entrance of the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Afghanistan)|foreign ministry]] offices in [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]], killing at least 20 people and many others injured. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/11/explosion-outside-afghan-foreign-ministry-in-kabul (Al Jazeera)]

[[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] raid the village of [[Qabatiya]] in the [[West Bank]], killing two [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] men. In a separate incident, Israeli forces arrest an 18-year-old Palestinian man and kill his father in the [[Qalandia]] refugee camp. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/palestinians-say-israeli-army-kills-man-in-west-bank-raid/2023/01/12/2198b246-9244-11ed-90f8-53661ac5d9b9_story.html (AP via ''The Washington Post'')] [https://www.ynetnews.com/article/rj00css6qo (Ynetnews)]

The city of [[Cusco]] is placed under red alert after one person is killed and 17 others are injured in clashes between protesters and [[National Police of Peru|police]]. [https://edition.cnn.com/2023/01/12/americas/peru-anti-government-protests-intl/index.html (CNN)]

[[Russia]]'s [[Ministry of Defence (Russia)|defence ministry]] says that its [[Russian Armed Forces|forces]] have taken full control of [[Soledar]] in [[Donetsk Oblast]]. However, [[Ukraine]] denies the fall of the city and its [[Soledar Salt Mine|salt mines]], claiming that the battle was still ongoing. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-64263119 (BBC News)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russia]] strikes a nine-story residential building in [[Dnipro]] with a [[cruise missile]], killing at least 40 people, injuring 73 others and leaving dozens more missing. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-belarus-conduct-defensive-air-drills-sparking-fear-kyiv-new-offensive-2023-01-16/ (Reuters)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/1/15/russia-ukraine-live-death-toll-from-strike-in-dnipro-rises-to-14 (Al Jazeera)]

[[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|UK Prime Minister]] [[Rishi Sunak]] confirms that the [[United Kingdom]] will send 14 [[Challenger 2]] [[main battle tank]]s to [[Ukraine]] in the coming weeks, as well as 30 self-propelled [[AS-90]] [[howitzer]]s. [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] will also be trained by the [[British Armed Forces]] to operate the tanks. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/uk-has-ambition-send-tanks-ukraine-pm-sunak-tells-zelenskiy-2023-01-14/ (Reuters)]

Eleven people are killed and more than 50 injured by an [[Al–Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[Suicide attack|suicide]] [[car bomb]]ing in [[Buloburde]], [[Hiran, Somalia|Hiran]]. [https://www.voanews.com/a/al-shabab-attacks-key-towns-in-somalia-killing-at-least-15-people/6918617.html (VOA)]

Two [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Palestinian Islamic Jihad]] members are killed by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] during a raid in [[Jaba', Jenin|Jaba]], in the [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/14/israeli-soldiers-kill-two-palestinian-men-near-jenin-in-west-bank (Al Jazeera)]

Ten people are killed and 39 others are injured when a bomb [[explode]]s at a [[Pentecostalism|Pentecostal]] church in [[Kasindi]], [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. The [[Islamic State – Central Africa Province|Islamic State]] has claimed responsibility for the attack. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/15/several-killed-in-dr-congo-church-bomb-attack (Al Jazeera)]

Former lawmaker [[Mursal Nabizada]] and one of her [[bodyguard]]s are shot and killed in [[Kabul]] inside her home, while her brother and a second security guard are injured. [[Taliban]] police spokesman Khalid Zadran condemns the killing and says that a "serious investigation has been launched". [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2232881/world (AFP via Arab News)]
[[Jihadism|Jihadists]] [[kidnap]] dozens of women in [[Arbinda]], [[Sahel Region]], [[Burkina Faso]], according to local officials. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-64285344 (BBC News)]

[[Ukraine]] announces defeat at [[Soledar]] after days of intense fighting. [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/ukraine-confirms-that-russia-has-taken-control-of-disputed-town-of-soledar/ar-AA16nYjG?li=BBnb7Kz (MSN)]

[[Amhara Region|Amharan]] Special Forces announce their withdrawal from the [[Tigray Region]] in line with an [[African Union]]-backed [[Ethiopia–Tigray peace agreement|peace agreement]] between the [[Government of Ethiopia|Ethiopian government]] and the [[Tigray People's Liberation Front]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/13/amhara-forces-leave-northern-ethiopias-tigray-region (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Somali Armed Forces]] claim to have recaptured the port town of [[Harardhere]] from [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] militants. According to a [[Puntland]] officer, Somali forces allied with regional militias also recaptured the town of [[El Dhere]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/16/somalia-says-it-has-seized-key-port-town-from-al-shabaab (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.theglobeandmail.com/world/article-somalia-says-it-has-seized-key-port-town-from-al-shabaab-2/ (''The Globe and Mail'')]

Seven soldiers, including a commander, are killed when [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[jihadist]]s attack a [[military base]] in Hawadley, [[Middle Shabelle]], with a [[suicide attack|suicide]] [[car bomb]] and gunmen. [https://www.reuters.com/article/somalia-security-idAFKBN2TW0FL (Reuters)]

During a visit to [[Kyiv]], [[Government of Canada|Canadian]] [[Minister of National Defence (Canada)|National Defence Minister]] [[Anita Anand]] announces that [[Canada]] [[List of foreign aid to Ukraine during the Russo-Ukrainian War|will send]] 200 [[Roshel Senator]] [[armoured personnel carrier]]s to [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/canada-ukaine-armoured-personnel-carriers-donation-1.6717597 (CBC News)]

Ten [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] militants are killed during a raid by security forces in the village of [[Galmagala]], [[Garissa County]], [[Kenya]], after the group killed five civilians in the region last week. [[Rocket]]-propelled [[grenade]]s and [[improvised explosive device]]s are recovered. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/20/kenyan-security-forces-kill-10-suspected-al-shabab-fighters (Al Jazeera)]

The [[United Nations]] reports the discovery of [[mass grave]]s in [[Ituri Province]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], containing the bodies of 49 civilians. [[CODECO]] militants are suspected of being behind the killings. [https://apnews.com/article/politics-democratic-republic-of-the-congo-united-nations-1d8ddf4706253b6a221df578062ae9a7 (AP)]

[[Minister of Defence (Sweden)|Swedish Defence Minister]] [[Pål Jonson]] announces that [[Sweden]] [[List of foreign aid to Ukraine during the Russo-Ukrainian War|will send]] its self-propelled [[Archer Artillery System]], 50 [[Combat Vehicle 90]] [[Infantry fighting vehicle|IFVs]], and [[NLAW]] [[anti-tank warfare|anti-tank missiles]] to [[Ukraine]] as part of its latest military support package for the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian military]]. [https://www.politico.eu/article/sweden-to-send-archer-artillery-to-ukraine-war-russia/ (Politico)]

Sixteen [[Volunteers for the Defense of the Homeland|VDP]] members and 14 civilians are killed during four attacks by [[Islamic extremism|Islamic extremists]] in [[Burkina Faso]]. At least ten attackers are also killed. [https://www.voanews.com/a/attacks-kill-dozens-in-burkina-faso-security-sources-say-/6927428.html (VOA)]

A [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] teacher and a member of the [[Jenin Brigades]] are killed, and three others are injured, in a raid by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] at a [[refugee camp]] in [[Jenin]], in the [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/19/teacher-among-two-palestinians-killed-by-israeli-forces-in-jenin (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-64330051 (BBC News)]

Three [[Law enforcement in Pakistan|police officers]] are killed in a [[Suicide attack|suicide bombing]] at a police outpost in [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/pakistani-taliban-attacks-police-outpost-killing-three-officers-2023-01-19/ (Reuters)]

Five [[Iraqis]] from [[Duhok]], [[Kurdistan Region]], [[Iraq]], are shot and killed by gunmen on a road in [[Mardin Province]], [[Turkey]]. Two of the victims were prominent [[imam]]s in Duhok. [https://www.thenationalnews.com/mena/2023/01/19/four-iraqis-killed-in-shooting-in-turkey/ (''The National News'')]

[[Russia]] claims that it captured the village of Klishchiivka in [[Donetsk Oblast]], south of [[Bakhmut]], and the village of Lobkove in [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/20/russia-claims-capture-of-village-near-ukraines-bakhmut (Al Jazeera)]

A bomb blast [[derailment|derails]] a [[passenger train]] in Peshi village, [[Kachhi District]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]], injuring 13 people. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/20/blast-derails-passenger-train-in-pakistans-balochistan-report (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Burkina Faso Armed Forces]] rescue 62 women and four babies [[kidnap]]ped by [[Jihadism|jihadists]] in [[Arbinda]], [[Sahel Region]], on January 15. [https://www.voanews.com/a/army-frees-abducted-women-babies-in-burkina-faso/6927629.html (AFP via Voice of America)]

The [[United States Department of the Treasury]] designates the [[Russia]]n [[paramilitary]] organization [[Wagner Group]] as a [[Transnational organized crime|transnational criminal organization]], allowing provisions for [[international sanctions]]. [https://www.lemonde.fr/en/international/article/2023/01/20/washington-designates-russia-s-wagner-criminal-organization_6012393_4.html (AFP via ''Le Monde'')]

The [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian military]] says that it has launched [[2023 Zaporizhzhia offensive|offensive operations]] in [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]] and "taken more advantageous lines and positions". [https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20230121-live-baltic-states-call-on-germany-to-provide-tanks-to-ukraine-now (France 24)]

[[Eritrean Defence Forces|Eritrean forces]] withdraw from [[Shire (Tigray)|Shire]] and other major towns in the [[Tigray Region]] of [[Ethiopia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/eritrean-troops-seen-leaving-ethiopian-town-shire-2023-01-21/ (Reuters)]

[[Peru]] indefinitely closes its iconic [[Machu Picchu]] historic site due to the ongoing unrest which has killed dozens of people. Around 500 foreign nationals are currently stranded in Peru. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-64360531 (BBC News)] [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230121-peru-closes-famed-tourist-site-machu-picchu-due-to-protests (AFP via France 24)]

[[Burkina Faso]] demands that [[French Armed Forces|French forces]] withdraw from its territory after suspending a 2018 military accord that allowed the presence of French troops in the country. The [[Patriotic Movement for Safeguard and Restoration|ruling military junta]] has given France one month to complete the withdrawal. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/burkina-military-govt-demands-departure-french-troops-national-television-2023-01-21/ (Reuters)]

Six people are injured after a bomb explodes in al-Majaza, [[Shabwah Governorate]], [[Yemen]]. [https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/20230122-bomb-blast-injures-6-soldiers-in-yemens-shabwa/ (Middle East Monitor)]

[[Government of Germany|German]] [[Minister for Foreign Affairs (Germany)|Foreign Affairs Minister]] [[Annalena Baerbock]] says that [[Germany]] will not prevent [[Poland]] [[List of foreign aid to Ukraine during the Russo-Ukrainian War|from sending]] [[Leopard 2]] [[main battle tank]]s to [[Ukraine]] which Ukrainian officials say are pivotal to defeating [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/france-does-not-rule-out-sending-leclerc-tanks-ukraine-macron-2023-01-22/ (Reuters)]

The [[Lebanese Armed Forces|Lebanese Army]] declares a "state of alert" after stopping [[Israel]]i [[bulldozer]]s and accompanying [[Israel Defense Forces|soldiers]] from approaching a border fence in [[Southern Lebanon]]. [[Peacekeeping]] forces from [[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon|UNIFIL]] have also been deployed to the area. [https://www.aa.com.tr/en/middle-east/lebanon-army-declares-state-of-alert-amid-tension-with-israel/2794370# (AA)]

[[Allied Democratic Forces]] [[insurgent]]s kill 23 people at a [[Bar (establishment)|bar]] in [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. The [[jihadism|jihadists]] also torched several homes and shops in the village during the attack. [[Islamic State]] claims responsibility. [https://www.france24.com/en/africa/20230123-islamic-state-group-claims-deadly-attack-in-east-dr-congo (AFP via France 24)]

Two [[British people|British]] aid workers are killed during a [[humanitarian aid|humanitarian evacuation]] from [[Soledar]] in [[Donetsk Oblast]], [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-64394105 (BBC News)]

[[Chancellor of Germany|German Chancellor]] [[Olaf Scholz]] announces that [[Germany]] [[List of foreign aid to Ukraine during the Russo-Ukrainian War|will send]] [[Leopard 2]] [[main battle tank]]s to [[Ukraine]], and will also allow other operators of the tanks, such as [[Poland]], to send them to Ukraine. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/germany-send-leopard-tanks-kyiv-allow-others-do-so-spiegel-2023-01-24/ (Reuters)]

Two [[Law enforcement in Iran|police officers]] are killed and a third is injured in an attack in [[Sistan and Baluchestan]], [[Iran]]. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2023/01/24/Two-police-officers-killed-in-armed-attack-in-Iran-s-southeast-State-media (Al Arabiya)]

[[President of the United States]] [[Joe Biden]] announces that the [[United States]] [[List of foreign aid to Ukraine during the Russo-Ukrainian War|will send]] 31 [[M1 Abrams]] [[Main battle tank|main battle tanks]] to [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.cnbc.com/2023/01/25/ukraine-war-news-us-will-send-abrams-tanks.html (CNBC)]

Forty people are killed by an [[airstrike]] against [[Fula people|Fulani people]] in Rukubi, [[Nasarawa State]], [[Nigeria]]. The [[massacre]] is blamed on the [[Nigerian Army|army]]. [https://www.africanews.com/2023/01/27/herders-blame-airstrike-that-killed-dozens-on-nigerias-air-force/ (Africa News)]

A [[Air Force of the Democratic Republic of the Congo|DRC Air Force]] [[Sukhoi Su-25]] is hit by [[Anti-aircraft warfare|anti-aircraft fire]] over the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo–Rwanda border|Rwandan border]]. The [[Politics of Rwanda|Rwandan government]] says that its [[Rwanda Defence Force|forces]] took "defensive measures" against a plane that had "violated its airspace". [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-64397725 (BBC News)]

[[France]] agrees to withdraw its 400 [[Special Operations Command (France)|special forces]] personnel from [[Burkina Faso]], following Saturday's mandate from the [[Patriotic Movement for Safeguard and Restoration|ruling military junta]] that France withdraw within one month. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-64397730 (BBC News)]

One person is killed and four others are injured when a man wielding a [[machete]] breaks into two [[church (building)|churches]] in [[Algeciras]], [[Andalusia]], [[Spain]]. A 25-year-old [[Moroccans in Spain|Moroccan]] man is arrested. [https://www.elmundo.es/andalucia/2023/01/25/63d1825621efa015088b457b.html (''El Mundo'')]

Twelve people are injured when a bomb [[explode]]s in a market in [[Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo| Beni]], [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], [https://apnews.com/article/islamic-state-group-politics-democratic-republic-of-the-congo-assault-united-nations-3966e88e590b9101aacc999180d13120 (AP)]

[[Russia]] launches a wave of [[cruise missile]] and [[Shahed 129]] [[Drone warfare|drone strike]]s across [[Ukraine]], targeting major cities and [[critical infrastructure]], killing at least 11 people and injuring 11 others. Ukrainian general [[Valerii Zaluzhnyi]] says that at least 20 missiles have been intercepted over the capital [[Kyiv]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/jan/26/russia-ukraine-war-live-key-thing-now-is-speed-and-volume-says-zelenskiy-as-allies-commit-to-tanks (''The Guardian'')]

A [[United States Armed Forces|U.S. military]] raid in northern [[Somalia]] kills senior [[Islamic State]] [[List of Islamic State members|member]] [[Bilal al-Sudani]] and ten other insurgents. No U.S. military casualties are reported in the operation, which was ordered by [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Joe Biden]]. [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/us-military-raid-somalia-kills-isis-leader-10-isis-fighters-rcna67742 (NBC News)]

Four [[Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades|Al-Qassam]] terrorists, three [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]] members and two [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] civilians are killed and 20 others are injured during a raid and subsequent [[gunfight]] by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in [[Jenin]], in the [[West Bank]]. In a separate raid in [[Al-Ram]], a Palestinian man is killed and two others are injured by Israeli soldiers. [https://apnews.com/article/politics-palestinian-territories-government-israel-middle-east-c8e644c39b066d78b8e2accde0a11e23 (AP)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/26/israeli-raid-kills-three-palestinians-in-jenin-fighting (Al Jazeera)]

Ten police officers are killed, one is critically injured and another is missing during a series of attacks in [[Port-au-Prince]], [[Haiti]], by the Gan Grif gang. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/26/tensions-soar-in-haitis-capital-after-police-officers-killed (Al Jazeera)]

[[Ukraine]] says that "fierce fighting" is underway in the east and northeast of the country as [[Russian Ground Forces|Russian troops]] try to break through Ukrainian defensive lines in [[Kharkiv Oblast|Kharkiv]], [[Donetsk Oblast|Donetsk]], [[Luhansk Oblast|Luhansk]] and [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]]s. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-unleashes-missiles-drones-ukraine-after-kyiv-secures-tanks-11-dead-2023-01-26/ (Reuters)]

[[Israeli Air Force]] jets launch [[airstrike]]s on an underground rocket manufacturing site, and a [[military base]] used by [[Hamas]] in the [[Gaza Strip]], in response to [[Palestinian rocket attacks on Israel|rockets fired by Palestinian militants]] into southern [[Israel]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/rocket-warning-sirens-set-off-southern-israel-israeli-army-2023-01-26/ (Reuters)]

Seven [[Israeli Jews]] are killed and three others are injured in a shooting at a [[synagogue]] in [[Jerusalem]]. The perpetrator is killed by police. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-64430491 (BBC News)]

A guard is killed and two others are injured during a shooting at the [[Azerbaijan]]i [[embassy]] in [[Tehran]], [[Iran]]. The perpetrator is arrested. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/27/armed-attack-azerbaijan-embassy-iran-kills (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons]] concludes with "reasonable grounds" that the [[Douma chemical attack]] that occurred in 2018, was carried out by the [[Syrian Armed Forces|Syrian military]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/27/opcw-blames-syria-government-forces-for-2018-douma-chlorine-gas-attack (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russia]] claims that a [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian]] [[M142 HIMARS|HIMARS]] missile strike on a hospital in [[Novoaidar]], [[Luhansk Oblast]], has killed 14 people and injured 24 others, including patients and medical staff. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-accuses-ukraine-killing-14-deliberate-strike-hospital-2023-01-28/ (Reuters)]

The [[Russian Air Force]] launches an [[airstrike]] on the city of [[Seredyna-Buda]] in [[Sumy Oblast]], destroying a [[kindergarten]] and damaging nearby residential buildings. No casualties have been reported. The towns of [[Esman]] and [[Shalyhyne]] are also damaged by cross-border [[shell (projectile)|shelling]]. [https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-ato/3661217-russia-launches-airstrike-on-sumy-region.html (Ukrinform)]

The [[Ministry of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics (Iran)|Iranian Defence Ministry]] says that a [[drone warfare|drone attack]] on a military plant in [[Isfahan]], [[Iran]], was "unsuccessful" with at least three drones shot down by [[Anti-aircraft warfare|air defense]]s. No casualties have been reported. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/blast-heard-military-plant-irans-central-city-isfahan-state-media-2023-01-28/ (Reuters)] [https://apnews.com/article/iran-government-business-drones-2ea4c51f7be1e377b95d1fccc1c963ad (AP)]

[[Explosion]]s are reported at [[Islamic Republic of Iran Armed Forces|military]] sites and factories across Iran, including near the capital [[Tehran]]. Videos on [[social media]] appear to show explosions and large fires in the cities of [[Karaj]], [[Dezful]], and [[Tabriz]]. [https://www.iranintl.com/en/202301282372 (Iran International)]

An explosion occurs at an [[oil refinery]] in [[Azarshahr]], [[East Azerbaijan province]], according to Iranian media. [https://www.urdupoint.com/en/business/explosion-occurs-at-motor-oil-production-faci-1633237.html (Urdu Point)]

Two [[Israelis]] are shot and critically injured by a 13-year-old [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] in [[East Jerusalem]], in the [[West Bank]] and the attacker is shot and injured by one of his victims before being arrested. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/28/two-israelis-injured-in-east-jerusalem-shooting (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.timesofisrael.com/2-seriously-wounded-in-another-shooting-attack-in-jerusalem-attacker-neutralized/(''The Times of Israel'')]

Forces of the [[Wagner Group]] say that they have captured the village of Blahodatne, north of [[Bakhmut]]. However, [[Ukraine]] rejects the claim and says that it repelled the attack. [https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2023/01/29/ukraine-says-repelled-attack-near-blahodatne-russias-wagner-claims-control-a80073 (AFP via ''The Moscow Times'')]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] [[shell (projectile)|shell]] the city of [[Kherson]], killing three people, injuring six others, and damaging a hospital, school, and bus station. [https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2023-01-29/three-killed-by-russian-shelling-of-kherson-officials (Reuters via U.S. News & World Report)]

The governor of [[Comoé Province]] reports that 15 [[corpse]]s, who were among 24 passengers of two [[minibus]]es that departed the provincial capital of [[Banfora]] when suspected [[jihadist]]s hijacked the buses in [[Linguekoro]] and coerced the passengers to walk to [[Mangodara]], were discovered near Linguekoro. The governor also reports that 15 other passengers had been abducted. [https://news.abs-cbn.com/overseas/01/31/23/suspected-jihadists-kill-28-in-troubled-burkina-faso (AFP via ABS-CBN News)]

Unidentified [[warplane]]s, suspected to be [[Israeli Air Force|Israeli]], strike a convoy of [[Iran]]ian trucks that entered [[Syria]] from [[Iraq]] through the [[Al-Qa'im border crossing]]. At least six trucks are believed to have been destroyed. There are no immediate reports of casualties. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/warplanes-said-to-strike-convoy-of-iranian-militia-trucks-on-syria-iraq-border/ (''Times of Israel'')]

An 18-year-old [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] man is shot dead by a group of [[Israelis|Israeli]] [[civilian]]s near the [[Israeli settlement|settlement]] of [[Kedumim]], in the [[West Bank]]. In a separate incident, a Palestinian civilian home is [[Arson|set on fire]] by settlers. The occupants were not there at the time of the attack. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/29/israeli-guards-kill-palestinian-near-west-bank-settlement (Al Jazeera)]

At least 100 people are killed and 225 others are injured when a [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] [[Detonation|detonates]] his [[explosive belt]] at a [[mosque]] in [[Peshawar]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. The mosque is located inside a compound that includes the [[headquarters]] of [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Police|the provincial police force]] and a [[counter-terrorism]] department. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/1/31/pakistan-rescue-operation-peshawar-mosque-suicide-bombing (Al Jazeera)]

Ten [[Law enforcement in Burkina Faso|police officers]], two [[Volunteers for the Defense of the Homeland]] personnel, and a civilian are killed in a [[terrorist attack]] by at least 15 [[jihadist]]s in [[Falagountou]], [[Séno Province|Séno]], while five other police officers are injured and ten people are missing. [https://news.abs-cbn.com/overseas/01/31/23/suspected-jihadists-kill-28-in-troubled-burkina-faso (AFP via ABS-CBN News)]

Fifteen people are injured after a bomb explodes near a bus carrying police officers near [[Khirbet Ghazaleh]], [[Daraa Governorate]], [[Syria]]. [https://apnews.com/article/syria-government-damascus-746d21cba8b3aa97076fc317f55e01d1 (AP)]

[[France|French]] [[Minister of the Armed Forces (France)|Armed Forces Minister]] [[Sébastien Lecornu]] announces that [[List of foreign aid to Ukraine during the Russo-Ukrainian War|France will send]] 12 additional [[CAESAR self-propelled howitzer]]s to [[Ukraine]], and could also train [[Ukrainian Air Force]] pilots to operate French fighter jets as part of their latest military support package. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/france-send-12-additional-caesar-howitzers-ukraine-2023-01-31/ (Reuters)]

A [[Russia]]n [[9K720 Iskander|Iskander-K]] [[ballistic missile]] destroys an apartment complex in [[Kramatorsk]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], killing at least three people and injuring 20 others, according to local officials. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-rocket-destroys-apartment-building-kramatorsk-two-dead-governor-2023-02-01/ (Reuters)]

[[March 23 Movement|M23]] [[insurgent]]s capture the town of Kitshanga in [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], after days of heavy fighting. The [[Land Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo|DRC army]] confirms the withdrawal of its troops from the town, saying that it was a "tactical move to protect [[civilian]]s". [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/2/1/m23-rebels-take-control-of-kitshanga-in-eastern-dr-congo (Al Jazeera)]

Eight [[Syrian Army|soldiers]] are killed near [[Kafr Rumah]] in [[Idlib Governorate]] by [[Tahrir al-Sham]] militants. [https://www.barrons.com/news/jihadists-kill-eight-soldiers-in-northwest-syria-monitor-01675271407 (AFP via ''Barron's'')]

[[Prime Minister of Jamaica|Jamaican Prime Minister]] [[Andrew Holness]] says that his [[Politics of Jamaica|government]] is willing to send [[Jamaica Defence Force|troops]] to [[Haiti]] as part of a "multinational security assistance deployment". [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/jamaica-willing-take-part-military-intervention-haiti-pm-says-2023-02-01/ (Reuters)]

[[Prime Minister of Ethiopia|Ethiopian prime minister]] [[Abiy Ahmed]] meets with officials of the [[Tigray People's Liberation Front]] for the first time since the signing of a [[Ethiopia–Tigray peace agreement|peace treaty]] in November. [https://www.rfi.fr/en/international-news/20230203-ethiopia-pm-holds-first-meeting-with-tigray-leaders-since-peace-deal (AFP via RFI)]

The [[Federal Aviation Administration]] closes the airspace off the [[east coast of the United States]], and suspends arrivals at [[Myrtle Beach International Airport]], [[Charleston International Airport]], and [[Wilmington International Airport]] after [[President of the United States|President]] [[Joe Biden]] orders the [[high-altitude balloon]] to be shot down over the [[Atlantic Ocean]]. [https://euroweeklynews.com/2023/02/04/update-biden-issues-official-order-to-shoot-down-suspected-chinese-spy-balloon/ (Euro Weekly News)]

The high-altitude balloon is shot down by a [[United States Air Force]] [[Lockheed Martin F-22 Raptor|F-22 Raptor]] over the Atlantic Ocean at 2:39 PM EST. An operation to collect the remnants of the balloon in U.S. territorial waters is currently underway. It is the first time that an aircraft has been shot down in the United States since [[World War II]]. [https://apnews.com/article/politics-united-states-government-china-antony-blinken-51e49202f2a0a50541cde059934c4cfb (AP)] [https://edition.cnn.com/politics/live-news/suspected-chinese-balloon-over-us-02-04-23/index.html (CNN)]

At least 34 people are killed and 40 others are injured during clashes between [[Somaliland Armed Forces|Somalilander soldiers]] and anti-[[government of Somalia|government]] fighters in [[Las Anod|Laascaanood]], [[Sool]], [[Somaliland]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/least-34-killed-clashes-somaliland-two-doctors-public-hospital-2023-02-06/ (Reuters)]

Five [[Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades]] members are killed, three others are injured, and eight members are arrested during a raid by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] and subsequent gunbattle at a [[refugee camp]] near [[Jericho]], in the [[West Bank]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-64517703 (BBC News)]

[[Russia]] launches [[drone warfare|drone]] and [[cruise missile]] strikes across the south and east of [[Ukraine]] with large explosions reported in the [[Dnipropetrovsk Oblast|Dnipropetrovsk]], [[Luhansk Oblast|Luhansk]], [[Mykolaiv Oblast|Mykolaiv]], and [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Zaporizhzhia]] [[Oblasts of Ukraine|oblasts]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/feb/09/russia-launches-drone-and-missile-attacks-in-south-and-east-ukraine (''The Guardian'')]

[[Médecins Sans Frontières]] (MSF) suspends its operations in north-west [[Burkina Faso]] following the killings of two of its [[Burkinabé nationality law|Burkinabé]] [[Humanitarian aid|aid worker]]s near [[Dédougou]]. [https://www.africanews.com/2023/02/09/msf-suspends-operations-in-northwest-burkina-faso-after-gunmen-kill-two-staff/ (Africanews)]

[[Moldova]] says that [[Russia]] has fired [[missile]]s over the country at targets inside [[Ukraine]], condemning the missile flyover as a violation of its sovereignty, and also summons the [[List of diplomatic missions of Russia|Russian ambassador]] for an official explanation. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-64593488 (BBC News)]

A [[Russian Navy]] [[unmanned surface vehicle|drone boat]] strikes the [[Zatoka, Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi Raion, Odesa Oblast|Zatoka]] railway bridge on [[Highway H33 (Ukraine)|Highway H33]] near [[Odesa]]. It is believed to be the first use of the naval weapon in the war by Russian forces. [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2023/02/11/ukraine-invasion-russia-strikes-key-odessa-bridge-drone-boat/ (''The Telegraph'')]

Three [[Israel]]is, two brothers aged six and eight years old and a 20-year-old man, are killed in a [[car-ramming attack]] in [[Ramot, Jerusalem]]. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/at-least-6-wounded-2-seriously-in-suspected-car-ramming-attack-in-jerusalem/ (''Times of Israel'')]

Two people are killed and three others are injured when a vehicle hits a [[roadside bomb]] in [[Kohlu District]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/afghanistan-iran-politics-violence-85d906ca1d4c766811d6075246b15e8d (AP)]

At least ten [[Niger Armed Forces|soldiers]] are killed and thirteen others are injured in an [[ambush]] by [[jihadists]] in [[Tillabéri Region]], [[Niger]]. Sixteen others remain missing. [https://punchng.com/terrorists-kill-10-niger-soldiers/ (AFP via ''The Punch'')]

The White House's spokesperson [[John Kirby (admiral)|John Kirby]] announces that the [[United States Air Force]] shot down a high-altitude object over territorial waters in [[Alaska]], just days after shooting down a [[2023 Chinese balloon incident|Chinese balloon]] over the [[Atlantic Ocean]]. The object was ordered to be shot down by [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Joe Biden]] because it posed "a reasonable threat to the safety of civilian flight". [https://thehill.com/policy/defense/3852988-us-shoots-down-another-high-altitude-object-over-alaskan-airspace/ (The Hill)]

[[Prime Minister of Canada|Canadian Prime Minister]] [[Justin Trudeau]] orders the takedown of an [[unidentified flying object]] over [[Yukon]], which is later shot down by a [[United States Air Force]] [[Lockheed Martin F-22 Raptor|F-22 Raptor]] using a [[AIM-9X Sidewinder]]. The [[Canadian Armed Forces]] have been deployed to collect and analyze the object. [https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/11/politics/norad-additional-object-northern-canada/index.html (CNN)]

A [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] blows himself up near a security forces' vehicle in [[North Waziristan District]], [[Pakistan]], killing three soldiers and wounding 20 more. [https://www.newsdrum.in/international/three-killed-20-injured-in-suicide-attack-in-pak-police (News Drum)]

At least ten [[civilian]]s and a [[Syrian Armed Forces|soldier]] are killed in a [[mass shooting]] by [[Islamic State]] gunmen at a [[truffle]] farm in [[Palmyra]], [[Homs Governorate]], [[Syria]]. [https://www.voanews.com/a/monitor-is-attack-in-central-syria-kills-11-mostly-civilians/6959429.html (AFP via VOA)]

Seven [[Law enforcement in Peru|police officers]] are killed and another is injured when their vehicle is [[ambush]]ed in [[Valle de los Ríos Apurímac, Ene y Mantaro]], [[Peru]], in a suspected attack by remnants of [[Shining Path]]. [https://www.infobae.com/america/agencias/2023/02/11/mueren-siete-policias-en-una-emboscada-en-una-zona-cocalera-de-peru/ (''Infobae'')]

A [[United States Air Force]] [[General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon|F-16 Fighting Falcon]] shoots down an [[unidentified flying object]] over [[Lake Huron]] near the [[Canada–United States border]]. The Department of Defense describe the object as octagonal and flying at roughly 20,000 feet. [https://www.forbes.com/sites/mattnovak/2023/02/12/yet-another-flying-object-shot-down-near-us-canada-border-on-sunday/ (Forbes)]

[[United States Department of Defense|The Pentagon]] holds a [[press conference|press briefing]] on the shootdowns with [[NORAD]] [[Commander of NORAD|Commander]] [[Glen D. VanHerck]] stating it is currently unclear how the objects were "staying aloft", and "we're calling them objects, not balloons, for a reason". [https://eng.bharattimes.co.in/us-brings-down-another-flying-object-fourth-such-shootdown-in-9-days/ (Bharat Times)]

[[China]] says that it has detected an unidentified flying object over the [[Yellow Sea]], and warns that it is prepared to shoot down the object. The Qingdao Marine Development Bureau issues an alert to fishermen in the waters to be "on alert" and "avoid risks". [https://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3209964/china-spots-mystery-object-over-waters-near-northern-port-city (''South China Morning Post'')]

The [[Romanian Air Force]] unsuccessfully attempts to intercept an [[unidentified flying object]] detected roughly {{convert|11,000|m|mi}} above southeastern [[Romania]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/romania-detects-suspicious-weather-balloon-its-airspace-ministry-says-2023-02-14/ (Reuters)]

[[Moldova]] temporarily closes its airspace after receiving reports of a "balloon-like object". [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/moldova-has-temporarily-closed-its-airspace-national-airliner-says-2023-02-14/ (Reuters)]

[[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] blow up a bridge located between [[Bakhmut]] and [[Kostiantynivka]] as [[Russian Ground Forces|Russian troops]] and [[Wagner Group]] fighters advance on the city. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/feb/14/ukrainians-blow-up-bridge-in-bakhmut-amid-reports-russia-closing-in (''The Guardian'')]

[[United States Central Command]] says [[United States Armed Forces|U.S. forces]] have shot down an [[Iran]]ian [[Unmanned surveillance and reconnaissance aerial vehicle|UAV]] near a patrol base and [[Petroleum reservoir|oil field]] in [[Deir ez-Zor Governorate]], [[Syria]]. [https://www.newsweek.com/us-military-shoots-down-suspected-iranian-made-drone-over-syrian-oil-site-1781296 (Newsweek)]

Three [[Pakistani Taliban]] members are killed by fellow militants who were trying to free them while being transported from [[Miranshah]] to [[Bannu]], [[Pakistan]] by counter-terrorism officers. Four of the attackers are also killed in the ensuing shootout. [https://tribune.com.pk/story/2401098/seven-terrorists-killed-in-mir-ali-encounter (Tribune)]

[[Canada]] announces that it will deploy [[Royal Canadian Navy|navy]] vessels to [[Haiti]] for intelligence-gathering amid a worsening security situation in the [[Caribbean]] country. [https://apnews.com/article/politics-canada-government-caribbean-justin-trudeau-ariel-henry-0d39bd8778e435fe5c6adeb32a6d3e61 (AP)]

[[Armenia]] submits a peace treaty to [[Azerbaijan]] in an effort to end the decades-long conflict between the two countries. [https://www.dailysabah.com/world/europe/armenia-submits-nagorno-karabakh-peace-treaty-project-to-azerbaijan (''Daily Sabah'')]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] [[Shell (projectile)|shell]] [[Bakhmut]] with [[artillery]] and [[BM-21 Grad|Grad rockets]], killing five people and injuring nine others. [https://news.yahoo.com/russia-shelling-bakhmut-kills-5-012932885.html (''The Kyiv Independent'' via Yahoo! News)]

The [[Pakistani Taliban]] attack a [[police station]] in [[Karachi]]. Three [[militant]]s, three [[police officer]]s and a [[civilian]] are killed. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-south-asia-64678923 (BBC News)]

[[Islamic State]] militants kill at least 68 people, including 61 [[civilian]]s and seven [[Syrian Army|soldiers]], in [[al-Sukhnah, Syria|Al-Sukhnah]], [[Homs Governorate]], [[Syria]]. [https://www.barrons.com/news/suspected-is-attack-in-syria-death-toll-rises-to-68-monitor-505be31e (Barron's)]

At least 51 soldiers are killed when their convoy is [[ambush]]ed by [[Islamic extremism|jihadists]] on a road between [[Oursi Department|Oursi]] and [[Déou Department|Déou]]. At least 160 attackers are killed. [https://amp.rfi.fr/fr/afrique/20230220-burkina-faso-au-moins-51-soldats-tu%C3%A9s-dans-une-embuscade (RFI)]

[[Médecins Sans Frontières]] suspends its operations in [[Burkina Faso]] for an "indefinite" period, except when responding to [[lifesaving]] emergencies, following the killings of two of its [[Burkinabé nationality law|Burkinabé]] [[Humanitarian aid|aid worker]]s by armed men near [[Dédougou]] on 8 February. [https://www.barrons.com/news/msf-says-suspending-work-in-burkina-after-2-employees-killed-116958cf (AFP via ''Barron's'')]

Four people are killed and two others are injured, including [[Mamintal Alonto Adiong Jr.]], governor of [[Lanao del Sur]], when their convoy is [[ambush]]ed in [[Maguing]], [[Philippines]], by unknown gunmen. [https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/02/17/23/lanao-del-sur-governor-injured-4-others-killed-in-ambush (ABS-CBN News)]

Five people are killed and fifteen others are injured by an [[Israeli Air Force|Israeli]] [[airstrike]] on [[Kafr Sousa]], [[Damascus Governorate]], according to [[Syria]]n media. [https://news.yahoo.com/israeli-missile-strikes-building-central-225156459.html (Yahoo! News)]

The [[Republic of Korea Armed Forces|South Korean military]] reports that [[North Korea]] has fired a presumed [[Intercontinental ballistic missile|long-range ballistic missile]] into the [[Sea of Japan]]. [https://www.thenews.com.pk/print/1042116-n-korea-fires-long-range-ballistic-missile-says-seoul (AFP via ''The News'')]

The [[African Union]] announces the organization of a [[peace conference]] to address the instability in [[Libya]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230219-au-says-to-organise-libya-reconciliation-conference (AFP via France 24)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] [[Shell (projectile)|shell]] the city of [[Kherson]], killing at least six people and injuring 12 others, according to local officials. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/six-killed-12-wounded-russian-shelling-ukraines-kherson-military-2023-02-21/ (Reuters)]

The [[Somali National Army]] kills 42 [[al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[jihadist]]s in an [[military operation|operation]] in [[Mahaday]], [[Middle Shabelle]], [[Somalia]], which began overnight and lasted for several hours. [https://english.news.cn/20230222/c405358ab6584668be838816dce59c36/c.html (Xinhua)]

Eleven [[Palestinians]] are killed and 102 more injured when [[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli troops]] storm [[Nablus]], in the [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/2/22/israeli-forces-kill-palestinians-in-nablus-raid (Al Jazeera)]

Ten people are killed when [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] gunmen storm a house in [[Mogadishu]] where several lawmakers are staying. All four attackers are killed by [[Somali National Army|soldiers]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/al-shabaab-attack-kills-10-officials-house-somalia-ministry-2023-02-22/ (Reuters)]

At least 15 soldiers are killed during an [[ambush]] in [[Tin-Akoff Department]], [[Oudalan Province]]. Several of the attackers are killed in the ensuing gunfight. [https://www.dailysabah.com/world/africa/at-least-70-burkina-faso-troops-killed-in-twin-terrorist-attacks/amp (Daily Sabah)]

[[China]] unveils a 12-point position paper on ending the [[Russo-Ukrainian War|war]] in [[Ukraine]], ahead of an expected speech by President [[Xi Jinping]] on the conflict. Ukraine says that it hopes China can urge [[Russia]] to withdraw its [[Russian Ground Forces|troops]] in response to the paper. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/feb/24/china-calls-for-russia-ukraine-war-peace-talks (''The Guardian'')]
[[Poland]] delivers the first [[Leopard 2]] [[main battle tank]]s to Ukraine. [https://www.dw.com/en/poland-delivers-first-leopard-tanks-to-ukraine/a-64809432 (DW)]

Twelve people are killed in a [[mass shooting]] by [[insurgent]]s in a village in [[Bankass Cercle]], [[Mopti Region]], [[Mali]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/gunmen-kill-least-12-civilians-central-mali-village-2023-02-24/ (Reuters)]

Nineteen athletes are injured by small [[explosion]]s during the [[Mount Cameroon Race of Hope]] in [[Buea]], [[Southwest Region (Cameroon)|Southwest Region]], [[Cameroon]]. The [[Ambazonia Defence Forces]] claim responsibility for the incident. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/nineteen-athletes-wounded-after-blasts-race-cameroon-doctor-2023-02-25/ (Reuters)]
