Two [[Israeli settlers]] are killed by a [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] gunman in [[Huwara]], [[Nablus Governorate]], [[West Bank]]. During revenge attacks by [[Israelis]], a Palestinian is shot and killed and 98 others are injured, many during [[arson]] attacks. [https://edition.cnn.com/2023/02/26/middleeast/west-bank-violence-intl/index.html (CNN)]

[[Mexican Army|Soldiers]] open fire on a [[pickup truck]] carrying unarmed [[civilian]]s in [[Nuevo Laredo]], [[Tamaulipas]], killing five people, sparking protests and riots by local people. [https://www.elpasotimes.com/story/news/2023/02/27/mexican-border-army-residents-clash-killing-in-nuevo-laredo/69950691007/ (''El Paso Times'')]

Four people are killed and 14 others are injured in a bombing at a market in [[Barkhan]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/2/26/blast-kills-four-at-crowded-bazaar-in-pakistans-balochistan (Al Jazeera)]

[[Belarusian opposition|Belarusian opposition partisans]] launch a [[drone attack]] on [[Russia]]n aircraft at the [[Machulishchy (air base)|Machulishchy air base]]. [https://news.yahoo.com/belarusian-partisans-sabotaged-machulishchy-194148130.html (''Ukrainska Pravda'' via ''Yahoo! News'')]

[[March 23 Movement|M23]] rebels seize the town of Rubaya and the [[Rubaya mines|Rubaya coltan mines]] in [[North Kivu]], [[DRC]], after [[Land Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo|government forces]] withdraw from the area. [https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/congolese-m23-rebels-seize-major-mining-town-of-rubaya/2832658 (Anadolu Agency)]

An [[Israeli Americans|Israeli-American]] man is killed in a [[drive-by shooting]] on a highway in [[Jericho]], in the [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/2/28/israeli-american-killed-in-jericho-attack (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Taliban]] kill the leader of operations and intelligence of [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province]] during a raid in  [[Kabul]]. [https://tribune.com.pk/story/2403690/iskp-chief-killed-in-kabul (''The Express Tribune'')]

[[Russia]] accuses a Ukrainian [[sabotage]] group of attacking the villages of Lyubechane and Sushany in [[Bryansk Oblast]] and taking [[hostage]]s. However, [[Ukraine]] accuses Russia of staging a false "provocation". [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-forces-are-fighting-ukrainian-sabotage-group-border-region-russian-news-2023-03-02/ (Reuters)]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] missile strike on an [[apartment]] building in the city of [[Zaporizhzhia]] kills three [[civilian]]s and injures at least four others, according to [[Ukrainian police]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-missile-strike-kills-3-zaporizhzhia-says-ukraine-police-2023-03-02/ (Reuters)]

Heavy street fighting takes place between [[Russian Ground Forces|Russian]] and [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] in [[Bakhmut]], [[Donetsk Oblast]]. The city's deputy mayor Oleksandr Marchenko says that "not a single building" has remained untouched by fighting, and that the city is "almost destroyed". [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-64846666 (BBC News)]

In a rare high-level visit to the [[Donbas]], [[Minister of Defence (Russia)|Russian Defence Minister]] [[Sergei Shoigu]] is filmed inspecting troops in "the eastern military district in the south Donetsk direction". [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/mar/04/russia-ukraine-war-live-ukraine-fortifying-bakhmut-as-russian-encirclement-looms (''The Guardian'')]

[[Burundi]] deploys 100 [[National Defence Force (Burundi)|troops]] to the eastern [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]] to help the country fight [[insurgencies]] by [[militia]]s, including [[March 23 Movement|M23]]. [https://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/tea/news/east-africa/burundi-to-deploy-troops-to-east-drc-4145612 (AFP via ''The East African'')]

Three [[Armenia]]n police officers and two [[Azerbaijani soldier]]s are killed during [[Armenia–Azerbaijan border|border]] clashes near the [[Lachin Corridor]]. Both countries accuse the other of opening fire first. [https://www.dw.com/en/armenian-and-azerbaijani-border-clash-leaves-five-dead/a-64891575 (DW)]

[[Jihadist]] group [[al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula]] acknowledges that a senior leader was killed in a recent [[airstrike]] by the [[United States Air Force]] in [[Yemen]]. [https://www.wionews.com/world/al-qaeda-says-top-leader-killed-in-strike-in-yemen-568947 (WION)]

At least nine [[Law enforcement in Pakistan|police officer]]s are killed and 16 other people are injured in [[Sibi District]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]], when a [[Baloch nationalism|separatist]] [[suicide bomber]] riding on a motorcycle [[vehicle-ramming attack|rams]] a [[Balochistan Police|police]] vehicle. [https://www.dw.com/en/pakistan-suicide-bomb-kills-police-officers-in-balochistan/a-64894133 (DW)]

Five [[Palestinians]] are injured by [[Israeli settlement|Israeli settlers]] attacking a family on a street in [[Huwara]], in the [[West Bank]]. Twenty-five Palestinians are injured by [[tear gas]] fired by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] during the attack. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/3/7/israeli-attack-wounds-palestinians-as-settlers-and-soldiers-dance (Al Jazeera)]

[[Israeli Air Force|Israeli]] [[warplane]]s strike [[Syria]]'s [[Aleppo International Airport]] with [[air-to-surface missile]]s, damaging the runway and putting the [[List of airports in Syria|airport]] out of service. The [[Ministry of Transport (Syria)|Syrian transport ministry]] says that the delivery of [[humanitarian aid]] to [[Idlib Governorate|Idlib]] will be rerouted to [[Bassel Al-Assad International Airport]] in [[Latakia Governorate]] following the strike. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/3/7/israeli-attack-puts-syrias-aleppo-airport-out-of-service-report (Al Jazeera)]

At least six members of the [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] militant group [[Jenin Brigades]] are killed by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] during a raid in [[Jenin]], [[West Bank]]. Among those killed is the killer of two [[Israeli settlers]] last month. [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230307-israeli-troops-kill-six-during-new-raid-in-jenin (AFP via France 24)]

[[Allied Democratic Forces]] [[jihadist]] [[insurgent]]s use [[machete]]s to kill about 40 people in the village of Mukondi, [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/least-36-killed-east-congo-village-attack-local-official-civil-society-survivor-2023-03-09/ (Reuters)]

A [[Drone warfare|drone strike]] on a [[Iran]]ian-backed [[weapons factory]] by an unknown attacker in [[Deir ez-Zor Governorate]], [[Syria]], kills seven people and injures 15 others, according to the [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights]], which describes the dead as three [[Afghans|Afghan]] fighters, three [[Syrians|Syrian]] [[civilian]]s and one unidentified Syrian. [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2264596/middle-east (Arab News)]

[[Russia]] launches [[cruise missile]]s at targets across [[Ukraine]]. Buildings and [[critical infrastructure]] are damaged, and at least five [[civilian]]s [[Attacks on civilians in the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine|were killed]] in [[Lviv Oblast]] when a missile destroyed their home, according to the region's governor [[Maksym Kozytskyy]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-64897888 (BBC News)]

[[Daud Muzamil]], the [[Taliban]]-appointed [[List of governors of Balkh|governor]] of [[Balkh Province]], is killed by an [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|Islamic State]] [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] at his office in [[Mazar-i-Sharif]]. Two civilians are also killed during the attack and four others wounded. [https://tolonews.com/afghanistan-182409 (TOLO News)] [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/03/09/Taliban-governor-of-Afghanistan-s-Balkh-province-killed-in-blast-at-his-office (Al Arabiya)]

Three [[Palestinian Islamic Jihad]] members are killed by [[Special forces of Israel|Israeli special units]] during a [[Military operation|operation]] in [[Jenin]], [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/3/9/israeli-special-forces-kill-3-palestinians-in-jenin-shoot-out (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.timesofisrael.com/3-islamic-jihad-gunmen-killed-by-undercover-forces-in-northern-west-bank/ (The Times of Israel)]

Three people are wounded by a shooting on [[Dizengoff Street]], in [[Tel Aviv]]. The perpetrator is killed by [[Israel Police|police]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/3/9/israeli-emergency-services-say-three-injured-in-tel-aviv-shooting (Al Jazeera)]

Eleven people are killed and four others are injured during an operation to retake territory in northeast [[Burkina Faso]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/eleven-soldiers-killed-burkina-fasos-effort-regain-territory-2023-03-09/ (Reuters)]

At least 25 people are killed when [[Boko Haram]] gunmen storm a fishing village in [[Dikwa]], [[Borno State|Borno]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/islamist-militants-kill-least-25-nigerias-borno-state-2023-03-09/ (Reuters)]

A [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] man is shot dead by an [[Israeli settlement|Israeli settler]] near a farm in [[Karnei Shomron]], in the [[West Bank]]. The [[Israel Defense Forces]] (IDF) claims that the Palestinian man was armed at the time. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/3/10/israeli-settler-kills-palestinian-in-occupied-west-bank (Al Jazeera)]

[[Angola]] announces that it will deploy [[Angolan Army|troops]] to the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], following the failure of a [[ceasefire]] between [[Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo|government forces]] and [[March 23 Movement|M23 rebels]] in [[North Kivu]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-64927180 (BBC News)]

A [[security guard]] is killed and eight other people are injured by an [[explosion]] in [[Mazar-i-Sharif]], [[Balkh Province]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/blast-hits-afghanistans-northern-balkh-province-police-2023-03-11/ (Reuters)]

Sixteen people are killed by [[Fula people|Fula]] gunmen at a [[police checkpoint]] in [[Zangon Kataf]], [[Kaduna State]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://apnews.com/article/nigeria-gunmen-violence-killings-5607147295fb5e2b4584d70c0c8e61ec (AP)]

[[Israel]]i [[airstrike]]s at a weapons depot in [[Masyaf]], [[Hama Governorate]], [[Syria]], kill a [[Syrian soldier]] and two pro-[[Iran]]ian [[militant]]s. [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2266981/middle-east (Arab News)]

[[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] kill three [[Palestinian]] gunmen near [[Nablus]], [[West Bank]], after coming under fire. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/mar/12/israeli-troops-kill-three-palestinian-gunmen-in-west-bank (''The Guardian'')]

Nineteen people are killed by suspected [[Islamist]] [[insurgent]]s in Kirindera, [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/suspected-islamist-militants-kill-19-another-village-raid-east-congo-2023-03-12/ (Reuters)]

[[Russian Air Force]] [[Sukhoi Su-27|Su-27]] [[fighter aircraft|fighter jet]]s "intercept and hit" a [[United States Air Force]] [[MQ-9|MQ-9 Reaper drone]] over the [[Black Sea]], with the collision damaging the [[unmanned combat aerial vehicle|drone]]'s [[propeller]] and causing the [[United States]] to crash the drone into [[international waters]]. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2023/03/14/russia-forces-down-us-reaper-drone-black-sea/ (''The Washington Post'')] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/us-says-reaper-drone-crashes-into-black-sea-after-russian-intercept-2023-03-14/ (Reuters)]

At least five people are killed and 11 others are injured, including [[Gedo]] governor Ahmed Bulle Gared, when a [[suicide attack|suicide]] [[car bomb]]er [[vehicle-ramming attack|drives into]] a guest house in [[Bardera]], [[Jubaland]], [[Somalia]]. [https://www.barrons.com/news/five-killed-in-somalia-suicide-attack-governor-wounded-f5a92f5a (AFP via ''Barron's'')]

A man accused of being the perpetrator of an [[explosion]] at the [[Megiddo Junction]] which injured a [[civilian]] two days ago is shot and killed by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]]. The man is believed to have crossed into northern [[Israel]] from [[Lebanon]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/3/15/israeli-army-says-it-killed-suspected-bomber (Al Jazeera)]

[[Poland]] announces that it will deliver four [[Mikoyan MiG-29|MiG-29]] [[fighter aircraft|fighter jet]]s to [[Ukraine]], becoming the first [[NATO]] member state to send warplanes to Ukraine. [https://news.sky.com/story/poland-to-send-at-least-four-russian-made-mig-29-fighter-jets-to-ukraine-12835338 (Sky News)]

Two militants including [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]] and [[Hamas]] commanders and two civilians are killed and five others are injured during a raid by [[Israeli security forces]] in the [[Jenin refugee camp]], in the [[West Bank]]. [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-734546 (''The Jerusalem Post'')] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/3/16/israeli-forces-kill-palestinians-in-latest-jenin-raid (Al Jazeera)]

Eight militants and two [[civilian]] children are killed during a [[military operation]] by the [[Pakistan Army]] in Zinghara, [[South Waziristan]]. [https://english.news.cn/20230316/dbe2ccc3a42143d387f7e7455deb455c/c.html (Xinhua)]

The [[Libyan National Army]] says that it has found about two and a half tonnes of [[uranium ore]] contained in ten drums,  near [[Chad–Libya border|the border]] with [[Chad]], that was reported missing by the [[International Atomic Energy Agency]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-64981875 (BBC News)]

[[Slovakia]] announces that it will donate its [[Mikoyan MiG-29|MiG-29]] [[fighter aircraft|fighter jet]]s, and supply part of its [[2K12 Kub|Kub air-defense system]] to [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/slovak-government-send-mig-29-fighter-jets-ukraine-pm-2023-03-17/ (Reuters)]

The [[Taliban]] kill several [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province]] [[insurgent]]s and seize weapons and [[ammunition]]s during raids at hideouts in [[Mazar-i-Sharif]], [[Balkh Province]]. [https://english.news.cn/20230318/61fe5e9923ee4bef9becde400fece1c9/c.html (Xinhua)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] [[shell (projectile)|shell]] [[Kramatorsk]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], with [[cluster munition]]s, killing at least two [[civilian]]s and injuring five others. [https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-ato/3684282-enemy-shells-kramatorsk-with-cluster-munitions-casualties-reported.html (Ukrinform)]

Nine [[Chinese people|Chinese nationals]] are killed and two others are injured when suspected rebels storm the Chinese-run Chimbolo [[gold mine]] in [[Ouaka]], [[Central African Republic]]. [https://apnews.com/article/chinese-killed-central-african-republic-rebels-mine-d8b3a467dc3c8faf0627fb16cc3104ed (AP)]

The [[European Union]] approves a [[€]]2 billion plan to supply 1 million [[Shell (projectile)|artillery shells]] to [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/03/20/ukraine-eu-ammunition-defense/59d2460a-c6f5-11ed-9cc5-a58a4f6d84cd_story.html (''The Washington Post'')] [https://www.kyivpost.com/post/14573 (Kyiv Post)]

Ukraine's [[Ministry of Defence (Ukraine)|Ministry of Defence]] says that a Russian shipment of [[Kalibr (missile family)|Kalibr]] [[cruise missile]]s was blown up as it was being transported by [[Rail transport|rail]] in [[Dzhankoi]], [[Crimea]]. At least one person is reportedly injured. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-says-russia-cruise-missiles-blown-up-transit-crimea-2023-03-20/ (Reuters)]

The [[United Kingdom]] confirms that it will provide [[Ukraine]] with [[depleted uranium]] armour-piercing shells, alongside its [[Challenger 2]] [[main battle tank]]s, saying that there is a "low risk" of radiation contamination. [[President of Russia|Russian president]] [[Vladimir Putin]] says Russia would be "forced to react" to the British move. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-65032671 (BBC News)] [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-65032671 (BBC News)]

The [[Somali National Army]] and pro-[[Federal Government of Somalia|government]] [[militant]]s kill 30 [[al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[jihadist]]s and injure many others while defending a [[military base]] in the south of the country. [https://english.news.cn/20230321/8391460236ce4a238be2135d4643bdbc/c.html (Xinhua)]

The [[United Nations]] reports that 187 people have been killed in a wave of violence in [[Haiti]] in the past eleven days during clashes between [[gang|gangs]]. Since the beginning of the year, 531 people have been murdered in the country. [https://apnews.com/article/haiti-gang-violence-killed-31eaed96031c7bbc6b3c03ab925d2860 (AP)] [https://www.france24.com/en/americas/20230321-un-gang-related-violence-has-killed-more-than-530-in-haiti-this-year (France24)]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[missile strike]] on an apartment building in the city of [[Zaporizhzhia]] kills a [[civilian]] and injures 25 others. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-war-xi-china-japan-kishida-summit-07af10f35b16472d12549875af420d08 (AP)]
A Russian drone strike in [[Rzhyshchiv]] kills at least nine civilians and injures 29 others. [https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/russian-attack-rzhyshchiv-death-toll-062932372.html (Yahoo)]

Ten [[Yemeni soldier]]s are killed by [[Houthi movement|Houthi]] [[Islamist]]s in [[Harib District]], [[Marib Governorate]], despite a [[truce]] reached between the [[politics of Yemen|government]] and the rebels on Monday. [https://www.france24.com/en/middle-east/20230322-at-least-10-soldiers-killed-in-yemen-as-renewed-fighting-hinders-peace-efforts (AFP via France 24)]

Ten [[Volunteers for the Defense of the Homeland|volunteers]] and four [[Burkina Faso Armed Forces]] soldiers are killed during an [[ambush]] in [[Centre-Nord Region]], [[Burkina Faso]]. Twenty attackers are killed. [https://amp.france24.com/en/africa/20230323-at-least-14-members-of-burkina-faso-security-forces-killed-in-terror-attack (France24)]

A United States [[Private military contractor|contractor]] is killed and five others are injured when a [[unmanned combat aerial vehicle|drone]] hits a U.S. base near [[Al-Hasakah]] in northern [[Syria]]. The United States responds with airstrikes on [[Iran]]ian-linked targets, killing eleven people. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/3/24/us-says-air-strikes-hit-syria-targets-after-deadly-drone-attack (Al Jazeera)]

A [[police raid]] in a [[favela]] in [[São Gonçalo, Rio de Janeiro|São Gonçalo]], [[Rio de Janeiro (state)|Rio de Janeiro]], [[Brazil]], results in the deaths of 13 people and the capture of two [[Comando Vermelho]] gang leaders from the northern [[states of Brazil|states]] of [[Pará]] and [[Sergipe]]. [https://www.barrons.com/news/brazil-police-raid-leaves-11-dead-in-favela-near-rio-media-9d18ff81 (''Barron's'')]

A rocket attack targets a U.S. [[military base]] in [[Syria]] in retaliation for retaliatory [[airstrike]]s from the United States hours earlier. No damages or casualties are reported. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2023/03/24/Missile-attack-targets-U-S-base-in-east-Syria-Security-source-media (Al Arabiya)]

Fifteen people are killed and 40 others are kidnapped in [[Hama Governorate]] during an [[ambush]] on [[truffle]] hunters by [[Islamic State]] members. [https://www.ucanews.com/news/islamic-state-group-kills-15-truffle-hunters-in-syria/100787 (UCA News)]

Three [[Military of Yemen|Yemeni soldiers]] are killed and several others are injured by a [[Houthi]] [[drone attack]] on a convoy carrying [[politics of Yemen|government]] officials, including [[Yemen]]'s defense minister. [http://english.news.cn/20230325/9321bc20cfef4614af8998a5e20d0495/c.html (Xinhua)]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[missile strike]] on [[Sloviansk]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], kills at least two [[civilian]]s and injures 29 others. [https://www.euronews.com/2023/03/27/two-killed-and-29-wounded-in-shelling-of-eastern-ukrainian-city (Euronews)]

The head of the [[Blagodarnensky District]] in [[Stavropol Krai]], [[Russia]], announces the death of Dmitry Lisitsky, commander of a battalion of the [[247th Guards Air Assault Regiment]] who participated in the 2014 [[Battle of Ilovaisk]]. [[Ukraine]] says that he was killed in battle while pro-Russian sources say that he committed [[suicide]]. [https://novayagazeta.eu/articles/2023/03/27/umer-rossiiskii-komandir-dmitrii-lisitskii-ego-nazyvaiut-odnim-iz-organizatorov-ilovaiskogo-kotla-na-vostoke-ukrainy-v-2014-godu-news (''Novaya Gazeta Europe'')]

Six people are killed and several others are injured when a [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] [[detonate]]s himself near the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Afghanistan)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] [[headquarters]] in [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/3/27/blast-near-afghanistan-foreign-ministry-kills-at-least-two-ngo (Al Jazeera)]

Six [[Houthis]] and five [[Military of Yemen|Yemeni soldiers]] are killed during clashes in government-controlled [[Lahj Governorate]], [[Yemen]]. [https://english.news.cn/20230328/32a99a9f3e87447faa3305be4ee047b6/c.html (Xinhua)]

[[Fazil Mustafa]], an opposition member of [[Azerbaijan]]'s [[National Assembly (Azerbaijan)|National Assembly]], is shot multiple times outside his home in [[Baku]] by unknown assailants in an [[assassination|assassination attempt]]. Mustafa's condition is described as satisfactory, and his life is not reported to be in danger. [https://news.az/news/azerbaijani-mp-fazil-mustafa-shot-near-his-home (News.az)]

[[National Liberation Army (Colombia)|ELN]] rebels launch homemade [[Mortar (weapon)|mortar]] shells at a [[military base]] in [[El Carmen, Norte de Santander|El Carmen]], [[Norte de Santander]], [[Colombia]], killing nine [[Military Forces of Colombia|soldiers]] and injuring nine others. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/militants-kill-9-soldiers-attack-colombias-military-98205348 (ABC News)]
Eight people are killed by a bombing in a village in [[Chin State]], [[Myanmar]]. [https://apnews.com/article/myanmar-village-bombing-chin-military-a17783e64e7b9bf5b7872c1a9ca43d01 (AP)]

Four people are killed and six others are injured by two [[Improvised explosive device|roadside bombings]] targeting police in [[Lakki Marwat]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-militants-police-attacked-0da516557c096c84436a2f35626eaf5b (AP)]

[[Pirate]]s [[kidnap]] some crew members of a [[Denmark|Danish]]-owned ship which they later abandon near [[São Tomé and Príncipe]]. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/03/31/Some-crew-members-missing-after-Gulf-of-Guinea-pirate-attack (Al Arabiya)]

Russian pro-[[government of Russia|government]] war correspondent [[Vladlen Tatarsky]] is killed by a [[bomb]]ing at a café in [[Saint Petersburg]] owned by oligarch [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]]. Sixteen others are injured. [https://tass.ru/proisshestviya/17429999 (TASS)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] shell [[Kostiantynivka]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], killing six [[civilian]]s and injuring eight others, according to the [[Ukrainian government]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/ukraine-says-least-three-killed-six-wounded-russian-shelling-east-country-2023-04-02/ (Reuters)]

[[Military of South Sudan|South Sudanese troops]] arrive in [[Goma]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], becoming the fourth country to join a [[coalition]] of [[peacekeeping]] missions to fight [[insurgencies]]. [https://english.news.cn/20230402/cf6d51c0abea44d48169ccdc66cd71ea/c.html (Xinhua)]

[[Yevgeny Prigozhin]], the head of the [[Wagner Group]], claims "legal control" of [[Bakhmut]], although [[Ukraine]] denies this, stating that its troops continue to remain in the city's western districts. [https://www.cnbc.com/2023/04/03/ukraine-war-live-updates-latest-news-on-russia-and-the-war-in-ukraine.html (CNBC)]

A [[Lions' Den (militant group)|Lions' Den]] militant and a [[Fatah]] member are killed during a raid by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in [[Nablus]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. Two other [[Palestinians]] are arrested and dozens more are hospitalized due to [[tear gas]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/3/israeli-forces-kill-two-palestinians-in-occupied-west-bank-raid-2 (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Israeli Air Force]] launches [[airstrike]]s near [[Damascus]], killing two [[civilian]]s, according to Syrian [[Syrian Arab News Agency|state media]]. The [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights]] says that an "unknown number" of [[Iran]]-backed militants were also killed in the strikes, which targeted a [[counter-battery radar]] in [[As-Suwayda Governorate]], and a glass factory in [[al-Kiswah]], [[Rif Dimashq Governorate]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/middle-east/20230404-two-civilians-killed-in-israeli-air-strike-on-syria-s-damascus (France 24)]

[[United States Central Command]] says that [[United States Armed Forces|U.S. forces]] killed senior [[Islamic State]] leader Khalid 'Aydd Ahmad al-Jabouri, who was allegedly planning attacks in [[Europe]] during [[Easter]], in an overnight raid in rebel-held northwest [[Syria]]. The U.S. also says that there were no civilian casualties in the raid. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/us-military-operation-kills-islamic-state-leader-syria-officials-2023-04-04/ (Reuters)]

Six [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|Islamic State]] members are killed during a raid by the [[Taliban]] in [[Balkh Province]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/04/04/Taliban-raid-kills-six-ISIS-members-in-Afghanistan-s-Balkh-province (Al Arabiya)]

[[Israel Police|Israeli police]] storm [[Al-Aqsa Mosque]] in [[Jerusalem]] in response to [[rioting]], injuring seven [[Palestinians]] and resulting in clashes in the [[West Bank]] and in [[Gaza Strip|Gaza]], where nine rockets were launched. [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2281526/middle-east (Arab News)]

Deputy leader [[Andrii Sybiha]] says that [[Ukraine]] is willing to hold talks on the future of [[Crimea]] if a Ukrainian [[counter-offensive]] reaches the Crimean administrative border. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/apr/06/ukraine-talks-crimea-russia-zelenskiy (''The Guardian'')]

At least 34 [[rocket]]s are fired, four of which landed, from [[southern Lebanon]] toward [[Northern District (Israel)|northern Israel]], injuring three people. [[Israel]] later fires [[artillery]] toward two [[Lebanon|Lebanese]] villages and the [[Gaza Strip]], wounding a [[Palestinian]] child. [https://menafn.com/1105961453/Palestinian-Child-Wounded-In-Israeli-Strike-On-Gaza-Wafa (MENAFN)]

At least 44 people are killed by [[jihadist]]s in two villages in [[Séno Province]], [[Sahel Region]], [[Burkina Faso]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/dual-attacks-northern-burkina-faso-kill-44-civilians-authorities-say-2023-04-08/ (Reuters)]

An [[Italians|Italian]] [[tourism in Israel|tourist]] is killed and six Britons and Italians are injured in a [[vehicle-ramming attack]] in [[Tel Aviv]], [[Israel]]. The perpetrator is shot dead by police. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-65217134 (BBC News)]

Three British Israelis are killed in a [[drive-by shooting]] near the [[Hamra, Bik'at HaYarden|Hamra]] [[Israeli settlement|settlement]] in the [[West Bank]]. [https://apnews.com/article/israel-lebanon-palestinian-jerusalem-alaqsa-hezbollah-19aabd8b5eeb9f972db0c35468a047eb (AP)]

The [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|UK defence ministry]] says that [[Russian forces]] have captured the [[Bakhmutka]] river west banks, endangering [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] [[supply line]]s. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-seizes-bakhmutka-rivers-west-bank-says-uk-defence-ministry-2023-04-07/ (Reuters)]

Twenty people are killed after [[Islamic State – Central Africa Province|Islamic State]] members storm a village in Musandaba, [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.wionews.com/world/at-least-20-killed-after-attack-in-eastern-congo-islamic-state-claims-responsibility-580587/amp (WION)]

[[Pakistan]] arrests the founder of the [[Baloch Nationalist Army]] in the country's southwest. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/04/07/pakistan-baluch-nationalists-gulzar-imam-shambay-intelligence/9846c75a-d517-11ed-ac8b-cd7da05168e9_story.html (AP via ''The Washington Post'')]

Two [[Pakistan Army|soldiers]] are killed after their vehicle hits a [[Improvised explosive device|roadside bomb]] in [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. In a separate incident, a [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Police|police officer]] is killed and two more injured during a [[grenade]] attack in [[Swabi]]. The [[Pakistani Taliban]] claims responsibility for both attacks. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-taliban-bomb-attack-soldiers-7c9a131fc2a96be494c9ca0db9a8e15f (Associated Press)]

[[Israel]] launches retaliatory [[airstrike]]s on [[Syria]]n territory after several rockets were launched toward the [[Israeli-occupied territories|Israeli-occupied]] [[Syria|Syrian]] [[Golan Heights]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/apr/09/israel-launches-strikes-in-syria-after-rocket-fire (''The Guardian'')]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] missile strike on [[Zaporizhzhia]] destroys a residential building and damages dozens of other buildings, killing two [[civilian]]s and injuring another. Russian attacks are also reported in other settlements, including [[Orikhiv]] and [[Huliaipole]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/two-killed-russian-strike-ukraines-zaporizhzhia-officials-2023-04-09/ (Reuters)] [https://www.aa.com.tr/en/russia-ukraine-war/at-least-3-killed-5-injured-in-russian-strikes-in-ukraine-s-zaporizhzhia/2867572 (Anadolu Agency)]

Eight people are killed by a [[land mine]] planted by [[Islamic State]] in [[Deir ez-Zor]], [[Syria]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/six-civilians-killed-by-land-mine-left-by-islamic-state-syria-state-news-2023-04-09/ (Reuters)]
Five people are killed after a convoy is ambushed in [[Agadez Region]], [[Niger]]. [https://apnews.com/article/niger-convoy-attacked-soldiers-killed-9e6a66f63f5e3db417737ef92e7484cc (AP)]

Four people are killed and 15 others are injured when a [[Car bomb|motorcycle bomb]] targeting a [[Balochistan Police|police]] vehicle [[explode]]s in [[Quetta]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/10/deadly-blast-hits-police-vehicle-in-pakistans-quetta-official (Al Jazeera)]

A 15-year-old [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] boy is killed by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in [[Jericho]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/10/israeli-army-kills-palestinian-settlers-march-to-illegal-outpost (Al Jazeera)]

At least 100 people are killed in an airstrike by the [[State Administration Council|military junta]] in the village of Pazigyi, [[Kanbalu Township]], [[Sagaing Region|Sagaing]], in the third major attack against [[civilian]]s since the junta's [[offensive (military)|offensive]] in Sagaing began in February. It is the junta's deadliest attack since seizing power in [[2021 Myanmar coup d'état|2021]]. [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/11/world/asia/myanmar-airstrike.html (''The New York Times'')]

Fighting occurs near the [[Armenia]]n village of [[Tegh]], resulting in the deaths of four Armenian and three [[Azerbaijan]]i soldiers. [https://apnews.com/article/nagorno-karabakh-armenia-azerbaijan-soldiers-af13054c5bbbe0c54437adc97b537de0 (Associated Press)]

Four [[Balochistan Police|police personnel]] and a [[terrorism in Pakistan|terrorist]] are killed in an [[shootout|exchange of fire]] during a [[Balochistan Police|police]] operation in [[Kuchlak]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://gnnhd.tv/news/20066/four-cops-martyred-during-kuchlak-operation (GNN)]

A [[Palestinian National Security Forces]] member and another [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] man are killed by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in [[Elon Moreh]], [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/11/israeli-soldiers-kill-two-palestinians-near-nablus (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Taliban]] say that the [[313 Central Corps]] carried out an operation in [[Parwan Province]], killing eight rebels, including a commander, of the [[National Resistance Front of Afghanistan|National Resistance Front]]. [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2285086/world (Arab News)]
The village of [[Tidermène]] is captured by the [[Islamic State in the Greater Sahara]]. [https://www.thedefensepost.com/2023/04/12/is-jihadists-tidermene-mali/ (Defense Post)]

The [[European Council]] agrees to donate a billion [[euro]]s worth of ammunition to [[Ukraine]] through an [[European Union|EU]] financing instrument. [https://www.tagesschau.de/newsticker/liveblog-ukraine-donnerstag-225.html (Tagesschau)]

The [[German government]] approves a request by [[Poland]] for the export of former [[East Germany|GDR]] [[MiG-29]] fighter jets to [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.tagesschau.de/ausland/europa/polen-ukraine-kampfjets-103.html (Tagesschau)]

In the battle of [[Bakhmut]], [[Armed forces of Russia|Russian forces]] are able to reach the centre of the city, according to [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] and [[Russia]]n sources. [https://www.spiegel.de/ausland/ukraine-news-am-donnerstag-mehrere-russische-regionen-sagen-militaerparaden-ab-offenbar-wegen-sicherheitsbedenken-a-15bb4ac8-3fbe-4ab1-8b24-8be6b8701d23 (Spiegel)]

Four people are killed and 12 others are injured by a series of [[car bomb]]ings during a [[Thingyan]] festival in [[Lashio]], [[Shan State]], [[Myanmar]]. [https://www.wionews.com/world/four-killed-several-injured-in-car-bomb-blasts-during-new-year-festival-in-myanmar-582164 (WION)]

The [[2021 Sudan coup d'état|Sudanese government]] warns of a possible conflict after the [[Rapid Support Forces]] [[paramilitary]] group mobilizes in several [[Sudanese cities]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/13/sudans-army-warns-of-rsfs-movements-in-khartoum-other-cities (Al Jazeera)]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] missile strike on [[Sloviansk]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], kills at least eight [[civilian]]s and injures 21 others. [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/14/world/ukraine-strike-sloviansk-toddler.html (''The New York Times'')]

A major [[prisoner swap]] of nearly 900 prisoners begins between rival factions in [[Yemen]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230414-major-yemen-prisoner-swap-under-way-as-first-plane-leaves-icrc (AFP via France 24)]

The [[Islamic State in the Greater Sahara]] encircles the strategic town of [[Ménaka]] in [[Ménaka Region]], [[Mali]]. [https://www.theafricareport.com/300081/mali-sahel-based-jihadists-threaten-key-town-of-menaka-gao-region/ (''The Africa Report'')]

At least 42 people are killed by suspected [[CODECO]] militants during a raid at a village in [[Ituri Province]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://apnews.com/article/eastern-congo-militia-civilians-killed-05f2efb7636ec163a3c49987eda8ef1a (Associated Press)]

Fighting occurs across [[Sudan]] three days after the [[paramilitary]] [[Rapid Support Forces]] (RSF) mobilized. The RSF claims to have captured [[Khartoum International Airport]] and the [[presidential palace]] in [[Khartoum]]. At least 56 civilians are killed and 595 others are injured, with several military personnel and rebel forces also being killed. Several [[Egyptian Army|Egyptian troops]] are also taken prisoner by the RSF. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-65284945 (BBC News)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/15/heavy-gunfire-heard-south-of-sudanese-capital-khartoum (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/16/egyptian-soldiers-captured-in-sudan-to-be-returned-says-rsf (Al Jazeera 2)]

[[Chad]] closes [[Chad–Sudan border|its border]] with Sudan as heavy fighting continues between the [[Sudanese Armed Forces|Sudanese military]] and rebel forces. [https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/chad-closes-borders-with-sudan-amid-armed-clashes/2873302 (Anadolu Agency)]

[[Saudi Arabia]], [[Egypt]], the [[United Arab Emirates]], [[Libya]] and [[Qatar]] suspend all planes from inside and outside of Sudan due to the ongoing conflicts and closure of several airports; airlines also fear attacks on their planes mainly in Khartoum. [https://menafn.com/1106019647/Sudan-Unrest-Saudi-Plane-Hit-By-Gunfire-UAE-Airlines-Cancel-Flights (Menafn)] [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2023/04/15/EgyptAir-suspends-flights-to-and-from-Sudan-capital- (Al Arabiya)] [https://libyaobserver.ly/inbrief/berniq-airways-suspends-flights-sudan-over-ongoing-clashes (Libya Observer)]

Rebels of the [[West Papua National Liberation Army]] kill nine [[Indonesian military]] personnel as the group accuses [[Jakarta]] of refusing to hold [[negotiation]]s. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/rebels-indonesias-papua-say-they-killed-9-army-soldiers-2023-04-16/ (Reuters)]

[[Prime Minister of Japan]] [[Fumio Kishida]] is evacuated during a speech in [[Saikazaki]], [[Wakayama (city)|Wakayama]], [[Kansai region|Kansai]], [[Japan]], after an "[[explosion]]-like sound" is heard. A suspect, believed to have thrown a [[smoke bomb]], is arrested. [https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/14/asia/kishida-evacuated-japan-explosion-intl-hnk/index.html (CNN)]

At least seven people are killed and another is injured during a [[mass shooting]] in La Palma resort in [[Cortazar, Guanajuato|Cortazar]], [[Guanajuato]], [[Mexico]]. [https://english.news.cn/20230416/0ab1c21ab14a4ce19032ec56d9bc7da0/c.html (Xinhua)]

Former [[Parliament of India|Indian Parliament]] member [[Atique Ahmed]], and his brother Ashraf Ahmed, are [[assassination|assassinated]] on [[live television]] while giving an interview to reporters in [[Allahabad]], while in the custody of police, [[Uttar Pradesh]], [[India]]. In response to the murders, the Uttar Pradesh government bars gatherings of more than four people across the entire state. His son had already been killed in an encounter a month earlier. The government shuts down the Internet access in the [[Allahabad district]]. [https://edition.cnn.com/2023/04/16/india/former-indian-lawmaker-killed-intl/index.html (CNN)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/india/former-indian-lawmaker-slain-live-tv-while-police-custody-state-restricts-2023-04-16/ (Reuters)] [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-65290042 (BBC News)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/16/ex-mp-atiq-ahmed-brother-shot-dead-on-live-tv-in-india (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.hindustantimes.com/cities/lucknow-news/atiq-ahmad-s-son-asad-wanted-in-umesh-pal-case-killed-in-encounter-101681371436932.html (''Hindustan Times'')] [https://indianexpress.com/article/india/gangster-turned-politician-atiq-ahmeds-son-asad-killed-in-encounter-in-jhansi-8554227/ (''The Indian Express'')] [https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/india/up-police-intensifies-security-in-prayagraj-internet-services-shut-sec-144-imposed/articleshow/99530848.cms (''The Economic Times'')]

The [[Sudanese Armed Forces|Sudanese military]] is said to have retaken control of the [[presidential palace]] and other key [[government of Sudan|government]] installations in [[Khartoum]]. The military says [[Khartoum International Airport]] remains under the control of [[Rapid Support Forces]], but that it was holding back from launching [[airstrike]]s to avoid destroying the airport. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/sudan-military-rivals-fight-power-killing-least-25-2023-04-16/ (Reuters)]

Thirty-six people are killed when [[Islamic State]] gunmen [[ambush]] a group of [[truffle]] hunters in [[Hama Governorate]]. Five shepherds are also killed near [[Deir ez-Zor]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230416-is-attack-on-syria-truffle-hunters-kills-at-least-26-monitor (France 24)]

Thirty-four [[Volunteers for the Defense of the Homeland|VDP]] and six [[Burkina Faso Armed Forces|soldiers]] are killed during an ambush in the village of Aorema, [[Ouahigouya Department|Ouahigouya]], [[Nord Region (Burkina Faso)|Nord]], [[Burkina Faso]]. Thirty-three other people are injured. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/16/dozens-of-defence-forces-killed-in-burkina-faso-attack-governor (Al Jazeera)]

At least 33 people are killed when armed bandits storm a village in Runji, [[Kaduna State|Kaduna]]. [https://apnews.com/article/nigeria-gunmen-attack-northwest-village-611062a02620f69120939280cfacd052 (AP)]

Ukraine and Russia conduct a prisoner swap for soldiers who [[Battle of Bakhmut|fought in Bakhmut]], with 130 Ukrainian soldiers returning and an unknown amount of Russian soldiers returning. [https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/130-ukrainian-pows-freed-in-easter-prisoner-exchange-with-russia (PBS)]

[[European Union]] [[List of ambassadors of the European Union|ambassador]] [[Aidan O'Hara]] is assaulted at his home in [[Khartoum]]. EU Foreign Affairs High Representative [[Josep Borrell]] calls the assault a "gross violation of the [[Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations|Vienna Convention]]". [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-65306695 (BBC News)]

[[Sudan]] closes its airspace, cancelling all flights in and out of the country. [[Kenya]] likewise suspends all flights to and from Sudan. [https://www.flightglobal.com/air-transport/sudanese-airspace-closed-as-armed-conflict-erupts/152865.article (Flight Global)] [https://www.kenyans.co.ke/news/88216-kenya-airways-adjusts-flight-schedules-over-khartoum-fighting (Kenyans.co.ke)]

[[China]], [[Malaysia]], and the [[United States]] urge their citizens in Sudan to hide, find shelter, or evacuate the country.  [https://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3217317/chinese-embassy-sudan-issues-high-alert-notice-tells-citizens-stay-indoors-away-windows (SCMP)] [https://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/nation/2023/04/17/foreign-ministry-looks-for-ways-to-get-malaysians-out-of-sudan/ (FMT)] [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/sudan-military-factions-at-war-civilians-cower-death-toll-tops-100/ (CBS News)]

''De facto'' leader [[Abdel Fattah al-Burhan]] declares the [[Rapid Support Forces]] to be a rebel group, and orders the group dissolved. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/17/sudan-army-declares-rsf-a-rebel-group-orders-dissolution (Al Jazeera)]

[[Slovakia]] transfers 13 [[Mikoyan MiG-29|MiG-29 fighter jets]] to [[Ukraine]], according to the [[Ministry of Defence (Slovakia)|Slovak Defence Ministry]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/slovakia-hands-over-all-13-promised-mig-fighter-jets-ukraine-2023-04-17/ (Reuters)]

A [[United States|U.S.]] embassy convoy is attacked in [[Khartoum]], amid U.S. efforts to mediate a [[ceasefire]]. [https://apnews.com/article/sudan-fighting-military-us-convoy-attacked-60b1568b3bd05cdf6ad78c7f17cc8208 (AP)]

[[India]] tells its citizens to find shelter or stay indoors. [https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/international/2421325-indian-embassy-in-sudan-issues-precautionary-advisory-for-indian-nationals-against-venturing-out-suggest-rationing-supplies (Dev Discourse)]
[[Canada]] closes its embassy in [[Sudan]] and advises its citizens against travelling to the country. [https://globalnews.ca/news/9630315/sudan-violence-unrest-canada/ (Global News)]

Russian president [[Vladimir Putin]] makes a rare visit to [[Russia]]n-occupied [[Kherson Oblast|Kherson]] and [[Luhansk Oblast|Luhansk]] oblasts and meets with [[Russian Armed Forces|military]] commanders in charge of military operations. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/putin-visits-two-regions-ukraine-g7-condemn-nuclear-plan-2023-04-18/ (Reuters)]
Former People's Deputy of Ukraine [[Oleh Barna]] is killed in combat. [https://www.unian.net/war/na-fronte-pogib-eks-nardep-oleg-barna-12224391.html (UNIAN)]

Six [[Fula people|Fulani]] [[herder]]s are killed by Kodo armed men during an attack on two villages in [[Logone Oriental (region)|Logone Oriental]], [[Chad]]. Fourteen attackers are killed by soldiers in the ensuing gunfight, while two others are killed in the initial clashes with the Fulanis. [https://www.barrons.com/news/chad-clashes-between-herders-farmers-kill-22-45feb927 (''Barron's'')]

[[Germany]] announces the suspension of its attempt to rescue 150 German citizens from [[Khartoum]]. [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/19/world/africa/japan-evacuations-sudan.html (''The New York Times'')] [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/germany-forced-halt-evacuation-mission-sudan-spiegel-2023-04-19/ (Reuters)]

Thousands of Sudanese [[civilian]]s cross the closed [[Chad–Sudan border|border]] with [[Chad]] as [[refugee]]s and are [[immigration detention|detained]], according to Chadian Defence Minister Daoud Yaya Brahim. Brahim also states that the [[Chad National Army]] detained and disarmed a contingent of 320 [[Sudanese troops]] who crossed the border. [https://www.trtworld.com/africa/hundreds-of-sudanese-troops-flee-to-chad-as-fighting-rages-67223 (TRT World)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/chad-disarmed-sudanese-contingent-which-entered-its-territory-monday-defence-2023-04-19/ (Reuters)]

The [[United Kingdom]], [[Germany]], and [[Japan]] urge their citizens to seek shelter, hide, or [[emergency evacuation|evacuate]] due to ongoing fighting. [https://news.sky.com/story/sudan-ceasefire-in-tatters-as-fighting-continues-around-khartoum-12861042 (Sky News)] [https://theprint.in/world/germany-forced-to-halt-evacuation-mission-from-sudan-spiegel/1527675/ (The Print India)]

Japanese Chief Cabinet Secretary [[Hirokazu Matsuno]] says that Japan will send a [[Japanese Self-Defense Forces|Self-Defense Forces]] aircraft to evacuate 60 Japanese nationals from [[Sudan]]. [https://www.asahi.com/sp/ajw/articles/14889095 (''Asahi Shimbun'')]

Satellite imagery reveals that at least one [[Egyptian Air Force]] [[Mikoyan MiG-29|MiG-29]] was destroyed at an [[airbase]] in [[Merowe, Sudan|Merowe]], with at least two others heavily damaged. [https://www.thedrive.com/the-war-zone/egyptian-mig-29s-destroyed-in-sudan (The Drive)]

Four people are killed and several others are reported missing after [[jihadism|jihadists]] [[ambush]] a [[Politics of Mali|Malian government]] [[delegation]] near [[Nara, Mali|Nara]], [[Koulikoro Region]], [[Mali]]. [https://www.barrons.com/news/four-dead-in-attack-on-mali-govt-convoy-officials-4c28b4f4 (''Barron's'')]
Amid fighting, a [[Food security|food shortage]] is reported in [[Khartoum]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-65335112 (BBC News)]
An [[American citizen]] is killed in Khartoum, becoming the second confirmed foreign death. [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/sudan-american-dead-us-troops-embassy-evacuation-khartoum/ (CBS News)]

The [[United States]] sends additional troops and equipment to [[Camp Lemonnier]] in [[Djibouti]] in preparation for a possible [[emergency evacuation|evacuation]] of Americans from [[Sudan]]. [https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/us-forces-djibouti-prep-sudan-evacuation/story?id=98730208 (ABC News)]

Russian authorities report an [[explosion]] in [[Belgorod]] near the border with [[Ukraine]], saying that it left a {{conv|20|m|adj=on}} crater in the city center. It resulted from an accidental discharge of [[ammunition]] from a Russian airplane. [https://www.barrons.com/news/russia-reports-explosion-in-belgorod-near-ukraine-border-59704c32 (''Barron's'' via AFP)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/large-blast-reported-russian-city-close-border-with-ukraine-2023-04-20/ (Reuters)]

Five [[Indian soldier]]s are killed in a suspected militant attack in [[Rajouri district]], [[Jammu and Kashmir (union territory)|Jammu and Kashmir]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/21/five-indian-soldiers-killed-in-suspected-rebel-attack-in-kashmir (Al Jazeera)]

An [[Iranian Navy]] commander claims on state television that the Iranian Navy forced a U.S. submarine to surface as it transited the [[Strait of Hormuz]] and that the submarine violated Iranian territorial waters. The U.S. denies the Iranian claims. [https://www.rferl.org/a/iran-us-submarine-surface-gulf/32372099.html (Radiofarda)]

[[Indonesia]] [[emergency evacuation|evacuates]] 43 of its citizens to its embassy in [[Khartoum]] after an [[Indonesians|Indonesian]] citizen is injured by a bullet. [https://jakartaglobe.id/news/sudan-clash-43-indonesians-evacuated-to-khartoum-embassy (Jakarta Globe)]

The [[Belgium|Belgian]] head of the EU humanitarian mission to [[Sudan]], Wim Fransen, is shot in Khartoum. [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2023/04/19/sudan-civil-war-2023-eu-diplomat-shot-germany-evacuation/ (''The Telegraph'')]

Many countries, including [[South Korea]], [[Spain]], [[Sweden]], and [[Switzerland]], announce plans to evacuate all of their citizens or nationals from Sudan. [https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/21/africa/sudan-fighting-ceasefire-eid-friday-intl-hnk/index.html (CNN)]

[[Latvia]]n Defence Minister [[Ināra Mūrniece]] announces that Latvia will send all of its [[FIM-92 Stinger]] missile systems to [[Ukraine]], following a meeting with [[NATO]] allies at [[Ramstein Air Base]] in [[Germany]]. [https://news.yahoo.com/minister-latvia-send-ukraine-stinger-194511317.html (Yahoo! News)]
Seven people are killed after an attack in [[Imo State]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/gunmen-kill-five-nigerian-police-officers-southeast-2023-04-21/ (Reuters)]

At least nine [[civilian]]s are killed and 60 others are injured in a triple [[suicide bombing]] outside the airport in [[Sévaré]], [[Mopti Region]], [[Mali]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/least-nine-killed-triple-suicide-bombing-central-mali-official-2023-04-22/ (Reuters)]

A [[Malian Air Force]] [[attack helicopter]] crashes into a residential area of [[Bamako]] while returning from operations against [[jihadism|jihadists]] near the [[Mali–Mauritania border|Mauritanian border]]. Three people on board are killed and six on ground injured. [https://menafn.com/1106072162/Army-Helicopter-Crashes-In-Malian-Capital (MENA FN)] [https://www.aa.com.tr/fr/afrique/mali-le-crash-d-un-h%C3%A9licopt%C3%A8re-militaire-fait-trois-morts-et-six-bless%C3%A9s/2879083 (AA France)]

[[France]] and [[Saudi Arabia]] announce that they will [[Emergency evacuation|evacuate]] their citizens from [[Sudan]], joining the [[United States]] and the [[United Kingdom]] in doing so. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/04/22/sudan-evacuations-us-britain-france-saudi/ (''The Washington Post'')] [https://gulfnews.com/world/mena/saudi-arabia-arranging-to-evacuate-its-citizens-and-brotherly-country-nationals-from-sudan-1.95287242 (Gulf News)]

The [[Department of Foreign Affairs (Philippines)|Department of Foreign Affairs]] of the [[Philippines]] announces the suspension of all flights to [[Sudan]] to ensure the safety of its citizens and raises alerts to level 3 after a Filipino is hit by a stray bullet in [[Khartoum]]. [https://rpnradio.com/dfa-to-ofws-in-sudan-evacuate-voluntarily/ (RPN Radio)] [https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/04/22/23/marcos-says-govt-seeking-secure-route-to-evacuate-pinoys-in-sudan (ABS-CBN)] [https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/pinoyabroad/dispatch/867524/over-80-pinoys-in-sudan-have-requested-evacuation-repatriation-dfa-exec/story/ (GMA Network)]

[[Syria]] suspends all of its flights to Sudan, following the deaths of 11 [[Syrians]] in the country. [https://npasyria.com/en/96715/ (NPA Syria)] [https://www.newarab.com/news/sudan-11-syrians-killed-violence-60-lebanese-evacuated (New Arab)]

Many countries, including the [[United Kingdom]], [[Germany]], [[Spain]], and [[Canada]], [[emergency evacuation|evacuate]] their nationals and some [[civilian]]s from Khartoum, or announce plans to do so. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-65363586 (BBC News)]

Canada and the [[United States]] suspend all diplomatic operations in Sudan due to the ongoing conflict. [https://www.barrons.com/news/canada-suspends-diplomatic-operations-in-sudan-449c63d1 (''Barron's'')] [https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2023/apr/23/us-suspends-diplomatic-operations-evacuates-embass/ (''Washington Times'')]

Sudan reports a large [[internet]] outage across the entire country during the night. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/4/23/sudan-fighting-internet-outage-reported-across-the-country (Al Jazeera)]

Thousands of Sudanese [[refugee]]s are reported to have entered [[South Sudan]] and [[Egypt]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/un-agency-chad-expects-more-refugees-fleeing-sudan-2023-04-22/ (Reuters)] [https://www.dw.com/en/worries-mount-among-sudans-neighbors-as-clashes-continue/a-65407641 (DW)]

According to the [[Institute for the Study of War]] and various [[Russian military]] bloggers, the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian military]] have taken up positions on the east bank of the [[Dnieper]] river north of the town of [[Oleshky]]. [https://novayagazeta.eu/articles/2023/04/23/isw-ukrainian-troops-take-up-positions-on-eastern-bank-of-dnipro-in-kherson-region-north-of-oleshky-en-news (''Novaya Gazeta Europe'')]

[[Armenia]] says that an [[Azerbaijan]]i [[sniper]] killed an [[Military of Armenia|Armenian soldier]]. The [[government of Azerbaijan]] denies the claim, stating that its own soldiers came under fire in [[Nagorno-Karabakh]]. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/04/23/Armenia-says-soldier-killed-by-Azerbaijan-sniper-Baku-denies (AP via Al Arabiya)]

Azerbaijan sets up a [[border checkpoint|checkpoint]] at the [[Lachin corridor]] connecting Armenia and Nagorno-Karabakh in violation of the [[2020 Nagorno-Karabakh ceasefire agreement|2020 ceasefire agreement]] which guarantees free and safe passage to the region. [https://www.dw.com/en/azerbaijan-sets-up-checkpoint-on-vital-road-to-armenia/a-65411806 (DW)]
[[Switzerland]] suspends all diplomatic operations at its [[embassy]] in [[Khartoum]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/switzerland-shuts-embassy-sudan-security-reasons-2023-04-24/ (Reuters)]

[[Brazil]], [[South Africa]], [[Niger]] and [[Mexico]] [[emergency evacuation|evacuate]] more than 100 citizens from [[Sudan]]. [https://www.rm.co.mz/africa-do-sul-evacua-seus-cidadaos-do-sudao/ (Radio Mozambique)] [https://noticias.uol.com.br/ultimas-noticias/ansa/2023/04/24/brasil-evacua-cerca-de-20-cidadaos-do-sudao.htm (Universo Online)] [https://elpais.com/mexico/2023-04-24/la-cancilleria-evacua-a-11-mexicanos-de-sudan-debido-al-conflicto-armado.html (El País)] [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/countries-evacuating-citizens-sudan-98799524 (ABC News)]

[[Russian forces]] in [[Crimea]] repel a [[drone attack]] on [[Sevastopol]], according to governor [[Mikhail Razvozhaev]], in the first attack on the [[peninsula]] since February. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/apr/24/russia-ukraine-war-live-drone-attack-on-crimea-repelled-russia-says-moscow-threatens-to-scrap-grain-deal (''The Guardian'')]

The [[United Kingdom]] begins a large-scale [[emergency evacuation|evacuation]] of [[British citizens]] from [[Sudan]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/apr/25/sudan-live-uk-government-coordinating-evacuation-of-british-nationals (''The Guardian'')]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[S-300 missile system|S-300-type missile]] strike in [[Kupiansk]], [[Kharkiv Oblast]], kills at least one [[civilian]] and injures 10 others. [https://www.rferl.org/a/ukraine-invasion-bakhmut-assaults-russia/32378224.html (RFE/RL)]

[[Russia]] uses its [[T-14 Armata]] [[main battle tank]]s in combat against [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] for the first time. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russias-new-t-14-armata-battle-tank-debuts-ukraine-ria-2023-04-25/ (Reuters)]

[[Paramount leader|Chinese leader]] [[Xi Jinping]] calls [[President of Ukraine|Ukrainian President]] [[Volodymyr Zelenskyy]], with both countries announcing the dispatch of representatives to establish a diplomatic presence after the call. [https://www.npr.org/2023/04/26/1164668179/xi-putin-summit-zelenskyy-china-russia-ukraine (NPR)]

Ten policemen and a [[civilian]] driver are killed when a bomb planted by suspected [[Communist Party of India (Maoist)|Maoist militants]] [[explode]]s in [[Dantewada district]], [[Chhattisgarh]], [[India]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/india/ten-policemen-driver-killed-central-india-blast-maoists-suspected-police-2023-04-26/ (Reuters)]

[[Iran]]ian [[ayatollah]] and [[Assembly of Experts]] member [[Abbas-Ali Soleimani]] is [[assassination|assassinated]] in a shooting at a bank in [[Babolsar]], [[Mazandaran province]]. The perpetrator, a security guard at the bank, has been arrested by police. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-65398982 (BBC News)]

Six Iranian demonstrators are injured in clashes in [[Fanuj]], [[Sistan and Baluchistan province]], after a teenager was killed when his motorcycle collided with a police car. [https://www.rferl.org/amp/iran-clashes-teen-dies-police/32380786.html (RFE/RL)]

One person is killed and 23 others are injured by a [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[Kalibr (missile family)|Kalibr missile]] strike in [[Mykolaiv]]. [https://www.euronews.com/2023/04/27/ukraine-war-one-dead-and-over-20-injured-in-russian-missile-attack-on-mykolaiv (Euronews)]

[[Girma Yeshitilla]], the leader of the [[Amhara Region|Amhara]] [[Prosperity Party]], the ruling party in [[Ethiopia]], is shot dead by unknown gunmen in [[North Shewa Zone (Amhara)|North Shewa]], [[Amhara Region]]. [https://borkena.com/2023/04/27/girma-yeshitila-top-ethiopias-ruling-party-official-assassinated/ (Borkena)]

An attack on a [[Burkina Faso Armed Forces|Burkinabé]] [[military base]] in [[Burkina Faso]]'s [[Est Region (Burkina Faso)|Est region]] by [[jihadist]]s kills 33 Burkinabé soldiers. During the attack, the soldiers say they killed 40 of the jihadists before government reinforcements arrived. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/28/attack-on-burkina-faso-military-post-kills-at-least-33-soldiers (Al Jazeera)]

Three people are killed by a [[suicide bomber]] in [[Lakki Marwat]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/pakistan-militant-attack-kills-three-troops-officials-say-2023-04-28/ (Reuters)]

The [[Islamic Republic of Iran Navy|Iranian Navy]] seizes a [[Marshall Islands]]-flagged [[oil tanker]] in [[international waters]] of the [[Gulf of Oman]], according to the [[United States Navy]]. [https://apnews.com/article/iran-us-navy-oil-tanker-advantage-057155f4d9caf92131533fe90f94a3a0 (AP)]

One person is injured after multiple bombings in [[Weare, New Hampshire|Weare]], [[New Hampshire]], [[United States]]. The perpetrator is still at large. [https://www.nbcboston.com/news/local/police-investigation-shuts-roads-in-weare-nh/3031813/ (WBTS-TV)]

At least 25 [[civilian]]s [[Attacks on civilians in the Russian invasion of Ukraine|are killed]] and many others are injured in a new wave of [[Russia]]n [[cruise missile]] strikes across [[Ukraine]]. The capital [[Kyiv]] is hit for the first time in 51 days. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-65421341 (BBC News)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/explosions-kyiv-air-raid-sirens-across-ukraine-2023-04-28/ (Reuters)]

[[Warplane]]s bomb [[Khartoum]] and heavy [[anti-aircraft artillery]] is heard in the city as the conflict enters its third week, with the [[United Nations]] warning that [[Sudan]] is "collapsing". [https://mb.com.ph/2023/4/29/sudan-fighting-enters-third-week-as-un-says-country-collapsing (AFP via ''Manila Bulletin'')]

A [[Turkey|Turkish]] [[emergency evacuation|evacuation]] plane is fired at in Khartoum, allegedly by the [[Rapid Support Forces]]. No injuries or deaths have been confirmed. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-65423962 (BBC News)]

The former [[Prime Minister of Sudan]], [[Abdalla Hamdok]], calls the conflict in his country a "nightmare", stating that it could become worse than those in [[Syrian civil war|Syria]] and [[Second Libyan Civil War|Libya]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-65436815 (BBC News)]

The [[Israeli Air Force]] launches [[airstrike]]s against targets near the [[Syria]]n city of [[Homs]] in a pre-dawn raid. [[Syrian Arab News Agency|Syrian state media]] reports that three [[civilian]]s were injured in the attacks. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/israeli-airstrikes-hit-targets-near-homs-syrian-state-media-says/ (Times of Israel)]

A huge fire engulfs a [[fuel depot]] in the port of [[Sevastopol]], in [[Russian occupation of Crimea|Russian-occupied]] [[Crimea]], in what governor [[Mikhail Razvozhaev]] says was a [[drone attack]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/4/29/russian-official-says-crimean-fuel-tank-blaze-likely-drone-attack (Al Jazeera)]

[[Laos|Laotian]] [[human rights defender|human rights activist]] [[Anousa Luangsuphom]] is shot at a [[coffeehouse]] in the capital [[Vientiane]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-65465770 (BBC News)]

[[Iran]] evacuates 65 nationals from [[Sudan]] with [[Saudi Arabia]]n assistance. [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2294886/middle-east (Arab News)] [https://www.tasnimnews.com/en/news/2023/04/29/2886558/dozens-of-iranians-evacuated-from-sudan (Tasnim News)]

[[President of Turkey|Turkish President]] [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] announces that the [[National Intelligence Organization|Turkish National Intelligence Organization]] has tracked down and killed the Caliph of the [[Islamic State]] [[Abu al-Hussein al-Husseini al-Qurashi]] in [[Syria]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/5/1/erdogan-says-turkey-has-killed-suspected-isil-leader (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russia]] launches [[cruise missile]] and [[drone warfare|drone strikes]] across [[Ukraine]]. Among the targets hit is an [[industrial park|industrial zone]] in [[Pavlohrad]], [[Dnipropetrovsk Oblast]], where a large [[explosion]] damaged or destroyed 19 apartment buildings and 25 homes, with 34 people reportedly injured. [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] say that they shot down 15 of 18 missiles launched by Russia. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/may/01/ukraine-ammunition-depot-reportedly-hit-in-wave-of-russian-missile-attacks (''The Guardian'')]

Ukrainian [[colonel general]] [[Oleksandr Syrskyi]] says that [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] have recaptured parts of central [[Bakhmut]], but that the situation on the ground "remains difficult". [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukrainian-defenders-oust-russian-forces-some-positions-bakhmut-ukraine-general-2023-05-01/ (Reuters)]

Fifteen people are killed after unidentified gunmen open fire at a farm in [[Kérou]], [[Benin]]. [https://apnews.com/article/benin-killings-farm-attack-6a977fbb32955de6b0f7ca4126c6ef29 (Associated Press)]

A 17-year-old [[Palestinian]] boy is killed during an [[Israel]]i raid near [[Jericho]] in the [[West Bank]]. [https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-teen-killed-west-bank-a434b00ac19b049747cd3ccee72ee379 (Associated Press)]

A bomb is [[detonate]]d on the road between [[Sofia]] and [[Samokov]], [[Bulgaria]]. The target is believed to be the Chief Public Prosecutor of Bulgaria [[Ivan Geshev]], whose motorcade was travelling on the road at the time. No injuries are reported. The explosion has been designated as a [[terrorist]] incident by officials. [https://www.politico.eu/article/bulgaria-prosecutor-escapes-bombing-attempt-officials-say/ (''Politico Europe'')]

[[Rapid Support Forces]] re-capture [[Geneina]], the capital of [[West Darfur]], after a week of fighting with more than 200 people killed. [https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/sudan-darfur-bloodshed-hemeti-allies-enemies-control  (Middle East Eye)] [https://www.dabangasudan.org/en/all-news/article/nearly-200-confirmed-dead-in-west-darfur-violence-situation-extremely-dangerous (Dabanga Sudan)]

The number of Sudanese refugees due to the ongoing civil conflict surpasses 100,000 after only a few days. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/over-100000-refugees-crossed-sudan-neighbouring-countries-un-2023-05-02/ (Reuters)]

Somali forces kill 67 [[al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] militants and seize many weapons in a continuation of offensives against the group in the [[Mudug]] region. [https://www.voanews.com/a/somali-army-kills-67-al-shabab-militants-seizes-explosives-/7075508.html (VOA)]

A [[Uganda People's Defence Force]] soldier [[assassination|assassinates]] retired [[colonel]] and [[Cabinet of Uganda|cabinet member]] [[Charles Engola]] at his home in [[Kampala]], while acting as his bodyguard. The soldier later commits suicide. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-65454213 (BBC News)]

[[Russia]] accuses [[Ukraine]] of attempting to assassinate [[President of Russia|President]] [[Vladimir Putin]] after two drones were shot down near the [[Kremlin]]. A spokesman claimed that Putin was not inside the Kremlin at the time of the attack. A video shows at least one drone hitting the compound. Ukraine denies any involvement in the attack. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-65471904 (BBC News)]

Russia's [[Federal Security Service]] says that it has arrested seven [[Foreign Intelligence Service of Ukraine|Ukrainian agents]] who were allegedly planning a "series of high-profile sabotage and terrorist acts" in [[Crimea]], including an attack on the [[Head of the Republic of Crimea]] [[Sergey Aksyonov]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russias-fsb-says-7-ukrainian-agents-arrested-crimea-2023-05-03/ (Reuters)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] shell [[Kherson Oblast]], killing 16 [[civilian]]s and injuring 22 others. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/three-civilians-killed-russian-attack-ukrainian-hypermarket-officials-2023-05-03/ (Reuters)]

[[Australia]]'s [[Royal Australian Air Force]] evacuates 36 Australians from [[Sudan]], reportedly overnight. [https://www.smh.com.au/national/australians-still-trapped-in-worsening-sudan-crisis-20230429-p5d48e.html (''Sydney Morning Herald'')] [https://www.abc.net.au/news/2023-05-03/australian-rescue-mission-flight-out-of-sudan/102295460 (ABC News Australia)]

The [[South Sudan]]ese foreign ministry announces that a seven-day [[ceasefire]] has been agreed to in Sudan, lasting from May 4 to 11. [https://www.firstpost.com/world/sudans-waring-parties-agree-to-seven-day-truce-starting-4-may-12538932.html (Firstpost)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/sudan-conflict-drives-100000-over-border-amid-crumbling-ceasefires-2023-05-02/ (Reuters)]

The [[Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps]] seize the [[Panama]]-flagged [[oil tanker]] ''Niovi'' in the [[Strait of Hormuz]]. [https://www.tasnimnews.com/en/news/2023/05/03/2889051/irgc-seizes-foreign-tanker-for-law-breaking (Tasnim News Agency)]

Seven [[teacher]]s are killed in a [[mass shooting]] at a [[high school]] in [[Parachinar]], [[Kurram District]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. Another teacher from the same school was killed on the road in a separate attack earlier in the day. [https://english.news.cn/20230504/ff7903f784214b9aa306b6e98dcd3e3f/c.html (Xinhua)]
Six soldiers and three [[Pakistani Taliban]] members are killed during a gunfight in Dir Duni, [[North Waziristan District]]. [https://www.dawn.com/news/1750866 (''Dawn'')]

Israeli security units kill three wanted [[Palestinian]] men in [[Nablus]], [[West Bank]], [[murderer]]s of a mother and her two daughters in April in [[Efrat (Israeli settlement)|Efrat]]. [https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-raid-attack-west-bank-51038d770650ae283716c7664b199d6a (AP)]

[[Wagner Group]] leader [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]] announces that, due to a lack of ammunition, his fighters will leave [[Bakhmut]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], on May 10 and hand over their positions to units of the [[Russian Defense Ministry]]. [https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/ukraine-war-bakhmut-prigozhin-1.6833207 (CBC News)]

Five [[Indian Army|Indian soldiers]] are killed by [[People's Anti-Fascist Front]] militants during an encounter in [[Rajouri]], [[Jammu and Kashmir (union territory)|Jammu and Kashmir]]. [https://m.economictimes.com/news/india/at-least-two-army-personnel-killed-four-injured-in-terrorist-attack-in-j-ks-rajouri/articleshow/100007723.cms (The Economic Times)]

[[Russian nationalism|Russian nationalist]] writer [[Zakhar Prilepin]] is injured and his driver is killed when their vehicle is hit by a [[car bomb]] in [[Nizhny Novgorod Oblast]], [[Russia]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-65509809 (BBC News)]

At least 30 people are killed in ethnic clashes in [[Manipur]], [[India]], after a rally by [[Meitei people|indigenous communities]] against moves to grant tribal status to the main ethnic group in the state. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-65513157 (BBC News)]

Two [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] men, members of the Tul Karm Battalion, are killed during a raid by the [[Israeli Defense Forces]] in [[Tulkarm]] in the [[West Bank]]. [https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-05-06/ty-article/.premium/two-palestinians-killed-by-idf-in-west-bank-palestinian-health-ministry-says/00000187-ef96-d8a1-a1cf-efbf59ee0000 (''Haaretz'')]

Two [[People's Anti-Fascist Front]] militants are killed and another is injured during two raids by [[Indian Army|Indian soldiers]] in [[Rajouri]], [[Jammu and Kashmir (union territory)|Jammu and Kashmir]], after five soldiers were killed yesterday. [https://apnews.com/article/kashmir-india-pakistan-rebels-soldiers-6b853e02135c3a48da92c4bb4ff03b97 (AP)]

[[Eritrea]] is accused of the forced [[deportation]] and [[repatriation]] of 3,500 [[Eritreans]] from [[Sudan]] to [[Teseney]] and other towns near the Sudanese–Eritrean border. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/may/07/eritrea-accused-of-forcibly-repatriating-civilians-caught-up-in-sudan-fighting (''The Guardian'')]

The death toll from the ethnic clashes in [[Manipur]], [[India]], between [[Meitei people|Metei]] [[Hinduism|Hindus]] and [[Kuki people|Kuki]] [[Christianity|Christians]], increases to 60. At least 230 others are injured. [https://www.msn.com/en-in/news/other/manipur-violence-death-toll-rises-to-60-1700-houses-burnt-cm-n-biren-singh-appeals-to-bring-peace-to-the-state/ar-AA1aU8uH (Times Now)]

Twenty-five people are killed during clashes between the [[Hausa people|Hausa]] and [[Nuba peoples|Nuba]] tribes in [[Kosti, Sudan|Kosti]], [[Sudan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/sudan-tribal-fighting-conflict-generals-truce-2e3d73be7944d90907182d0b29b61a54 (AP)]

The head of the [[Prosperity Party]] in Haruka Woreda, in [[Ethiopia]]'s [[Afar Region]], is shot and killed alongside his brother by unknown gunmen while returning from the city of [[Adama]], [[Oromia]]. It is the third [[assassination]] targeting the party's members in the past month. [https://addisstandard.com/news-prosperity-party-organizational-department-head-of-haruka-woreda-afar-region-shot-dead-en-route-from-adama/ (''Addis Standard'')]

The [[Israeli Air Force]] begins "Operation Shield and Arrow", launching multiple [[airstrike]]s in the [[Gaza Strip]] and killing three senior [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad Movement]] leaders and at least ten [[civilian]]s, including four children. [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-742463 (''The Jerusalem Post'')] [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-jets-strike-islamic-jihad-targets-gaza-military-2023-05-08/ (Reuters)]

Two [[Palestinians]] are killed in an Israeli air attack on a car in [[Khan Yunis]] in the Gaza Strip. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/5/9/palestinians-killed-israeli-air-attack-gaza-car (Al Jazeera)]

[[France|French]] journalist [[Arman Soldin]] is killed by a [[Russia]]n rocket strike in [[Chasiv Yar]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], while working for [[Agence France-Presse]]. [https://www.lemonde.fr/en/international/article/2023/05/09/afp-journalist-killed-by-rocket-fire-in-eastern-ukraine_6026058_4.html (''Le Monde'')]

Five people are killed and nine more injured during a [[mass shooting]] at the [[El Ghriba Synagogue]] in [[Djerba]], [[Tunisia]]. The perpetrator is shot dead. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/5/10/four-dead-after-attack-near-synagogue-on-tunisias-djerba-island (Al Jazeera)]

[[Israel]] launches an [[airstrike]] in the [[Gaza Strip]], killing seven people, including four members of the [[Marxist–Leninism|Marxist–Leninist]] [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine|PFLP]]. In another raid, two [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad Movement]] [[militant]]s are killed by [[Israeli security forces]] in [[Qabatiya]], in the [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/5/10/israeli-palestinian-fighting-ongoing-as-egypt-ceasefire-falters (Al Jazeera)]

[[Palestinians|Palestinian]] militants fire more than 260 rockets into Israel from [[Gaza Strip|Gaza]] in response to yesterday's airstrikes. Most of the rockets are intercepted by the [[Iron Dome]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-65544214 (BBC News)]

One person is killed and four others are injured when a [[car bomb]] [[explode]]s outside a [[police station]] in [[Barzeh, Syria|Barzeh]], [[Damascus]], [[Syria]]. [https://apnews.com/article/syria-damascus-car-explosion-c240dbb5be3ea1477d8fd207653479ca (AP)]

One person is killed and 30 others injured during protests against repression across [[Senegal]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/5/10/senegal-opposition-leader-calls-for-mass-protest-after-court-ruling (Al Jazeera)]

An [[Israel]]i [[airstrike]] in the [[Gaza Strip]] kills two commanders of [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]]. Additionally, the total death toll from the Israeli airstrikes in Gaza over the past two days increases to 26. A rocket is also launched from Gaza to [[Rehovot]], killing one person and injuring five others. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/5/11/israel-palestine-live-news-gaza-rocket-unit-commander-killed (Al Jazeera)]

[[Wagner Group]] leader [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]] confirms that [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian troops]] have recaptured parts of [[Bakhmut]] in [[Donetsk Oblast]] from his forces. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-says-it-routs-russia-brigade-kremlin-admits-campaign-very-difficult-2023-05-10/ (Reuters)]

The [[United Kingdom]]'s [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|Defence Ministry]] confirms that it has supplied [[Ukraine]] with [[Storm Shadow]] [[cruise missile]]s. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-65558070 (BBC News)]

Thirty-three people are killed and three more injured after gunmen open fire against vegetable farmers in [[Boucle du Mouhoun Region]]. [https://www.voanews.com/a/civilians-killed-in-burkina-faso-attack-governor-says-/7092472.html (VOA)]

[[Israel]] launches an [[airstrike]] against a [[multi-story building]] in [[Gaza City]], killing two people, including a commander of [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]]. Rockets are also fired by [[Palestinian militant]] groups in the [[Gaza Strip]], striking the [[West Bank]] near [[Jerusalem]] for the first time. The death toll from [[Israel]]i [[airstrike]]s on Gaza increases to 31 as [[Egypt]] mediates for a [[ceasefire]] between the two sides. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-65571023 (BBC News)]

A report by the [[Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights]] concludes that the [[Malian Armed Forces]] and foreign fighters [[massacre]]d at least 500 people in the town of [[Moura, Mali|Moura]], [[Mopti Region]], in March 2022. At least 58 women and girls were also [[rape]]d by the military during the operation against [[Jihadism|jihadist]] groups. [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230512-%F0%9F%94%B4-mali-army-foreign-fighters-killed-at-least-500-people-in-march-2022-un-report (France 24)]

Six [[Pakistan Army|soldiers]] and a [[civilian]] are killed, and six others are wounded, when gunmen storm a security facility in [[Muslim Bagh]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. All six attackers are killed. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/5/13/pakistan-more-than-a-dozen-dead-in-balochistan-attack (Al Jazeera)]

[[Airstrike]]s on the [[Gaza Strip]] destroy two neighborhoods. Meanwhile, a [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] worker is killed and another is injured by [[rocket]] shrapnel in the [[Negev]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/5/13/palestinian-islamic-jihad-vows-more-attacks-on-israel-live-news (Al Jazeera)]

[[Palestinian Islamic Jihad]] spokesman Dawoud Shehab announces that the group accepted a ceasefire agreement mediated by [[Egypt]], while the [[Israel Defense Force|IDF]] says they will tentatively support it. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/5/13/islamic-jihad-says-agrees-gaza-truce-with-israel-officials (Al Jazeera)]

[[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] storm a [[refugee camp]] in [[Nablus]], [[West Bank]], killing two people and injuring three others. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/5/13/2-palestinians-killed-in-israel-raid-as-gaza-attacked-for-5th-day (Al Jazeera)]
[[Russia]] launches [[cruise missile]]s at the city of [[Ternopil]] in [[Western Ukraine]], injuring two civilians. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-65586701 (BBC News)]

Two [[Russian Air Force|Russian]] [[Mi-8]] helicopters and two fighter jets, an [[Su-34]] and an [[Su-35]], are reportedly shot down in [[Bryansk Oblast]]. [https://www.msn.com/en-sg/news/world/four-russian-military-aircraft-shot-down-near-ukraine-russian-daily-reports/ar-AA1b9u9O (Reuters via MSN)]

[[Ethiopia]] reports large numbers of [[Sudan|Sudanese]] refugees entering its territory, mainly in the city of [[Metemma]], where nearly 20,000 Sudanese are reported to have entered in a single day. [https://addisstandard.com/news-more-than-18-000-displaced-people-arrive-in-metema-feeling-violence-in-sudan-first-arrivals-cross-into-gambella/ (''Addis Standard'')]

The [[Ministry of Defence (Russia)|Russian Ministry of Defence]] announces the deaths of two of their commanders in [[Bakhmut]] and the village of Sontsivka west of [[Donetsk]]. [https://novayagazeta.eu/articles/2023/05/14/russias-defence-ministry-reports-deaths-of-two-commanders-en-news (''Novaya Gazeta Europe'')]

More than a dozen explosions are reported in [[Kyiv]] as [[Russia]] launches a [[missile]] barrage at the capital and other [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] cities. [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] say that they have shot down six [[Kh-47M2 Kinzhal]] [[Hypersonic weapon|hypersonic missiles]]. [https://www.ft.com/content/3a3ea049-699f-4f92-8b5e-d0aba9023dce (''Financial Times'')] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/air-defence-systems-repelling-attacks-ukraine-early-tuesday-officials-2023-05-16/ (Reuters)]

The [[Ministry of Defense (Russia)|Russian Ministry of Defense]] claims that it destroyed a [[MIM-104 Patriot|Patriot air defense system]] in Kyiv. However a [[United States]] official says that the system was likely damaged but not destroyed. [https://www.cnn.com/2023/05/16/politics/patriot-missile-damage-ukraine/index.html (CNN)]

At least 80 people are killed by armed attackers during a [[Spree killer|shooting spree]] on several villages in [[Plateau State]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://apnews.com/article/nigeria-violence-killings-shooting-plateau-herdsmen-fulani-043596ecac029a7b5603cb3a0513732b (AP)]

Nine people are arrested after an alleged [[Iran]]ian-backed [[coup d'état]] plot is uncovered in [[Azerbaijan]]. [https://www.barrons.com/news/azerbaijan-makes-arrests-over-fresh-coup-plot-blamed-on-iran-bde2f604 (''Barron's'')]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] [[Shell (projectile)|shell]] Ukrainian-held areas of [[Kherson Oblast]], killing at least five [[civillian]]s, including a child, while 17 others are reportedly injured. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-65630018 (BBC News)]
