Four people are killed and six others are injured in an armed [[ambush]] on a convoy near the village of Kivandya, [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/three-rangers-killed-east-congo-convoy-ambush-near-gorilla-park-2023-05-18/ (Reuters)]

[[Wagner Group]] leader [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]] says that they have captured all of [[Bakhmut]] in [[Donetsk Oblast]]. The [[Ministry of Defence (Ukraine)|Ukrainian Defence Ministry]] rejects this claim, saying that its forces still control a district on the westernmost edge of the city. [https://www.cnn.com/2023/05/20/europe/bakhmut-capture-wagner-ukraine-russia-intl/index.html (CNN)]

[[Pope Francis]] appoints Italian [[Cardinal (Catholic Church)|Cardinal]] [[Matteo Maria Zuppi]] as the [[Holy See|Vatican]]'s special envoy and peace envoy for the [[Russo-Ukrainian war]]. [https://www.tagesschau.de/newsticker/liveblog-ukraine-samstag-280.html (Tagesschau)]

Fighting in [[Khartoum]] between rival factions intensifies, with damage reported at the [[embassy]] of [[Qatar]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230520-air-strikes-shake-khartoum-qatar-embassy-attacked (AFP via France 24)]

Five [[Border Guard Command (Iran)|Iranian border guard]]s are killed and two others are injured in [[Saravan, Iran|Saravan]], [[Sistan and Baluchestan province]], during a confrontation with an [[Violent non-state actor|armed group]] at [[Iran–Pakistan border|the border]] with [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/iran-border-clash-guards-killed-pakistan-7c871b8b66363155d1b8acdd8d211acb (AP)]

Governor of [[Belgorod Oblast]] [[Vyacheslav Gladkov]] says that Ukrainian "sabotage groups" have entered [[Grayvoronsky District]]. Ukrainian media reports that the cross-border excursion is being performed by the Russian rebel opposition groups, the [[Russian Volunteer Corps]] and the [[Freedom of Russia Legion]]. The Freedom of Russia Legion reports that it has captured the Russian towns of [[Kozinka, Belgorod Oblast|Kozinka]] and [[Gora-Podol]]. A bridge crossing the [[Vorskla]] near [[Grayvoron]] is destroyed in an explosion. [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/05/22/world/europe/belgorod-russia-ukraine-fighting.html (''The New York Times'')] [https://news.yahoo.com/explosions-belgorod-oblast-russian-volunteer-084900667.html (Ukrainska Pravda via Yahoo! News)] [https://meduza.io/en/news/2023/05/22/belgorod-governor-reports-incursion-into-region-by-ukrainian-sabotage-and-reconnaissance-group (''Meduza'')] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/governor-russias-belgorod-says-ukrainian-sabotage-group-crossed-border-2023-05-22/ (Reuters)]

[[Israeli security forces]] kill three [[Al Aqsa Martyrs Brigades]] militants and injure six others during a raid in [[Nablus]], [[West Bank]]. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/3-palestinians-killed-israeli-raid-occupied-west-bank-99500257 (ABC News)]

Three [[Sinjar Resistance Units]] [[militant]]s are killed by a [[Government of Turkey|Turkish]] [[drone strike]] in [[Sinjar District]], [[Iraq]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/turkish-drone-strike-kills-three-ybs-fighters-iraq-kurdish-counter-terrorism-2023-05-23/ (Reuters)]

Four security troops and two private guards are killed after several gunmen tried to storm an oil and gas plant in [[Hangu, Pakistan|Hangu]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-militant-attack-oil-plant-ff3af8226f78dbad25982740e1be9721 (AP)]

[[Japan]] announces that it will donate 100 [[military vehicle]]s to the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine]]. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/japan-provide-100-military-vehicles-ukraine-99564731 (ABC News)]

Four people are killed and several others are injured by a [[suicide attack|suicide]] [[car bomb]]ing at a [[security checkpoint|checkpoint]] in [[North Waziristan District]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-suicide-bomber-attack-waziristan-32e4f46197cab70e136fc903d007260b (AP)]

[[Wagner Group]] forces begin withdrawing from [[Bakhmut]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], transferring control over to the [[Russian Ground Forces]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-65705733 (BBC News)]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] missile strike on [[Dnipro]] damages a medical facility, killing two people and injuring 23 others. [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2023/05/26/7404002/ (Ukrainska Pravda)] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/may/26/russia-ukraine-war-at-a-glance-what-we-know-on-day-457-of-the-invasion (''The Guardian'')]

Fifty-four [[Uganda People's Defence Force|Ugandan soldiers]] are killed after [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] gunmen storm an [[African Union Mission to Somalia|AMISOM]] base in [[Buulo Mareer|Bulomarer]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/4/al-shabab-killed-54-ugandan-soldiers-in-somalia-says-museveni (Al Jazeera)]

Seventeen civilians are killed by [[Allied Democratic Forces]] members in [[Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo|Beni]], [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://apnews.com/article/jihadi-violence-congo-rebels-a6ef6d240da7200e6d07a76155d4cd07 (AP)]

[[Germany]]'s [[Bundestag]] votes 375–263, with one abstention, to approve the [[Bundeswehr]]'s deployment in [[Mali]] as part of the [[United Nations|UN]]'s [[United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali|MINUSMA]] [[peacekeeping]] mission until May 31, 2024. [https://www.dw.com/en/germany-extends-mali-military-mission-for-last-time/a-65746884 (DW)]

Russian authorities say that shelling has killed a person in [[Shebekino]], [[Belgorod Oblast]] and [[Kursk]], [[Kursk Oblast]], respectively. [[Russia]] accuses [[Ukraine]] of the attacks, although Ukraine denies any involvement. [https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2023/05/27/two-killed-in-shelling-in-russian-border-regions-officials-a81310 (AFP via ''The Moscow Times'')]

Two [[Border Guard Command (Iran)|Iranian border guards]] and a [[Afghan Armed Forces|Taliban member]] are killed during a sbootout along the [[Afghanistan–Iran border]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/two-killed-clash-iran-afghan-border-taliban-official-says-2023-05-27/ (Reuters)]

About 40 people, mainly [[Volunteers for the Defense of the Homeland|VDP]] members, are killed during two attacks by gunmen in the [[Boucle du Mouhoun Region]]. [https://www.africanews.com/2023/05/31/burkina-faso-nearly-40-dead-in-2-jihadist-attacks/ (Africa News)]

Two people are killed and three others are injured in a "record [[military drone|drone]] attack" on [[Kyiv]]. [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] authorities say they have shot down 52 of 54 drones. [https://www.euronews.com/2023/05/27/ukraine-war-kyiv-requests-german-missiles-as-counter-offensive-looms (Euronews)]

Two [[park ranger|rangers]] are killed in a shooting at [[Virunga National Park]] in [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/gunmen-kill-two-rangers-congos-virunga-national-park-2023-05-28/ (Reuters)]

Thirty-three tribal [[militant]]s are killed by [[Indian Army|soldiers]] during an operation in [[Manipur]], [[India]], following ethnic clashes in the region. [https://www.reuters.com/world/india/around-33-tribal-militants-killed-clashes-indias-manipur-minister-2023-05-28/ (Reuters)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] strike [[Kyiv]] using [[9K720 Iskander|Iskander]] [[Ballistic missile|ballistic]] and [[cruise missile]]s, with debris injuring one [[civilian]] and damaging infrastructure. Russian [[airstrike]]s on [[Toretsk]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], target a [[Filling station|petrol station]] and a multi-storey building, killing two people and injuring eight others. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/two-dead-eight-wounded-russian-attack-donetsk-region-governor-2023-05-29/ (Reuters)]

[[Commander-in-chief]] of the [[Special Operations Forces (Russia)|Russian special forces]] in [[Syria]], Colonel Oleg Pechevisty, is killed by an [[Tahrir al-Sham|HTS]] [[artillery]] strike on a military post in [[Latakia Governorate|Latakia Province]]. [https://www.syriahr.com/en/300051/ (SOHR)] [https://www.enabbaladi.net/archives/643845 (Enab Baladi)]

Twenty-five [[Peacekeeping|peacekeepers]] of the [[NATO]]-led [[Kosovo Force|KFOR]] are injured after clashes with [[Kosovo Serbs|ethnic Serbs]] in [[North Kosovo]] over the installation of [[Kosovo Albanians|ethnic Albanian]] mayors. [[President of Serbia|Serbian President]] [[Aleksandar Vučić]] places the [[Serbian Armed Forces]] on the highest level of combat alert in response to the clashes. [[Russian authorities]] say they have intercepted eight [[military drone|drones]] over [[Moscow]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-65751632 (BBC News)]

A Russian [[drone attack]] on [[Kyiv]] results in the death of a [[civilian]] and injures several others. [https://www.nytimes.com/live/2023/05/30/world/russia-ukraine-drones-news (''The New York Times'')]

An [[Israeli settler]] is shot and killed near [[Hermesh]], [[West Bank]] by [[Al Aqsa Martyrs Brigade]] gunmen. [https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-violence-west-bank-e7c01624cf4d3b56851770b77c41ed77 (AP)]

Eight people are killed when [[Boko Haram]] gunmen attack the towns of [[Mora, Cameroon|Mora]] and Zigage, [[Far North Region (Cameroon)|Far North]], [[Cameroon]]. [https://apnews.com/article/boko-haram-cameroon-attacks-ee7815d117fe92398bf089356d73badb (AP)]

[[Russia]] says that it destroyed the [[Ukrainian Navy]] warship [[Ukrainian ship Yuri Olefirenko|''Yuri Olefirenko'']] at the [[Port of Odesa]] in a [[missile]] strike on May 29. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-says-it-destroys-ukraines-last-warship-2023-05-31/ (Reuters)]

Russian authorities say that a [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] [[drone warfare|drone strike]] has caused a fire at an [[oil refinery]] in [[Krasnodar Krai]], and also caused damage in [[Shebekino]], [[Belgorod Oblast]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukrainian-drone-sparks-fire-russian-refinery-governor-2023-05-31/ (Reuters)]

According to Russian authorities, five people are killed and 19 others are injured by Ukrainian [[shell (projectile)|shelling]] in Karpaty, in Russian-occupied [[Luhansk Oblast]]. [https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2023-05-31/five-dead-in-ukraine-shelling-of-luhansk-village-moscow-installed-centre (US News)]

About 100 gunmen [[ambush]] a military escort of a food convoy in Tibou, killing two civilians. [https://www.africanews.com/amp/2023/06/02/burkina-2-civilians-and-50-terrorists-killed-in-an-attack-in-the-north/ (Africa News)]

Five members of the [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine – General Command]] are killed and ten others are injured in an explosion at a base in Qusaya, [[Beqaa Governorate]], [[Lebanon]]. The PFLP accuses the [[Israel Defense Forces]] of responsibility. [https://www.aljazeera.com/amp/news/2023/5/31/5-palestinian-fighters-killed-in-lebanon-blast-blamed-on-israel (Al Jazeera)]

[[NATO]] deploys a further 700 troops to [[North Kosovo]] to reinforce its [[Kosovo Force|KFOR]] [[peacekeeping]] mission amid clashes with [[Kosovo Serbs|Kosovo Serb]] protesters over the election and installation of [[Kosovo Albanians|ethnic Albanian]] mayors in several Serb-majority towns following a Serbian election boycott. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/us-troops-guard-town-hall-northern-kosovo-2023-05-31/ (Reuters)]

Russia says they have prevented three attacks by the [[Russian Volunteer Corps]] in [[Belgorod Oblast]]. [https://news.yahoo.com/russian-partisans-back-belgorod-oblast-100800965.html (''The New Voice of Ukraine'' via Yahoo! News)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-defence-ministry-says-it-thwarted-three-attacks-belgorod-region-agencies-2023-06-01/ (Reuters)]

[[Governor of Belgorod Oblast|Belgorod Governor]] [[Vyacheslav Gladkov]] says that [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] have shelled [[Shebekino]] with [[BM-21 Grad]] rockets, damaging a dormitory and an administrative building in the town. Hundreds of people are [[emergency evacuation|evacuated]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/belgorod-governor-says-eight-wounded-by-ukrainian-shelling-civilians-be-2023-06-01/ (Reuters)]
[[Russia]] launches [[cruise missile]]s and [[ballistic missile]]s at [[Kyiv]], killing three [[civilian]]s and injuring 12 others. [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2313866/world (AFP via Arab News)]

Twenty-seven people are killed and at least 106 others are injured when rockets are fired at a market in [[Khartoum]], [[Sudan]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jun/01/sudan-19-killed-in-shelling-of-market-in-poor-area-south-of-khartoum (''The Guardian'')] [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-65777311 (BBC News)]

[[Russian occupation of Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Russian occupation]] official Vladimir Rogov says [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] have shelled the [[port of Berdiansk]] in [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]], injuring nine people. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-backed-official-says-ukraine-shelled-port-berdyansk-2023-06-02/ (Reuters)]

Nine people are killed when [[Allied Democratic Forces]] [[insurgent]]s attack a group of people on the Kyondo-Kyavinyonge road in [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://apnews.com/article/congo-civilians-killed-adf-extremist-fe3b6e1fee669c68e69f496f257ad4b0 (AP)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] strike a residential area in [[Dnipro Raion]] with [[9K720 Iskander|Iskander]] [[cruise missile]]s, killing a two-year-old girl and injuring 22 other [[civilian]]s, including five children. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/thirteen-injured-explosion-near-ukrainian-city-dnipro-2023-06-03/ (Reuters)]

Three [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] and an [[Egyptian National Police|Egyptian policeman]] are killed in an [[Shootout|exchange of fire]] near the [[Egypt–Israel border|Egyptian-Israeli border]]. It is the first fatal incident between the two countries in more than a decade. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/06/03/israel-egypt-border-shootout/801491ea-01f3-11ee-9eb0-6c94dcb16fcf_story.html (''The Washington Post'')]

Seven people are killed during a [[mass shooting]] against villagers in Polhó, a [[Zapatista Army of National Liberation|Zapatista]] community in [[Chenalhó]], [[Mexico]]. [https://www.laprensalatina.com/7-killed-in-attack-on-displaced-people-in-southern-mexico/amp/ (La Prensa Latina)]

The [[Sudanese Armed Forces]] bombs the [[International University of Africa]] in [[Khartoum]], killing ten [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congolese]] nationals. DRC Foreign Minister [[Christophe Lutundula]] says his country has demanded an explanation from the Sudanese government. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-65821597 (BBC News)]

Seventy-seven [[primary school]] girls are hospitalised after a poison attack on two schools in [[Sancharak District|Sancharak]], [[Sar-e Pol Province|Sar-e Pol]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://www.channelnewsasia.com/world/afghanistan-schoolgirls-poisoned-primary-taliban-3538031 (CNA)]

The [[Russian Volunteer Corps]] claims to have captured the village of [[Novaya Tavolzhanka]] in the [[Belgorod region]] of [[Russia]]. The governor of Belgorod, [[Vyacheslav Gladkov]], says that about 100 [[civilian]]s are still trapped in the village and cannot be evacuated because of continued [[shell (projectile)|shelling]]. [https://novayagazeta.eu/articles/2023/06/05/belgorod-region-governor-authorities-cannot-enter-territory-of-novaya-tavolzhanka-village-because-of-non-stop-shelling-en-news (''Novaya Gazeta Europe'')]

[[Wagner Group]] mercenaries publish a video of a captured Russian commander claiming that he had ordered his troops to fire on a Wagner convoy leaving [[Bakhmut]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jun/05/wagner-group-release-video-of-captured-russian-commander (''The Guardian'')]

Two [[Pakistan Army|soldiers]] and two [[Pakistani Taliban]] members are killed in a [[shootout]] in [[North Waziristan]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-taliban-shootout-soldiers-killed-c9432bde016b50ef8aa67d5493d1e911 (AP)]

The [[Kakhovka Hydroelectric Power Plant|Nova Kakhovka dam]] in the [[Russian occupation of Kherson Oblast|Russian-occupied part]] of [[Ukraine]]'s [[Kherson Oblast|Kherson]] [[Oblasts of Ukraine|Oblast]] is destroyed, releasing a huge amount of water downstream on the [[Dnieper]]. The dam had held back 18 [[cubic kilometre]]s of water in the [[Kakhovka reservoir]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/what-is-kakhovka-dam-ukraine-what-happened-2023-06-07/ (Reuters)]

Thousands of [[civilian]]s are being [[emergency evacuation|evacuated]] from the town of [[Nova Kakhovka]] and surrounding villages as the floods spread. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-65819591 (BBC News)]

The deputy governor of [[Afghanistan]]'s [[Badakhshan Province]] and his driver are killed and six civilians injured when a [[Suicide attack|suicide]] [[car bomb]]er [[vehicle-ramming attack|rams]] their vehicle in [[Fayzabad, Badakhshan|Fayzabad]]. [https://www.dw.com/en/taliban-provincial-governor-killed-in-car-bomb-attack/a-65835136 (DW)]

[[Iran]] unveils a domestically produced [[Hypersonic speed|hypersonic]] long-range [[Ballistic missile|missile]] named "[[Fattah (missile)|Fattah]]", which they claim can penetrate missile defense systems. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/6/fattah-iran-unveils-its-first-hypersonic-missile (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] shell [[Kherson]], injuring nine [[civilian]]s near an [[emergency evacuation|evacuation]] point in a flooded part of the city following the [[Destruction of the Kakhovka Dam|destruction of the Kakhovka dam]]. [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/08/world/europe/kherson-russian-shelling.html (''The New York Times'')]

The [[Ministry of Defence (Russia)|Russian Defence Ministry]] says it has destroyed several [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Ukrainian army]] tanks in [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]], including a [[Leopard 2]] main battle tank, the first Western-made tank to be destroyed by [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] in the war. A video released by the ministry shows a column of tanks being hit in a field, with one of them confirmed to be a Leopard 2. [https://www.businessinsider.com/russia-says-video-shows-1st-leopard-tank-destroyed-in-ukraine-2023-6?r=US&IR=T (Business Insider)]

At least 11 people are killed and 30 others are injured by a [[car bomb]] outside a [[mosque]] in [[Fayzabad, Badakhshan|Fayzabad]], [[Afghanistan]], during a prayer service for the deputy governor of [[Badakhshan Province]] who was killed two days ago. The [[Islamic State – Khorasan Province|Islamic State]] claimed responsibility. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-65842605 (BBC News)]

Thirteen people are killed after intercommunal fighting in a camp in [[Malakal]], [[Upper Nile (state)|Upper Nile]], [[South Sudan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/fighting-south-sudan-displaced-peoples-camp-kills-13-un-2023-06-09/ (Reuters)]

A [[United Nations peacekeeping|United Nations peacekeeper]] is killed and four others are injured in an [[improvised explosive device]] attack in [[Ber, Mali|Ber]], [[Tombouctou Region]], [[Mali]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/one-un-peacekeeper-killed-four-injured-north-mali-attack-2023-06-09/ (Reuters)]

At least 27 people are killed and 53 others are injured after a [[Mortar (weapon)|mortar]] attack in [[Qoryoley]], [[Lower Shabelle]], [[Somalia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/mortar-blast-kills-27-somalia-state-news-media-2023-06-09/ (Reuters)]

Six civilians and three soldiers are killed and ten others are injured by [[al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] at a hotel in [[Lido Beach, Mogadishu|Lido Beach]], [[Mogadishu]]. All seven attackers are also killed. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/06/10/Six-civilians-killed-10-wounded-in-Somalia-hotel-siege-Police (AFP via Al Arabiya)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] attack [[Odesa]] with [[Unmanned combat aerial vehicle|drones]] and missiles, killing three [[civilian]]s and injuring 27 others. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/three-killed-russian-drone-attack-odesa-overnight-ukraine-2023-06-10/ (Reuters)]

[[Armed forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] claim to have retaken three villages south of [[Velyka Novosilka]] in the southern [[Donetsk region]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jun/11/ukraine-claims-to-have-liberated-two-frontline-villages-in-donetsk (''The Guardian'')]

Four police officers are killed and two others are injured in shootings at two [[police station]]s in [[Cư Kuin district|Cư Kuin]], [[Đắk Lắk province|Đắk Lắk]], [[Vietnam]]. Sixteen people are arrested. [https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/several-killed-wounded-vietnam-central-highlands-police-station-attacks-3554261 (CNA)]

Three people are killed and three others are injured after border clashes near the [[North Waziristan District]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]], on the [[Afghanistan–Pakistan border barrier|Afghanistan–Pakistan border]]

[[Turkish Armed Forces|Turkish]] [[artillery]] [[shell (projectile)|shelling]] kills a [[Russian Ground Forces|Russian soldier]] and injures four others in northern [[Aleppo governorate]], [[Syria]]. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/reports-turkish-shelling-north-syria-kills-russian-soldier-100006243 (ABC News)] [https://www.syriahr.com/en/301197/ (SOHR)]

At least 46 people are killed by [[CODECO]] in an [[Internally displaced person|IDP camp]] in the Bahema Badjere district of [[Ituri]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/least-40-killed-militia-attack-camp-displaced-people-congos-ituri-2023-06-12/ (Reuters)]

Russian rockets hit a residential building in the city of [[Kryvyi Rih]], [[Dnipropetrovsk oblast]], killing 11 people and injuring 28 others. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/13/russia-air-attack-hits-apartment-building-in-central-ukraine (Al Jazeera)] [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-counteroffensive-kryvyi-rih-60442dd3deace0c1f8f874c01b357487 (AP)]

At least three people are killed and 13 others are injured in a [[missile strike|rocket attack]] on a residential area in [[Odesa]], [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/6/14/russia-ukraine-live-three-killed-in-odesa-missile-strike (Al Jazeera)]
[[Adam Delimkhanov]], a Russian-[[Chechens|Chechen]] member of the [[State Duma]], is reportedly injured in Ukraine. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-65900913 (BBC News)]

[[Serbian Armed Forces|Serbian forces]] detain three [[Kosovo Police]] officers, accusing them of illegally crossing the border. [[Prime Minister of Kosovo|Kosovan Prime Minister]] [[Albin Kurti]] denies the Serbian claims, saying that the officers were arrested 300 metres inside Kosovan territory, and demands their immediate release. [https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2023-06-14/serbias-security-forces-detain-three-kosovo-police-officers-kosovo-official-says (U.S. News and World Report)]

Ten [[Syrian Democratic Forces|SDF]] fighters and five [[Syrian Arab Army|Syrian soldiers]] are killed by [[Turkish Armed Forces|Turkish]] [[Drone warfare|drone strikes]] in [[Aleppo Governorate]], [[Syria]]. [https://www.syriahr.com/en/301454/ (SOHR)]

The [[List of current state governors in Sudan|state governor]] of [[West Darfur]], Khamis Abakar, is killed in [[Geneina]] after being abducted by armed men shortly after accusing the [[Rapid Support Forces]] (RSF) of committing [[genocide]] in the state. The RSF denies killing Abakar, blaming "outlaws" for his death. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-65914569 (BBC News)]
Nine people are killed in ethnic clashes in [[Manipur]], [[India]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/14/nine-killed-in-new-ethnic-violence-in-indias-manipur (Al Jazeera)]

Two [[Islamic State]] operatives, including Abu Zacharia, a leader of [[Abu Sayyaf]], are killed in separate operations by joint security forces in [[Marawi]], [[Philippines]]. [https://www.cnnphilippines.com/news/2023/6/14/ISIS-Southeast-Asia-leader-killed-in-Marawi-encounter-AFP.html (CNN Philippines)] [https://news.abs-cbn.com/video/news/06/14/23/2-terrorists-killed-in-lanao-del-norte (ABS-CBN News)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] attack [[Kherson]], injuring 23 [[civilian]]s and damaging infrastructure. [https://kyivindependent.com/update-23-injured-in-russian-attack-against-kherson-oblast/ (''The Kyiv Independent'')]

A peace mission visit of African officials to Ukraine is interrupted by a Russian missile attack according to the [[Ukrainian Air Force]], which says it has shot down six [[Kh-47M2 Kinzhal|Kinzhal]] [[ballistic missile]]s, six [[Kalibr (missile family)|Kalibr]] missiles, and two [[reconnaissance]] [[Unmanned aerial vehicle|UAVs]]. [https://news.yahoo.com/news/african-leaders-set-meet-presidents-082455161.html (AFP via Yahoo! News)]

Forty-one people are killed, including 38 students, eight others injured and at least six [[kidnap]]ped during an attack by five [[Allied Democratic Forces]] [[jihadist]]s at a [[secondary school]] in [[Mpondwe]], [[Western Region, Uganda|Western Region]], [[Uganda]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/17/dozens-killed-in-attack-on-ugandan-school-near-drc-border (Al Jazeera)]

Five foreign [[militant]]s are killed in a [[gunfight]] with police in [[Kupwara district]], [[Jammu and Kashmir (union territory)|Jammu and Kashmir]], [[India]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/india/indian-police-say-five-foreign-militants-killed-kashmir-2023-06-16/ (Reuters)]

[[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Mali)|Foreign Minister]] [[Abdoulaye Diop]] requests the [[United Nations Security Council]] to terminate [[United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali|its peacekeeping mission]] in [[Mali|the country]] immediately, citing its "failure" to help improve the situation. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/16/mali-asks-un-to-withdraw-its-peacekeeping-mission-without-delay (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Sudanese Air Force]] launches [[airstrike]]s in [[Khartoum]], killing at least 17 people and destroying dozens of homes. The [[Sudanese Armed Forces|armed forces]] and the [[Rapid Support Forces]] agree to a 72-hour [[ceasefire]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-65938868 (BBC News)]

At least ten people are killed during an [[offensive (military)|offensive]] by the [[military of Cameroon]] against [[separatist]]s in the [[English-speaking]] [[Northwest Region (Cameroon)|Northwest Region]]. [https://english.news.cn/20230617/693db70a7bc34d8ba12b380b169b5f2d/c.html (Xinhua)]

[[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] capture the [[front line]] village of Piatykhatky in [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]] as heavy fighting continues. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukrainian-forces-take-control-piatykhatky-village-zaporizhzhia-front-russian-2023-06-18/ (Reuters)]

Six [[Palestinians]] are killed and 90 others are injured during an [[Israeli Defense Forces|IDF]] raid in the [[Jenin refugee camp]] in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/19/deaths-injuries-as-israeli-forces-raid-jenin (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/20/sixth-palestinian-killed-in-israeli-raid-on-jenin-refugee-camp (Al Jazeera)]

[[Hamas]] kill four [[Israelis]] and injure four others in a [[mass shooting]] at a restaurant and a [[Filling station|petrol station]] near the [[Israeli settlement]] of [[Eli (Israeli settlement)|Eli]] in the occupied [[West Bank]]. The two gunmen are killed by a civilian and a [[Israeli Ground Forces|soldier]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-65963017 (BBC News)]

Seven people are killed and seven more injured when a police car and a public service vehicle are targeted by two [[improvised explosive device|roadside bombings]] at two different locations in [[Mandera County]], [[Kenya]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/four-killed-north-east-kenya-after-vehicle-runs-over-explosive-2023-06-21/ (Reuters)]

A [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] man is killed and several others are injured by [[Israeli settlement|Israeli settlers]] in [[Turmus Ayya]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-65973383 (BBC News)]

An Israeli [[Drone warfare|drone]] conducts the first [[airstrike]] on the [[West Bank]] since 2005, targeting a car, and killing two [[Palestinian Islamic Jihad|PIJ]] members and an [[Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades]] member. [https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/palestinian-car-west-bank-struck-israeli-drone-strike (Middle East Eye)]
A bridge between southern Ukraine and Russian-occupied [[Crimea]] has been damaged by a British-made [[Storm Shadow]] missile. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-65982817 (BBC News)]

Eight people are killed and ten others are kidnapped after Islamic extremists attacked a group of farmers in [[Mafa]], [[Borno State]], [[Nigeria]]. [https://apnews.com/article/nigeria-boko-haram-farmers-killed-abducted-c67405c72d226ba2eadbe5c95854c432 (AP)]

[[Wagner Group]] leader [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]] declares that he will "stop" the [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian military]] leadership and calls for a "march of justice", claiming that his forces have been killed in [[airstrike]]s by Russian government forces. The [[Ministry of Defence of the Russian Federation|defence ministry]] rejects the claims, stating that they are "not true and are an information provocation". [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-66005256 (BBC News)] [https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/mutiny-wagern-prigozhin-1.6887226 (CBC News)] [https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2023/06/23/prigozhin-says-moscow-strikes-kill-huge-number-of-wagner-forces-vows-to-stop-top-brass-a81615 (''The Moscow Times'')] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jun/23/wagner-chief-accuses-russias-military-of-attack-and-says-evil-leadership-must-be-stopped (''The Guardian'')]

The [[Prosecutor-General of Russia]] [[Igor Krasnov]] formally orders the arrest of Yevgeny Prigozhin on charges of calling for an "armed rebellion", with authorities urging Wagner personnel to refuse Prigozhin's "criminal and treacherous orders" and to detain him. The [[Federal Security Service|FSB]] begins a [[mutiny]] investigation into Yevgeny Prigozhin. [https://tass.com/russia/1637425 (TASS)] [https://tass.com/russia/1637417 (TASS 2)] [https://www.npr.org/2023/06/23/1184090744/russia-wagner-group-yevgeny-prigozhin-criminal-case (NPR)]

[[BBC News Russian]] reports that there are roadblocks on the [[M4 highway (Russia)|M4 highway]] between [[Moscow]] and [[Voronezh]], with the [[Federal Security Service|FSB]] and other security services being placed on high alert in the [[Moscow Oblast]]. [https://t.me/bbcrussian/48274 (BBC News Russian)]

The [[Wagner Group]] seizes and occupies the cities of [[Rostov-on-Don]] and [[Voronezh]] as clashes occur across both oblasts. Wagner Group forces capture the [[Southern Military District]] headquarters in Rostov-on-Don. [[Governor of Rostov Oblast|Rostov Governor]] [[Vasily Golubev (politician)|Vasily Golubev]] asks residents to remain indoors. [https://amp.9news.com.au/article/b8400f77-3afc-4b43-9336-890051477041 (9News)] [https://ukrainetoday.org/2023/06/24/breaking-wagners-took-city-of-voronezh-convoy-of-tanks-on-highway-to-moscow/ (Ukraine Today)] [https://edition.cnn.com/europe/live-news/russia-ukraine-war-news-06-23-23/index.html (CNN)]

[[Yevgeny Prigozhin]] warns that his troops will march on [[Moscow]] unless [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian military]] leadership meet with him for talks. [[President of Russia|Russian president]] [[Vladimir Putin]] addresses the nation, saying that a [[coup d'état]] attempt is under way. [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/24/world/europe/prigozhin-videos-rostov.html (''The New York Times'')] [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-wagner-prigozhin-9acbdf1eda849692ca0423a4116058d1 (AP)]

An [[Antonov An-26]] transport plane is reportedly shot down over [[Voronezh Oblast]], while [[Russian Air Force]] [[Kamov Ka-50|Ka-50]] helicopters strike an [[oil refinery]] and depot in Voronezh, causing a large [[explosion]] and fire.[https://defence-blog.com/russian-mercenaries-shot-down-an-26-transport-plane/ (Defence Blog)] [https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/russia-wagner-group-rebellion-live-updates-yevgeny-prigozhin-ukraine-101687576973612.html (''Hindustan Times'')]

Authorities in [[Lipetsk Oblast]] tell residents to remain indoors, with the [[M4 highway (Russia)|M4 highway]] closed off to traffic. Wagner forces later enter [[Lipetsk]]. [https://www.livemint.com/news/world/russia-live-updates-wagner-chief-russian-military-leadership-putin-ukraine-11687571201382.html (Live Mint)] [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/06/24/Authorities-in-Russia-s-Lipetsk-urge-residents-to-stay-home-amid-Wagner-rebellion (Al Arabiya)] [https://www.dnpindia.in/world/russian-civil-war-wagner-troops-enter-lipetsk-on-their-march-towards-moscow-whats-in-store/253695/ (DNP India)]

The Wagner Group withdraws after Yevgeny Prigozhin, Vladimir Putin, and [[President of Belarus]] [[Alexander Lukashenko]] negotiate a deal to end the rebellion. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-wagner-prigozhin-9acbdf1eda849692ca0423a4116058d1 (AP)]

The debris of a Russian [[cruise missile]] shot down last night damages a 25-storey building in [[Kyiv]], [[Ukraine]], killing three [[civilian]]s and injuring eight others. The [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian military]] says that air defences destroyed 41 out of 51 cruise missiles launched by Russia, as well as two drones. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/all-ukraine-under-air-alerts-drone-fragments-kyiv-2023-06-24/ (Reuters)]

A [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] teenager is shot and killed at a checkpoint in [[Qalandiya]] after opening fire on [[Israeli security forces]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/24/israeli-forces-kill-palestinian-teen-after-checkpoint-shooting (Al Jazeera)]

One person is killed and five others are injured as a [[Balochistan Liberation Army]] [[suicide attack|suicide bomber]] blows herself up near a military convoy in [[Turbat]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-suicide-bomber-11cd95d4ab2169eadb51bc3bb313afa0 (AP)]

Two people, a rebel and a soldier, are killed, and fourteen others are injured in a shooting incident in [[Maimbung]], [[Sulu]], [[Philippines]]. [https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/06/25/23/2-dead-14-wounded-in-sulu-clash (ABS-CBN News)]

Nine people are killed and 30 others are injured by [[Russian Air Force|Russian]] [[airstrike]]s on a market in [[Jisr ash-Shughur]], [[Idlib Governorate]], [[Syria]]. [https://apnews.com/article/syria-idlib-airstrike-russia-cbe52979bd8a0f7e6001a0b371d9745b (AP)]

Five people are killed, some by [[decapitation]], by [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[jihadist]]s across two villages in [[Lamu County]], [[Kenya]]. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/06/25/Al-Shabaab-extremists-kill-five-civilians-in-Kenya-some-by-beheading-Police-source (AFP via Al Arabiya)]

[[Australian Government|Australian]] [[Prime Minister of Australia|Prime Minister]] [[Anthony Albanese]] announces a [[Australian dollar|AU$]]110 million [[military aid]] package to [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2023/jun/26/australia-ukraine-support-funding-110m-military-assistance-vehicles-ammunition (''The Guardian'')]

[[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] recapture the uninhabited village of [[Rivnopil, Velyka Novosilka settlement hromada, Volnovakha Raion, Donetsk Oblast|Rivnopil]] in [[Donetsk Oblast]], according to Deputy Defence Minister [[Hanna Maliar]], the ninth in the past month. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-says-it-has-retaken-southeastern-village-rivnopil-2023-06-26/ (Reuters)]

The [[Rapid Support Forces]] take control of the main [[Law enforcement in Sudan|police]] base in [[Khartoum]], seizing a large amount of [[military equipment]] and [[ammunition]], including 160 [[pickup truck]]s, 75 [[armoured personnel carrier]]s, and 27 tanks. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jun/26/sudan-paramilitary-force-reportedly-makes-gains-in-khartoum-as-fighting-surges (''The Guardian'')]

The [[Sudan People's Liberation Movement–North]] attacks the town of [[Kurmuk]] in [[Blue Nile (state)|Blue Nile]], [[Sudan]], prompting hundreds of [[civilian]]s to flee across [[Ethiopia–Sudan border|the border]] to [[Ethiopia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/reports-fighting-sudans-southeast-after-rsf-advance-khartoum-2023-06-26/ (Reuters)]

A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] missile strike on a restaurant in [[Kramatorsk]], [[Donetsk Oblast]], [[Ukraine]], kills 13 [[civilian]]s and injures 61 others. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jun/27/deadly-russian-missile-strike-on-busy-pizza-restaurant-in-kramatorsk (''The Guardian'')] [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ukraine-war-russia-kramatorsk-putin-b2365996.html (''The Independent'')]

[[President of Belarus|Belarusian President]] [[Alexander Lukashenko]] confirms that the head of the [[Wagner Group]], [[Yevgeny Prigozhin]], has arrived in [[Belarus]] in accordance with the agreement reached with the [[Russian government]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/putin-pays-tribute-russian-pilots-killed-fighting-mutineers-2023-06-27/ (Reuters)]

Suspected [[jihadist]]s kill several [[Burkina Faso Armed Forces|Burkinabé soldiers]] and members of the [[Volunteers for the Defense of the Homeland|Volunteers for the Defence of the Homeland]] in a series of attacks on troops in the village of Noaka, [[Pissila Department|Pissila department]], [[Sanmatenga Province]], and in the [[Sahel Region]]. [https://www.voanews.com/a/burkina-troops-allied-militiamen-killed-in-attacks-security-sources-say/7155308.html (AFP via VOA)]

[[Airstrike]]s are reported in the [[Sudan]]ese capital [[Khartoum]], while heavy fighting takes place in [[Omdurman]] despite a [[ceasefire]] declared by both sides for the [[Islamic holidays|Islamic holiday]] [[Eid al-Adha]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/6/28/air-strikes-hit-sudan-capital-despite-eid-truce (Al Jazeera)]

Four [[Armed Forces of Armenia|Armenian soldiers]] are killed by [[Azerbaijani Armed Forces|Azerbaijani forces]] in the [[separatist]] region of [[Republic of Artsakh|Artsakh]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20230628-four-armenian-soldiers-killed-by-azerbaijani-forces-in-nagorno-karabakh-separatists-say (AFP via France 24)]

Two students and a professor are stabbed and injured in a [[Gender studies|gender-studies classroom]] at the [[University of Waterloo]] in [[Waterloo, Ontario]], [[Canada]]. The suspect, a recent university graduate, has been arrested and charged. The attack is believed to be motivated by hatred related to "gender expression and gender identity." [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/kitchener-waterloo/emergency-alert-university-waterloo-stabbing-watsafe-1.6892506 (CBC News)] [https://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/student-charged-in-university-of-waterloo-stabbing-police-say-was-hate-motivated-1.6461495 (CTV News)]

A man opens fire near the [[United States]] consulate in [[Jeddah]], [[Saudi Arabia]], killing a security guard, before being shot dead during a [[shootout]]. [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2329721/saudi-arabia (Arab News)]

The [[Tatmadaw]] carries out an air strike in the [[Sagaing Region]], [[Myanmar]] killing at least ten civilians and injuring more than a dozen others, according to local officials and eyewitnesses. Thirteen homes are also destroyed according to officials. [https://www.cnn.com/2023/06/29/asia/myanmar-junta-airstrike-sagaing-pale-intl-hnk/index.html (CNN)]

Two people are killed and another is injured after a man [[mass shooting|opens fire]] at the [[Chișinău International Airport]] in [[Chișinău]], [[Moldova]]. The perpetrator is injured and detained. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-66070461 (BBC News)]

The [[United Nations Security Council]] votes unanimously to end [[MINUSMA]], its peacekeeping mission in [[Mali]]. [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/un-votes-to-end-its-peacekeeping-mission-in-mali-as-demanded-by-the-country-s-military-junta/ar-AA1dgoBy?ocid=entnewsntp&cvid=4daddb4c9027416f9fb9c7774c4dc028&ei=21 (MSN)]

[[Riot|Rioters]] set fire to the main [[public library]] in [[Marseille]] as [[civil unrest]] continues across [[France]]. More than 900 people have been arrested and [[Minister of the Interior (France)|Interior Minister]] [[Gérald Darmanin]] deploys an additional 45,000 [[National Police (France)|police officers]] to the streets. [https://www.freepressjournal.in/world/france-violence-rioters-burn-down-largest-public-library-in-marseille-visuals-surface (''Freepress Journal'')] [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/world-europe-66049895 (BBC News)]
[[Riot]]s continue across [[France]]. More than 1,300 people have been arrested, and 79 police officers have been injured. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/world-europe-66073728 (BBC News)]

[[Looter]]s raid a [[gun shop]] in [[Marseille]], stealing eight hunting [[rifle]]s and [[ammunition]] before [[Law enforcement in France|police]] intervene. [https://news.sky.com/story/france-suspends-all-bus-and-tram-services-amid-riots-over-police-shooting-12912490 (Sky News)]

[[President of France|President]] [[Emmanuel Macron]] cancels a [[state visit]] to [[Germany]], which would have been the first state visit in 23 years. [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/nahel-buried-france-macron-cancels-germany-state-visit-riots/ (CBS News)]

[[Riot]]ers [[Ram-raiding|ram-raid]] and set ablaze the residence of [[L'Haÿ-les-Roses]] mayor [[Vincent Jeanbrun]], a member of the [[Centre-right politics|centre-right]] [[The Republicans (France)|Republicans]] party, injuring the mayor's wife and child. Jeanbrun was at the [[town hall]] during the incident. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/rioters-ram-raid-home-french-mayor-wife-injured-2023-07-02/ (Reuters)]

Eight [[Palestinians]] are killed and more than 50 others are injured when [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] storm the [[Jenin refugee camp]] in the occupied [[West Bank]]. The [[Israeli Air Force]] also launches [[airstrike]]s during the night. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/3/two-palestinians-killed-as-israel-attacks-west-bank-city-of-jenin (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russia]] launches [[drone warfare|drone attacks]] on [[Sumy]], [[Ukraine]], killing two people and injuring 19 others. In response to the attack, [[President of Ukraine|Ukrainian President]] [[Volodymyr Zelenskyy]] calls for a major upgrade of anti-aircraft defences. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/one-killed-russian-drone-strike-northern-ukrainian-city-kyiv-says-2023-07-03/ (Reuters)]

The [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli military]]'s assault on [[Jenin]] in the [[West Bank]], continues for a second day, killing four more [[Palestinians]] and bringing the death toll to 12, with more than 120 others injured. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/7/4/jenin-attack-live-10-killed-as-israeli-raid-enters-second-day?update=2260075 (Al Jazeera)]

Seven people are injured in a [[vehicle-ramming attack|vehicle-ramming]] and [[Stabbing as a terrorist tactic|stabbing attack]] in [[Tel Aviv]], [[Israel]]. The perpetrator is shot dead by an armed citizen. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/4/several-hurt-in-suspected-car-ramming-attack-in-tel-aviv-reports (Al Jazeera)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] attack [[Pervomaiskyi]], [[Kharkiv Oblast]], with [[missile]]s, injuring at least 38 [[civilian]]s and damaging infrastructure, according to Ukrainian officials. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russian-shelling-wounds-12-including-five-children-ukraines-kharkiv-region-2023-07-04/ (Reuters)]

Two people are killed during Russian shelling of [[Kherson]]. Three more people are injured by Russian shelling in [[Chernihiv]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/04/russia-ukraine-war-at-a-glance-what-we-know-on-day-496-of-the-invasion (''The Guardian'')]

The [[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli military]] withdraws its troops from the [[Jenin refugee camp]] in the occupied [[West Bank]] after two days of [[military operation|operations]], which resulted in the deaths of at least 13 [[Palestinians]], the [[internally displaced person|displacement]] of thousands of people, and widespread damage. An Israeli soldier was also killed. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-66095622 (BBC News)]

At least 15 [[civilian]]s are killed by [[jihadist]]s in [[Sorgha]], [[Gnagna Province|Gnagna]], [[Burkina Faso]]. [https://www.voanews.com/a/civilians-killed-in-burkina-faso-in-suspected-jihadi-attack-/7168452.html (AFP via VOA)]

At least eight people are killed during an attack at a village in Bungushu, [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230705-at-least-8-dead-in-village-attack-in-eastern-dr-congo (AFP via France 24)]

Ihor Humenyuk, a [[defendant]] at the [[Shevchenkivskyi District, Kyiv|Shevchenkivskyi]] District Court in [[Kyiv]] and a former member of the [[Sich Battalion]], dies after injuring two police officers in an apparent escape attempt. [https://meduza.io/news/2023/07/05/v-shevchenkovskom-sude-kieva-proizoshel-vzryv (Meduza)]

[[Russia]] launches a [[Kalibr (missile family)|Kalibr]] [[cruise missile]] attack on [[Lviv]] from the [[Black Sea]], killing 10 [[civilian]]s and injuring 48 others. [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian forces]] say that they shot down seven of the ten missiles. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-governor-reports-casualties-infrastructure-hit-lviv-2023-07-06/ (Reuters)] [https://city-adm.lviv.ua/news/society/emergency/297386-vnaslidok-vchorashnoi-raketnoi-ataky-na-lviv-zahynulo-10-liudei-shche-48-travmovani (Lviv City Council)]

[[Israel]] [[shell (projectile)|shells]] [[Lebanon]] in response to [[List of projectile attacks from Lebanon on Israel and the Golan Heights|rocket fire]] from the Lebanese side of [[Blue Line (border)|the border]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/6/israel-attacks-launch-site-in-lebanon-after-rockets-fired (Al Jazeera)]

The [[Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps Navy]] captures a commercial ship in the [[Persian Gulf]] involved in smuggling activity. [https://www.rferl.org/a/iran-oil-tankers-shots-fired-united-states-navy/32490465.html (RFE/RL)]

The [[United States]] announces an $800 million aid package for [[Ukraine]] that includes [[cluster munition]]s for the first time. While the weapons are outlawed by over 100 countries under the [[Convention on Cluster Munitions]], the United States, Ukraine, and Russia are not signatories. [https://edition.cnn.com/2023/07/07/politics/cluster-munitions/index.html (CNN)]

The U.S. package also includes [[M777 howitzer|M777 howitzers]], munitions for [[MIM-104 Patriot]] and [[M142 HIMARS]] missile systems, [[anti-tank weapons]], [[Unmanned aerial vehicle|UAVs]], and additional [[Bradley Fighting Vehicle]]s and [[Stryker]] [[armoured personnel carrier]]s. [https://www.reuters.com/world/us-cluster-munitions-ukraine-expected-fridays-800m-aid-package-2023-07-07/ (Reuters)]

Six [[Kenya Army|Kenyan soldiers]] and 23 [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] members are killed during a [[shootout]] in Orgene village, [[Mandera County]], [[Kenya]]. Eight other soldiers are injured. [https://www.voanews.com/a/kenya-special-forces-kill-23-al-shabab-militants-/7171526.html (VOA)]

[[Jihadism|Jihadists]] kill at least 22 [[civilian]]s in two separate attacks in [[Namentenga Province]], [[Burkina Faso]]. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/07/08/Suspected-extremists-kill-22-in-Burkina-Faso-Sources (AFP via Al Arabiya)]

Six [[Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh|Rohingya refugees]] are killed at the [[Kutupalong refugee camp|Kutupalong camp]] in [[Ukhia Upazila|Ukhia]], [[Cox's Bazar District|Cox's Bazar]], [[Bangladesh]], amidst clashes between rival [[Insurgency|insurgent groups]], the [[Arakan Rohingya Salvation Army]] and [[Rohingya Solidarity Organisation]]. [https://www.manilatimes.net/2023/07/09/world/six-killed-in-rohingya-camps-after-icc-prosecutors-visit/1899798 (AFP via ''The Manila Times'')]

[[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] shoot dead two [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine]] [[militant]]s during a raid at a house in [[Nablus]] in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-66132367 (BBC News)]
At least 22 people are killed by an [[airstrike]] in [[Omdurman]], [[Sudan]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/22-killed-air-strike-sudans-omdurman-health-ministry-2023-07-08/ (Reuters)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] shell [[Lyman, Ukraine|Lyman]] in [[Donetsk Oblast]], [[Ukraine]], killing eight people and injuring 13 others, according to [[Governor of Donetsk Oblast|governor]] [[Pavlo Kyrylenko]]. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-66142752 (BBC News)]
Four [[insurgent]]s and two officers are killed at a [[police station]] in [[Zahedan]], [[Sistan and Baluchestan province]], [[Iran]]. [https://www.iranintl.com/en/202307082943 (Iran International)]

The [[United States Central Command]] announces that a [[General Atomics MQ-9 Reaper|MQ-9 Reaper]] [[drone warfare|drone strike]] killed a senior [[Islamic State]] leader, Usamah al-Muhajir, in eastern [[Syria]] two days ago. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/us-central-command-says-they-killed-isis-leader-usamah-al-mahajir-eastern-syria-2023-07-09/ (Reuters)]

At least eight people are killed by two separate car bombings in northern Syria. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2023/07/10/Several-car-bombings-shake-northern-Syria-leave-eight-dead (AFP via Al Arabiya)]

The [[United States Department of Defense]] announces that ten [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] members were killed today by airstrikes near [[Afmadow]], [[Jubaland]], [[Somalia]]. [https://edition.cnn.com/2023/07/09/politics/somalia-al-shabaab-us-airstrikes/index.html (CNN)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] strike a residential area in [[Orikhiv]], [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]], killing seven [[civilian]]s and injuring 11 others, according to [[Governor of Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Governor]] Yuriy Malashko. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/four-civilians-killed-11-wounded-russia-strikes-zaporizhzhia-town-ukraine-2023-07-10/ (Reuters)]

Stanislav Rzhitsky, deputy chief in charge of military mobilization in the Russian city of [[Krasnodar]] and commander of the [[Russian Navy]] submarine [[Kilo-class submarine|B-265 ''Krasnodar'']], is shot dead near the city's sports complex. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/11/senior-russian-draft-officer-shot-dead-while-running-in-park (''The Guardian'')] [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-749527 (Reuters via ''The Jerusalem Post'')]

[[Russia]]n Lieutenant General [[Oleg Tsokov]] is reportedly killed by a missile strike near [[Berdiansk]], [[Zaporizhzhia Oblast]]. [https://edition.cnn.com/europe/live-news/russia-ukraine-war-news-07-11-23/h_1c3b305e5bc12343bd24e8fe6954bb74 (CNN)]

Suspected [[drug cartel]] members set off bombs targeting police officers in [[Tlajomulco de Zúñiga]], [[Jalisco]], [[Mexico]], killing six people (four officers and two civilians) and injuring 12 others. [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/explosives-attack-kills-three-mexican-security-officials-2023-07-12/ (Reuters)]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] strike a residential area in [[Zaporizhzhia]], injuring 18 [[civilian]]s, including six children. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-keeps-air-strikes-kyiv-nato-meets-2023-07-12/ (Reuters)]

An 81-year-old man is killed and his wife is injured due to Russian shelling in [[Kherson]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/13/russia-ukraine-war-at-a-glance-what-we-know-on-day-505-of-the-invasion (''The Guardian'')]

Three [[Hezbollah]] members are injured by [[Israel]]i strikes near the [[Blue Line (border)|Blue Line]] with the [[Israel Defense Forces]] accusing Hezbollah of attempting to destroy the [[border barrier]]. [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230712-israeli-fire-wounds-hezbollah-members-near-lebanon-israel-border-security-source (AFP via France 24)]

Nine [[Pakistan Army|soldiers]], five Tehreek-e-Jihad Pakistan gunmen, and a civilian passerby are killed in a [[shootout]] at a [[security checkpoint]] in [[Zhob]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. Five other soldiers are injured. [https://apnews.com/article/pakistan-militants-attack-security-forces-4609bc60ace91501d0567df370f3ab4f (AP)]
A [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] [[drone attack]] on [[Kyiv]] injures at least two [[civilian]]s and damages infrastructure. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-66184558 (BBC News)]

The [[United Nations]] reports the discovery of a [[mass grave]] in the area of [[Geneina]], [[West Darfur]], [[Sudan]], believed to contain at least 87 individuals, including women and children, reportedly killed by the [[Rapid Support Forces]] and an affiliated [[Sudanese Arabs|Arab]] militia. [https://apnews.com/article/west-darfur-mass-grave-sudan-un-0e6b29f58c2f80c4ecf9ff24cb869cdc (AP)]

Four people are killed in [[Jubaland]], [[Somalia]], after [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] is confirmed to have captured a [[military base]] in the area which had been handed to Somalia by the [[military of Kenya|Kenyan military]] on June 29. [https://english.news.cn/20230714/a17d9a6544934d42b1aa95b585c22ab8/c.html (Xinhua)]

Five people are killed and 19 more injured during an [[ambush]] by gunmen at a convoy in the [[Tillabéri Region]], [[Niger]]. Two attackers are killed in the ensuing [[shootout]]. [https://www.voanews.com/amp/killed-in-suspected-jihadi-attack-in-niger-/7182446.html (VOA)]

Ten people are killed and two others are injured as gunmen [[Mass shooting|open fire]] at a busy junction in [[Bamenda]], [[Northwest Region (Cameroon)| Northwest Region]], [[Cameroon]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/gunmen-kill-10-restive-northwest-cameroon-2023-07-17/ (Reuters)]

[[Transnistria]]n [[Pridnestrovie Communist Party|communist]] and opposition leader [[Oleg Khorzhan]] is [[Assassination|assassinated]] during a [[stabbing attack]] in his office. [https://www.newsweek.com/oleg-khorzhan-communist-party-leader-transnistria-dead-1813420?amp=1 (''Newsweek'')]

A couple are killed and their daughter is injured by [[explosion]]s at the [[Crimean Bridge]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/traffic-stopped-crimean-bridge-due-emergency-russian-backed-governor-2023-07-17/ (Reuters)] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/jul/17/russia-ukraine-war-live-crimean-bridge-emergency-traffic-stops-explosion (''The Guardian'')]

The agreement to allow safe passage of grain exports from [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] ports, in effect since July 2022, expires following [[Russia]]'s refusal to renew the deal. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/black-sea-grain-deal-expire-monday-if-russia-quits-2023-07-17/ (Reuters)]

Three children are killed and two others are injured when a [[mortar (weapon)|mortar]] [[warhead]] explodes in [[Dara-i Sufi Payin District]], [[Samangan Province]], [[Afghanistan]]. [https://www.khaama.com/mine-explosion-kills-3-injures-2-in-afghanistans-samangan/ (Khaama Press)]

The [[Russia]]n [[Federal Assembly (Russia)|Federal Assembly]] amends its [[mobilization]] laws, raising the age limits for [[Conscription in Russia|conscription]] to 70 years old from 65 for the [[Army ranks and insignia of the Russian Federation|highest-ranking officers]] of the [[Russian Armed Forces|armed forces]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-extends-eligibility-military-call-up-by-least-five-years-2023-07-18/ (Reuters)]

At least 12 people are injured in a night-time [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] missile attack on [[Odesa]], [[Ukraine]]. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/russia-launches-intense-night-attacks-ukraine-targeting-southern-101472010 (AP via ABC News)]

A fire occurs at the [[military training]] grounds in [[Crimea]], forcing the [[emergency evacuation|evacuation]] of more than 2,000 people and the closure of a nearby highway. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/fire-military-base-crimea-major-highway-closed-russia-backed-governor-2023-07-19/ (Reuters)]

The [[United States]] announces a $1.3 billion military aid package to Ukraine. The package includes four [[NASAMS]] air defense systems, [[anti-tank missile]]s, [[Phoenix Ghost]] and [[AeroVironment Switchblade|Switchblade]] [[Unmanned aerial vehicle|attack drones]], and [[Demining|landmine clearing]] equipment, among others. [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/07/19/world/europe/us-ukraine-aid-military-pentagon.html (''The New York Times'')]

Nine people are killed and 16 others are injured during the explosion of a bomb in a [[Field (agriculture)|field]] in [[Rutshuru Territory]], [[North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/20/nine-dead-16-wounded-in-bomb-blast-in-eastern-dr-congo (Al Jazeera)]

Police in [[Bangalore]], [[India]], arrest five men suspected of [[List of thwarted Islamic terrorist attacks|planning a terrorist attack]] in the city. [https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/major-terror-plot-averted-in-bengaluru-5-suspects-arrested/articleshow/101915727.cms (''The Times of India'')]

At least three people are killed and eight [[civilian]]s are injured in a [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian]] strike on [[Odesa]], [[Ukraine]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-warns-ships-black-sea-ukraine-create-temporary-grains-export-route-2023-07-19/ (Reuters)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/least-nine-wounded-russian-strike-mykolaiv-governor-2023-07-20/ (Reuters 2)]

The [[List of diplomatic missions of China|consulate general]] of [[People's Republic of China|China]] in Odesa suffers minor damage during the Russian strike. [https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinese-consular-building-damaged-russian-attack-ukraines-odesa-governor-2023-07-20/ (Reuters)]

Russian forces strike [[Mykolaiv]], Ukraine, injuring at least 19 civilians. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/least-nine-wounded-russian-strike-mykolaiv-governor-2023-07-20/ (Reuters)] [https://kyivindependent.com/update-18-injured-in-russian-strike-against-mykolaiv-oblast/ (''The Kyiv Independent'')]

The [[International Atomic Energy Agency]] reports that it is still awaiting access to the rooftops of Ukraine's [[Russian occupation of Zaporizhzhia Oblast|Russian-occupied]] [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]] in [[Enerhodar]], despite being permitted to view the [[Spent fuel pool|fuel cooling pools]] amid allegations of the plant's usage as an [[Nuclear strategy|atomic bargaining chip]]. [https://www.manilatimes.net/2023/07/22/world/americas-emea/iaea-cant-access-nuclear-plant-roof/1901675 (AFP via ''The Manila Times'')]

Two policemen are killed and two more injured during a shooting by [[Pakistani Taliban]] gunmen at a checkpoint in [[Peshawar]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://www.geo.tv/latest/500480-4-terror-attacks-in-48-hours-rock-kp (Geo TV)]

Two Pakistani Taliban members [[Suicide attack|blow themselves up]] at a police station and government station in [[Bara, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa|Bara]], Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, killing four police officers and wounding eleven more. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/pakistani-taliban-kill-2-policemen-wound-2-gun-101511338 (ABC News)]

The [[Russian Armed Forces]] strike grain warehouses in [[Odesa]] with [[Kalibr (missile family)|Kalibr]] missiles, destroying 120 tons of crops and injuring two [[civilian]]s, according to [[Governor of Odesa Oblast|Governor]] Oleh Kiper. [https://edition.cnn.com/europe/live-news/russia-ukraine-war-news-07-21-23/h_04abd2251c74e48f41adc2c87542803b (CNN)]

The Russian Armed Forces strike a building in [[Mykolaiv]], killing two civilians. [https://www.yenisafak.com/en/news/at-least-four-killed-27-injured-in-russian-strikes-in-odesa-mykolaiv-says-ukraine-3667174 (''Yeni Şafak'')]

Fifteen civilians and 19 army officers are killed in a [[drone attack]] in [[Khartoum]], [[Sudan]]. [https://globeecho.com/news/deaths-in-a-raid-near-khartoum-and-the-release-of-prisoners-from-the-army/ (Globe Echo)]

At least 20 civilians are killed and more than 45 others are injured by [[Rocket artillery|rocket attacks]] on residential areas in [[Nyala, Sudan|Nyala]], [[South Darfur]], and [[Shell (projectile)|shelling]] in proximity to [[Health in Sudan|hospitals]] in [[El-Obeid]], [[North Kordofan]], as per reports from medical professionals and lawyers. [https://www.arabnews.com/node/2342766/amp (AFP via ''Arab News'')]

A [[World Food Programme]] employee is killed by unknown assailants in [[Taiz Governorate|Taiz]], [[Yemen]], with [[Republic of Yemen Armed Forces|security forces]] launching a pursuit of the individuals responsible. [https://mb.com.ph/2023/7/22/un-food-agency-worker-killed-in-south-yemen (AFP via ''Manila Bulletin'')]

Ukraine strikes an ammunition depot in occupied [[Crimea]], leading to the evacuation of houses within a {{convert|5|km|mi|adj=on}} radius. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-war-shelling-civilians-killed-donetsk-7954cc6c8f2ce4e3fc94c05bba19d96c (AP)]

A nighttime Russian missile attack on [[Odesa]] kills at least one person, injures 22 others, and severely damages the [[Transfiguration Cathedral in Odesa|Transfiguration Cathedral]]. [https://apnews.com/article/odesa-missile-grain-deal-ukraine-russia-adc78b45e74e0236125b1ec706e5d7da (AP)]

The [[International Atomic Energy Agency]] finds [[anti-personnel mine]]s at the Russian-occupied [[Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant]], but notes that any detonation "should not affect the site's nuclear safety and security systems". [https://www.barrons.com/news/mines-found-at-ukraine-s-zaporizhzhia-nuclear-plant-un-watchdog-9ad63a7d (AFP via ''Barron's'')] [https://www.iaea.org/newscenter/pressreleases/update-175-iaea-director-general-statement-on-situation-in-ukraine (IAEA)]

At least four road patrol policemen are killed in an [[ambush]] in [[Zahedan]], [[Sistan and Baluchestan province]], [[Iran]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/least-four-dead-attack-irans-zahedan-tasnim-2023-07-23/ (Reuters)]

A child is killed and six people are wounded in a Russian missile strike on [[Kostiantynivka]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/25/russia-ukraine-war-at-a-glance-what-we-know-on-day-517-of-the-invasion (''The Guardian'')]

Dylan Collins, a journalist for [[Agence France-Presse]], is wounded in [[Bakhmut]] by a Russian [[drone attack]]. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/25/russia-ukraine-war-at-a-glance-what-we-know-on-day-517-of-the-invasion (''The Guardian'')]

[[Russian Armed Forces|Russian forces]] attack [[Odesa Oblast]] with [[Unmanned combat aerial vehicle|drones]], destroying grain warehouses at the [[Reni Commercial Seaport]] and injuring seven [[civilian]]s. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/russia-attack-odesa-destroys-grains-depot-injures-four-ukraine-military-2023-07-24/ (Reuters)]

Two [[Unmanned aerial vehicle|drones]] damage buildings in [[Moscow]], including one near the [[Main Building of the Ministry of Defense (Russia)|Defence Ministry headquarters]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/drone-fragments-found-near-russias-defence-ministry-building-central-moscow-2023-07-24/ (Reuters)]

An [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] blows himself up at a [[military academy]] in [[Mogadishu]], [[Somalia]], killing over 20 [[Somali Armed Forces|soldiers]] and injuring dozens more. [https://www.dw.com/en/somalia-al-shabab-islamist-kills-dozens-in-attack-on-army/a-66333884 (DW)]

Large clashes with [[air raids]] and [[artillery]] in the Ombada district in northern [[Khartoum]] leave over 16 people dead, including 2 confirmed children. [https://globeecho.com/news/africa/sudan-air-raids-and-artillery-fire-in-khartoum-at-least-16-civilians-killed/ (Globe Echo)]

The [[Sudanese Armed Forces]] shells three [[Rapid Support Forces|RSF]]-held neighbourhoods in [[Omdurman]], [[Khartoum (state)|Khartoum State]], [[Sudan]], killing at least 18 people and injuring dozens more. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/25/sudan-city-omdurman-attack (''The Guardian'')]

The [[United States Central Command]] says that a [[Russian Armed Forces|Russian military]] jet damaged an [[General Atomics MQ-9 Reaper|MQ-9 Reaper]] drone in [[Syria]]n airspace on July 23, by ejecting [[flare (countermeasure)|flares]] while flying "dangerously close" to the U.S. aircraft. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-66306030 (BBC News)]

Three [[Hamas]] members are killed by [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] in the [[Nablus]] neighborhood of al-Tur, in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://apnews.com/article/palestinian-militants-israel-army-west-bank-attack-raid-893c2f08314f08a2116b4a1751ce7850 (AP)]

The United States announces a $400 million military aid package to Ukraine. The package includes various anti-tank and air defense missiles, 32 [[Stryker]] armored fighting vehicles, [[Hydra 70]] rockets, and [[Black Hornet Nano]] surveillance [[Unmanned aerial vehicle|drones]], among other equipment. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/jul/25/russia-ukraine-war-live-moscow-drone-strike-kyiv-un-mines-zaporizhzhia-plant?page=with:block-64c022648f082e4442451f69#block-64c022648f082e4442451f69 (''The Guardian'')]

[[Niger Armed Forces|Soldiers]] from [[Niger]]'s presidential guard are reportedly holding [[President of Niger|President]] [[Mohamed Bazoum]] inside the presidential palace in [[Niamey]]. Entrances to [[government of Niger|government]] ministries have also been blocked by the guard in a possible [[coup]] attempt. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/26/soldiers-holding-niger-president-inside-palace-security-sources (Al Jazeera English)]
